Carmen been in her business of raising pigs/hogs for 5 years, and she gets an income of 6,500 PHP per month. 

Carmen became a member of GDMPC in 2011. She is applying for a loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feed for her pigs. 

She hopes to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Simplicio

texts.en:
Simplicio is 59 years old and separated with two children. He lives in Kahayagan East, Aurora. For the past 13 years, Simplicio has operated a food vending business. Simplicio uses his motorcycle to deliver his food and earns a monthly income of 15,000 PHP. He joined GDMPC in 2011. 

Simplicio is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products to sell. He plans to use the profit from his loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
As a married parent of 7 children, Sharon works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Sharon is borrowing 20000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Sharon has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Hegenio

texts.en:
Hegenio is married with 4 children. He is 43 years old and lives in Lacapp, Acad, Aurora. He is operating a transportation service-based business to earn a living. He has been doing this for 6 years, and every month he earns about 4,000 PHP from this work. 

He has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. In 2009, Hegenio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. 

He hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Break Through Group

texts.en:
Aisha, who is in her early 40s, is single with three children who are still going to school. She has been selling clothes for two years now. She works from 6.00 am to 4.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Aisha's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use for buying more clothes to re-sell. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Aisha will share this loan with her loan group "BREAK THROUGH," which has a total of 19 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to re-sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is training ground for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. She has four children and has been doing farming work for four years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business.

Lilian stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Earning from agriculture!' Her biggest challenge is: 'Lack of funds to boost production.' The animal on the farm is named, 'Tetat'. Lilian was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Learned about Juhudi from a friend.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'How to invest in agriculture, through credit.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked, 'How will this loan benefit your family?,' Lilian replied, 'increased income from increased milk production.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Lilian owns the following: 'cow, poultry, bicycle, automobile,' but does not own 'pig, pump, motorcycle'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards, based on this loan. This borrower has in the household, 'mosquito net, TV,' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coconut wine to resell

loans.name: Kimberly

texts.en:
Kimberly is a merchant from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and commodities to the people in her locality. Her husband is a fisherman. 

Kimberly is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, dry goods  and toiletries, and materials for fishing like nets, hooks and buckets. With this, she will be able to able to improve her store as well as their fishing business. 

Kimberly dreams of expanding their ventures in order to generate more income necessary for the needs of the family and for the schooling of their four young children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, dry goods and toiletries, and materials for fishing like nets, hooks and buckets.

loans.name: Zaal

texts.en:
Zaal is 57 years old. He lives in the small village in Chiatura District with his wife and 2 children. Zaal requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were all rejected because of his low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have 25 beehives with bee colonies and 0.5 hectares of agricultural land. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Zaal requested loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frame of new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Zaal will purchase a minibus. After purchasing the minibus, he plans to buy and sell fruits and vegetables. He will buy fruits and vegetables from the wholesalers and resell them at a higher price. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and begin to sell fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Fran

texts.es:
Fran, de 26 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de su esposa Dalila, con quien tiene un hija: Jimena a la que cuidan en la casa de su cuñada hace medio año. 
Hace 6 años, emprendió la responsabilidad de afrontar los gastos económicos de su familia, es así que desde entonces cuidó de su hija y esposa. Durante la mañana se dedica a trabajar con el tractor para voltear la tierra de los demás agricultores de la zona. Pero con el tiempo pensó en abrir una tienda de comestibles, pues su cuñada se dedicaba a ese negocio y como viajó a la capital lo cerró, es ahí donde Fran piensa en abrir una tienda como la su familiar y poder mejorarla, le va muy bien en su negocio pues lo administra su esposa y es la única en su pueblo por lo que siempre tiene que adquirir alimentos en gran cantidad. Ahora desea llenas la tienda, pues en las fiestas navideñas y de fin de año vende todo el stock. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Cruz de espinas” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, en todo estos años de trabajo, obtuvo buenos resultados en su negocio y en su vida personal, por lo que se encuentra agradecido, por ello promete ser puntual con sus cuotas, además le agrada pertenecer a su asociación, pues se apoyan y son como una familia.
Fran, invertirá el dinero en la compra de sacos de arroz, azúcar, leche, huevo y demás productos no perecibles.
texts.en:
Fran, 26 years old, is a responsible man. He lives with his wife, Dalila, and their daughter, Jimena. For the last six months, they have taken care of Jimena in Fran's sister-in-law's house. Six years ago, Fran took on the responsibility of his family's finances, so in turn, his sister-in-law helps to care for his wife and daughter. 

In the mornings, Fran works on a tractor to turn up land for some farmers in his region. Over time, he planned to open a small food stand. His sister-in-law used to own one, but it closed when she moved to the capital. Fran decided to open another, similar to his sister-in-law's in order to improve it. This business has gone very well for him. His wife helps him to manage the store. It is the only one of its kind in their town, so they always need to acquire merchandise in bulk. Now, Fran wants to restock his store, since the Christmas and New Year's season depletes it. 

Fran belongs to the support group "Cruz de Espinas" (Cross of Thorns). This is his fourth loan with MFP. In all of these years of work, Fran has been very successful in his business and personal life, so he is very grateful and promises to be punctual with his repayments. Furthermore, Fran is grateful to belong to this group that supports him and has formed a kind of family. 

Fran will use this loan to buy bags of rice, sugar, milk, eggs, and other nonperishable items.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, sugar, milk, eggs, and other nonperishable items.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene, de 40 años, es una madre soltera. Vive desde hace 3 años en la casa que compró  junto a sus 2 hijos: Gabriela y Yovana. Ella posee 4 vacas de buena raza, “mis animales son mi mayor tesoro”, afirma, Todas las mañanas los cuida con mucho esmero, pues de ellas extrae un promedio de 36 litros diarios. Cuenta que si sus vacas se encuentran preñadas y tienen becerros machos o toros, los comercializa en la feria ganadera de la ciudad de Jauja, pues su mayor ingreso económico se centra en la producción de leche, ya que una las principales procesadoras en lata, compra diariamente la leche que producen las vacas de Marlene, por eso se siente feliz y desea mejorar sus ingresos. Ya comenzó por sembrar por si solo alfalfa de buena calidad para sus alimentación, ahora que se encuentran preñadas bajaron su producción por lo que piensa comprar una vaca de calidad más, con la que podrá continuar con la cantidad que produce y como ella dice si es posible, tener más litros de leche. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario  “las abejitas” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, agradece la oportunidad de progreso que le otorgaron, pues comenzará a mejorar su negocio con el préstamo que obtuvo.
Marlene, invertirá el dinero en la compra de una vaca lechera, ya que no quiere bajar su producción.
texts.en: Marlene, who is 40, is a single mother.  She has lived for the past three years in the house which she bought together with her 2 daughters, Gabriela and Yovana.  She owns 4 purebred cows and declares "my animals are my most prized possession".  She tends them with great care every morning since she obtains an average of 36 litres a day from them.  She says that if her cows become pregnant, she sells any male calves or bulls which they may have at the cattle market in the city of Jauja.  This is because most of her earnings come from milk production and one of the major producers of tinned goods buys the milk from Marlene's cows every day.  As a result, she feels happy and wants to increase her income.  She has already started to grow her own good quality alfalfa to eat and, now that her cows are pregnant and their production has fallen, she is thinking of buying an additional purebred cow so as to maintain the same level of production and produce more litres of milk, which she thinks is possible.  She belongs to the "las abejitas" (the beehives) solidarity group and this will be her second loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the opportunity to make progress which they given her, and so she will begin to use the loan to improve her business.  Marlene will invest money in the purchase of a dairy cow because she does not want to reduce her level of production.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es:
Zaida, de 37 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Arturo y sus 3 hijos: Erick, Jovani y Roly, a los que cuida en la casa que alquiló hace 20 años.  
El trabajo al que se dedica desde hace pocos años es la ganadería, posee 4 vacas lecheras a las que cuida con mucho esmero, pues depende mucho de ellas el ingreso que adquiera durante el día. El día comienza con el ordeño de las vacas, pero como los litros de leche no son suficientes Zaida, junto a su esposo recolectan la leche de los demás ganaderos, para poder vender en las principales productoras de queso del valle, por lo que después de la recolección se dirige a vender la leche con la camioneta que alquila, “al día vendo un promedio de mil litros de leche, el trabajo es arduo pero me gusta”, afirma. Paralelo a ese ingreso su esposo se dedica a la confección de zapatos, donde obtiene un dinero extra pues es el arte que aprendió desde niño.  Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “señoras del milenio” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, en todo estos años de trabajo, obtuvo buenos resultados en su negocio y en su vida personal, por lo que se encuentra agradecido, por ello promete ser puntual con sus cuotas, además le agrada pertenecer a su asociación, pues se apoyan y son como una familia.
Zaida, invertirá el dinero en la compra de comida balanceada para alimentar a sus animales.
texts.en:
Zaida is 37 and hardworking. She lives with her husband Arturo and their three children, Erick, Jovani, and Roly, in a house they have rented for 20 years. For the past few years, she has raised livestock and owns four milk cows that she carefully tends. Her daily income depends on her animals. She begins the day milking the cows. Since they don't yield enough milk, Zaida and her husband collect milk from the rest of the herd, and then Zaida uses her rented truck to deliver the milk to the main cheese makers in the valley. She says that she sells about 1000 liters of milk daily and that the work is hard but she likes it. Her husband adds earnings as a shoemaker, a profession he learned as a child. 

Zaida belongs to the communal bank “señoras del milenio” (Women of the Millennium), and this is its 15th loan cycle with MFP. She is thankful that her business and her personal life have been consistently successful. She promises to make her loan payments on time and is happy to belong to her communal bank because they support one another like family. Zaida will use the loan to buy nutritious feed for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy nutritious feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
15 son las mujeres que decidieron unirse para trabajar y salir adelante, y por medio de este trabajo ayudar a sus familias y darles todo lo que necesitan para seguir creciendo.
La Sra.  Mercedes es presidenta de este grupo,  tiene un Kiosco en el que invierte su crédito para ayudar a solventar los gastos de su familia. Ella quiere poder seguir creciendo para que el día de mañana tenga un buen negocio y siga dando buena calidad a sus clientes. Mercedes es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora con muchos deseos de superación y es por eso que lucha.
Ella con el crédito quiere poder comprar bebidas, golosinas, comestibles y demás, con lo que podrá seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
15 women decided to band together to work and move forward. Through their efforts, they help their families and give them everything they need to keep growing. 

Mercedes is the president of this group, she runs a kiosk, in which she invest her money to help cover the expenses of her family. She wants to continue growing her business so that, one day, she can have a great business and continue to offer excellent service to her customers. 

Mercedes is a hard-working, entrepreneurial individual who has high hopes for her future. For this reason, she continues to work so diligently. With this loan, she wants to buy drinks, snacks, edibles, and other things so she can continue to work.

loans.use: to buy drinks, snacks, edibles, and other things.

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
This is Joey, 41. He is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Irene, a housewife and mother to their children. Joey is working hard to continually provide income for their daily expenses.

Joey oversees operations of the family's jeepney transportation business. They have one jeepney which carries up to 16 passengers to their destinations within the community. Their regular passengers and customers are from the local community. Joey earns his income from the boundary (daily quota) the jeepney driver remits, a minimum of 1,000 PHP each day.

To help him continue his business operations, he requests a 15,000 PHP loan. He will use the loan to pay for the maintenance of his jeepney vehicle. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands the business.  

Joey dreams of having more jeepneys and hopes to have a good and peaceful life. He faithfully meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from his study of the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of his jeepney vehicle

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 25 years old and married with two children who are in school. She lives with her family in Nkubu county in Kenya. For the past four years, Dinah has been a farmer, producing maize, beans, potatoes, and bananas that she sells at her local market. She also runs a retail shop to provide an additional source of income. Dinah's major business challenges are diseases and theft.

Dinah is requesting a 40,000 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to venture into rearing pigs. She will use her loan to buy pigs to raise and sell to provide extra income that will uplift her living standards. Dinah will use the profit from her loan to pay school fees for her children. In the future, she aspires to open a wholesale shop. Dinah believes that Juhudi Kilimo will help her make her life better.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is married and mother of two dependents. She is 41 years old and lives in San Vicente, Tambulig. For the past two years, Margarita has owned and operated a motorcycle transport business. She established her business as a way of generating an extra 4,600 PHP income each month. Margarita is a new GDMPC member. 

Margarita is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan from GDMPC to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories. In the future, Margarita wants to purchase more motorcycles for her business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah is 29 years old and married to John. They have been blessed with three children of the following ages: 7, 4, and 3 years respectively.

Lydiah runs a beauty salon, and she has been in business for 12 years. Right now her monthly income from the business is KES 20,000.

She is borrowing a loan of KES 30,000, which she plans to use to purchase more equipment for the salon. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. This is Lydiah’s first loan.

Lydiah’s hopes and dreams are to ensure that her children have better living standards.

loans.use: to add more stock to her beauty salon.

loans.name: Thaaban

texts.en:
Thaaban is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and a father of two children. Thaaban is the only provider of the family. 

Thaaban owns a blacksmith business. He specializes in making doors and windows. He established his business in 1988 after he gained his knowledge in this field from his father. He built good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Thaaban is requesting a $3,000 loan to buy a generator for his work. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his children a good education and a promising career path in this field.

loans.use: to buy a generator for his business

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is 26 years old and married to Jacob. She runs a beauty salon and has been in the business for two years. Right now her monthly income from the business is KES 30,000.

Norah is borrowing a loan of KES 15,000, which she intends to use to add more equipment to her beauty salon. This is her first loan.

Norah’s hopes and dreams are to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to add more equipment to her salon.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a married mother of two young children. They live in Getafe, Bohol. She earns a living through her sari-sari, or variety store.

Lorena is asking for a loan to buy more stocks of bread, snack foods, candies, canned goods, noodles, cooking ingredients and other items for her shop. With these, she will be able to attract and sell more products to her customers and buyers.

In the future, Lorena hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money so that she can continue to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bread, snack foods, candies, canned goods, noodles, cooking ingredients and other items for her shop.

loans.name: Aroldo

texts.es: 3 Máquinas lavadoras de ropa y materias primas e insumos alimenticios como aceite, maíz, queso y carne, son los requerimientos por los cuales Aroldo hizo el anterior credikiva y en eso justamente lo invirtió. Con ello le fue muy bien y hoy busca nuevamente aumentar su capital de trabajo y por eso acude a un nuevo financiamiento con la Fundación ario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará 4 lavadoras más, porque su clientela continua en crecimiento, llegando muchas veces a no responder su demanda del servicio de alquiler de maquinarias. También invertirá la otra parte de su crédito, en materias primas e insumos,  con los cuales aumentará su producción de alimentos e incrementará también, sus otros ingresos por concepto de este negocio y ello resulta ser muy bueno para su grupo familiar, porque Aroldo continua ofreciendo cada vez mejores opciones de bienestar a los suyos.
texts.en: With his previous loan, Aroldo bought three washing machines, basic materials, and cooking ingredients such as oil, corn, cheese, and meat. That investment was very successful, and now he is requesting another loan from the Fundación Ario Santo Domino to increase his working capital. With this loan, Aroldo will buy four additional washing machines, because his clientele continues growing at such a rate that sometimes he is not able to respond to the demand for his machine rentals. Aroldo will invest another part of the loan in basic equipment and ingredients to help him increase his production of food items. This will help him to increase his earnings, which enables him to help his family and improve their well-being.

loans.use: to buy four washing machines, basic materials, and cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is 52 years old and lives in Cabgan, Tambulig with her husband and four children. She earns a living by selling fish while her husband catches them. She has been in this line of work for three years and earns PHP 6,000 a month. She joined GDMPC last year and is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to continue improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment, including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Wakorintho Group

texts.en:
Abreman, who is in his late thirties, is married with three children who are still going to school. He has been selling second-hand shoes for a year and a half and works every day from 9:00 in the morning through 10:30 at night. Abreman is able to make a fair monthly profit. He is a member of a loan group called "Wakorintho," comprised of 14 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loan.

Abreman is requesting a loan to buy more stock of shoes to resell. This will be his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. In the future, Abreman dreams of building his own house.

loans.use: to buy shoes to resell

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and has four children. Mouhammad is the only provider for the family. 

Mouhammad is a cowman and owns a small farm. He specializes in producing dairy products like cheese and milk. He established his business in 1995. He built a good experience in this field, and he is well known with an excellent reputation in the surrounding area.

Mouhammad is requesting a loan of $2,000 to buy a cow. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina, de 27 años, es una mujer emprendedora, amable y muy trabajadora, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad, todos viven en su casa propia junto a su cuñada y sus hijos.
El trabajo de Dina consiste en vender abarrotes y artículos de primera necesidad como cereales, arroz, pan, huevos, aceite, leche y gaseosas. Compra cada 3 días al por mayor en el mercado principal de la ciudad obteniendo sus productos a precios cómodos lo cual le ayuda a obtener algunos centavos adicionales como ganancia. Tiene su bodega instalada en su casa, trabaja en esta actividad desde hace 3 años y desde que empezó siempre ha trabajado sola. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da independencia para hacer otras actividades, lo que no le gusta es que siempre hay personas que quieren ir a solicitar algún producto a crédito y en la fecha establecida del pago, no lo hacen, por ese motivo prefiere vender ahora todo al contado. Espera hacer crecer aun más su negocio ya que se siente joven y espera poder seguir trabajando como lo hizo hasta ahora. Este es el préstamo número 2 con MFP, agradece a las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de contar con un capital de negocio, le gusta mucho trabajar con este grupo ya que hasta ahora se mostraron todos responsables y espera poder seguir trabajando con su asesor ya que se siente cómoda al igual que con la institución. 
Con el préstamo solicitado 800 soles, ella comprará productos de primera necesidad para tener en stock y algunos otros productos como verduras, huevos, leche y otros.
texts.en:
Dina is 27, enterprising, friendly, and hardworking. She is single and has two children, ages 8 and 2, who live with her and her sister-in-law and her children. Dina sells groceries and essential goods such as grains, rice, bread, eggs, oil, milk, and sodas. Every three days, she buys at wholesale in the city's main market at prices that allow her to make a few cents profit. 

She set up her store in her house three years ago and works alone. She enjoys that her business leaves her free to do other activities. It bothers her, though, that some customers buy on credit but don't pay on time; therefore, she prefers to sell for cash. She hopes to grow her business, since she feels young, and hopes to keep working as she has done in the past. 

This is her second loan cycle with MFP, and she thanks the people who have provided capital. She likes working with her communal bank because the members have shown themselves to be responsible. She expects to continue working with her consultant as she feels comfortable with that person and the institution. She will use the loan of 800 soles to buy essential goods for inventory and other items such as vegetables, eggs, and milk.

loans.use: to buy essential goods such as vegetables, eggs, and milk.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en: Irine is 27 years old and married to Joseph. They have been blessed with two kids. She is a farmer, and she has been in business for three years. Right now her monthly income is KES 20,000. She is borrowing a loan of KES 10,000, with which she intends to expand her farming business by purchasing some sheep. This is her first loan, and her dream is to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to improve her farming business

loans.name: Magsarjav

texts.en: Mr. Magsarjav is 29 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a small house in Orhon Province, Mongolia. His wife, Otgon-Erdene, age 24, studies at university for her masters and is now temporarily staying home taking care of their newborn baby daughter Enhsaran, 7 months. The borrower has been running his grocery store since 2010 on his plot of land. He is now requesting 2,500,000 MNT to purchase a fridge and other equipment and inventory to run his grocery store without temporarily stopping. He is a hardworking and optimistic person who says, "My wife has not yet graduated and I need to pay her tuition and also cover all my newborn daughter's expenses."

loans.use: to purchase a fridge and other equipment and inventory to run his grocery store without temporarily stopping

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 56 years old and married with seven children. She lives in Tinago, Ozamis City. For the past 11 years, Juliana has been selling prepared foods, tasty desserts, and refreshments from her food stall to earn a living. She earns 15,000 PHP each month and has been a member of GDMPC since 2010.

Juliana is requesting a 28,000 PHP loan to purchase the raw ingredients she needs to make her products. In the future, she hopes that her business will be more successful.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients she needs to make her products

loans.name: Adulfa

texts.en:
Adulfa is a 63-year-old married woman who has three adult children. She hails from Loon, Bohol. For the past 20 years, Adulfa has been selling fish. Her husband works as a carpenter. Adulfa does not depend on her children and so she and her husband work hard to provide for their livelihood.

Adulfa is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to purchase fishing equipment such as net, fish hooks, and nylon. In the future, she would to like invest in other ventures to have a sustainable livelihood in preparation for her old age.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment such as net, fish hooks, and nylon

loans.name: Harun

texts.en:
Harun is 34 years old and married to Ann. The couple has been blessed with two children who are one and three years old. For the past 10 years, Harun has been a photographer. He earns 50,000 KES each month.

Harun is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to purchase a printer. He will use his anticipated profit to repay his loan.

loans.use: to purchase a printer

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 24 years old and single. He runs a barbershop and he has been in business for one year. Right now, his monthly income from the business is KES 6,000.

Nelson is borrowing a loan of KES 10,000, which he intends to use to purchase a modern shaving machine for use in his barbershop. This is his first loan and his hope and dream is to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy a modern shaving machine for his barbershop.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: Beverly is 60 years old and married. She lives in Mailen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, where she has earned a living for the last five years by selling home and used products. She makes PHP 8,000 per month and is applying for a loan for PHP 17,500 to purchase additional products, like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. Beverly joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2011 as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for her business, like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married, and has six children. Ali is the only provider of the family.

Ali owns a small shop and sells beauty supplies, perfumes, and accessories. He established his business in 1992. He built a good experience in this field and he is well-known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation.

Ali is requesting a sum of USD 2,400 to pay the yearly rent of his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his children with good education and better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the yearly rent of his shop.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 34 años, es una mujer tímida. Vive en compañía de su esposo Mauricio y sus 3 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que heredó de su suegra desde hace 10 años. 
Gracias a los terrenos que heredó de su abuela, ella puede sembrar diversos productos agrícolas, pero su principal ingreso económico se centra en la ganadería, cría cerdos, ovejas y vacas, las cuales le brindan el dinero necesario para mantener la casa, pues como ella afirma, los ingresos son diarios. Su principal ganancia los obtiene de los cerdos, pues invierte poco en su alimentación y después de estar alimentados y maduros, los comercializa a bien precio. Desea aumentar la cantidad de su ganado pues ya tiene un pedido grande para algunos meses de varios ejemplares de cerdos para carne. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario  “las abejitas” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, agradece la oportunidad de progreso que le otorgaron, pues comenzará a mejorar su negocio con el préstamo que obtuvo.
María, invertirá el dinero en la compra de un cerdo macho para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
María, 34 years old, is a shy woman.  She lives in the company of her husband Mauricio and her three children whom she looks after in the home that she inherited from her mother-in-law 10 years ago.  

Thanks to the land that she inherited from her grandmother, she can plant various agriculture products but her main economic income centers on livestock, raising pigs, sheep and cows, which provide her the necessary money to maintain her home because, as she says, the income is daily.  She obtains her main profit from the pigs as she invests little in their food and after being fed and matured, she sells them at a good price.  She wants to increase the quantity of her livestock as she already has a big order for some months of several specimens of pigs for meat.  

She belongs to the communal bank “Las Abejitas” (Little Bees) and this is the second loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the opportunity to progress that they grant her as she will begin to improve her business with the loan that she obtained.

María will invest the money in the purchase of a male pig to increase her livestock.

loans.use: to buy a pig.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita, de 43 años es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, siempre va en busca de nuevas y mejores oportunidades y no se rinde hasta cumplir sus metas, tiene 4 hijos junto a su conviviente desde hace 25 años llamado Carlos, el último de sus hijos tiene tan solo 6 años y necesita de toda la protección atención y cuidado que solo le pueden ofrecer sus padres, todos viven en la casa propia que construyó gracias al esfuerzo de su cónyuge y al fruto de sus ahorros obtenidos en sus respectivos trabajos. Todos los días, Felicita, se despierta muy temprano para ir al mercado y comprar los ingredientes necesarios para preparar diversos potajes de la región como “juanes”, arroz chaufa  y diversas carnes asadas. Tiene su establecimiento en su propia casa en donde empieza a atender al caer la tarde. Sus ventas son muy buenas y sus ganancias siempre son rentables y satisfactorias. Tiene este negocio desde hace 3 años, trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo, anteriormente tenía una bodega pero no le daba los ingresos económicos necesarios por lo que optó por dedicarse a este negocio.
A pesar que le va muy bien siente que no es suficiente, por eso complementa su negocio diario vendiendo gaseosas y cervezas, afortunadamente también le esta yendo bien en esta actividad, pero las intensas lluvias han ocasionado que algunas veces no puede vender lo suficiente, ahora desea mejorar la infraestructura de su modesto restaurante y continuar en el camino al progreso. Este es el préstamo número 15 con la institución MFP, siempre se caracterizó dentro de su grupo por ser una persona responsable, está feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan para poder realizar una buena inversión, además está segura de que seguirá cancelando sus cuotas a tiempo como lo hizo hasta ahora, esta muy comprometida con el grupo al que pertenece y no desea dejar una mala impresión ni a ellos ni a la institución. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles comprará productos de primera necesidad, verduras y otros ingredientes que usa en la preparación de los alimentos que pone a la venta.
texts.en:
Felicita, 43, is enterprising, hardworking, always looking for new and better opportunities, and doesn't stop until she has achieved her goals. She and Carlos, her life partner of 25 years, have four children. The youngest is just six and needs the attention and care only parents can give. They live in the house her husband built with their savings.

Every day Felicita wakes very early to go to the market and buy ingredients to prepare different regional dishes such as juanes, fried rice and vegetables, and grilled meats. Her business is in her house, and she starts serving in the afternoon. Sales are excellent, and her profits are good.The business has been open for three years, and her husband helps her. Earlier, she had a store, but it didn't provide sufficient income, so she opted for this business. 

Though the business is prospering, she feels that it is not enough; therefore, she started serving sodas and beer, which has been a success. Heavy rains have occasionally reduced sales below what she needs to achieve, so she wants to upgrade her modest restaurant and continue to make progress.

The is her 15th loan cycle with MFP. Her communal bank members say she is always responsible. She is pleased to have the opportunity to make a new investment and is certain she will make her payments on time, as before. She is committed to her communal bank and does not want to leave a bad impression with the members nor with the institution. She will use the loan of 1500 soles to buy essential goods, vegetables, and other ingredients to prepare the foods she sells.

loans.use: to buy essential goods and vegetables.

loans.name: Victoria's Group

texts.en: Victoria leads a loan group made up of four hard-working women. She is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende in the Mubende region of Uganda with her husband and three children, one of whom currently attends school. For the past year, Victoria has been working hard at her small business, where she sells fresh food. To help expand her business, Victoria has requested a loan for 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use this loan to buy more fresh food to sell, including potatoes and bananas. This loan will help her earn more money and reach her goal for the future, which is to buy a plot of land. Victoria is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Mónica, de 22 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y alegre. Es conviviente con Juan quien se dedica al transporte, tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad. Vive en su casa propia que construyó en una parte del terreno que su madre le ha concedido.
La actividad que realiza Mónica es la venta de plátanos. Todos los días instala una mesa al costado de la bodega que tiene su madre en su casa, de esa manera oferta sus productos a los clientes de la bodega donde no se expende estos productos. En algunas ocasiones diversifica sus ventas con algunas verduras regionales como pepino, ajíes, limones u otros. Tiene más de 3 años realizando éste negocio y hasta el momento se dedica sola a atender sola a sus clientes de manera amable y cordial.

Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico y le permite tener una ocupación y sentirse una persona productiva. Considera a su negocio rentable ya que logra vender todos sus productos y obtiene ganancias razonables, por tanto desea incrementar su stocks  de mercaderías  así logrará hacer  crecer su negocio. Además tiene planes de comprarse otra unidad de transporte y alquilarlo, para generarse más ingresos económicos.
Este es el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además se siente a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus miembros y los considera personas responsable s y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en su negocio con la compra de mayor cantidad de racimos de plátanos y algunas verduras, buscando menores precios por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Mónica, 22 years old, is a hardworking and persevering woman. She is also very kind and happy. She makes a living selling plantains. Mónica lives with Juan, who makes a living in transportation, with whom she has two children who are 5 and 2 years old. Mónica lives in her own house that she built on some land that her mother gave her. 

Each day, Mónica sets up a table outside of her mother's store and sells plantains. Sometimes she sells other vegetables as well such as cucumbers, peppers, limes. Mónica has been working like this for three years. She works alone and is always very polite and kind with her customers. Mónica enjoys this work because it generates income and allows her to stay busy working, as well as gives her a sense of satisfaction and productivity.
She considers this a good business because she is always able to sell all of her products. In addition to this food stand, Mónica is planning to buy an automobile and rent it out in order to generate more income in the future.

This is Mónica's third loan through MFP. She enjoys working with this communal bank group because she knows each of the other members and considers them all to be very responsible and supportive. She hopes this loan will help her to reach her goals. Mónica is requesting a loan of 1000 Peruvian soles to invest buying plantains and other vegetables in larger quantities, in order to get them at lower prices.

loans.use: to buy a bigger quantity of plantain bunches and vegetables at lower prices.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. He has no children and has been doing this work for 3 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Just being on the farm and watching animals running around!" His biggest challenge is "drought, which affects crop production and makes feed unaffordable." Animals on the farm have been given the names "white headed and brown."

Anthony was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied that he heard about Juhudi from a nearby group. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, "About proper loan use and farming as a business." He will use the loan to buy poultry birds.

His highest monthly expense is business related. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?", Anthony replied that he will be able to educate his children, and he has also increased his assets.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Anthony owns the following: a cow, poultry, and a bicycle. But he does not own a pig, pump, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or DVDs.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 29 years.
Delia has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell. In the future, Delia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 51, is a farmer in Nkubu county in Kenya, where she lives with her three children, who are all adults and through with school. She is a widow and has been farming for twenty years, producing milk, french beans, potatoes, maize and wheat, which she sells at the local market.
She is requesting a 60,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase water tanks and water pipes for irrigation, which will help her water her crop even when there is little rainfall and yield more crops, to generate more food for the family and income to improve her living standards. She aspires to buy a vehicle to help her transport her produce, in the next five years. 
Poor road networks and lack of security are her major challenges in farming.
Mary says Juhudi Kilimo is the best microfinance institution for farmers.

loans.use: to purchase water tanks and pipes for irrigation.

loans.name: Mtaji Wa Masikini Group

texts.en:
Joseph, who is in his early 50s, is married, with two children, one is a grown-up and one is still at school. He has been selling meat for fifteen years now. He works from 9.00 am to 9.00 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Joseph's 13th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy land, has built his small house, bought furniture, a radio, and a television set, paid school fees, recovered household expenses, and has successfully paid back all his loans. 

Joseph wants a loan to buy more stock of meat.  His dream is to one day be able to go up-country and buy things, like rice.

Joseph will share this loan with his loan group "Mtaji Wa Masikini Group," with ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more meat for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Elvia

texts.en:
Elvia is 63 years old and married, with seven children. Elvia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks to sell, like spices, snack foods, eggs, and noodles.

Elvia has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Elvia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell, like spices, snack foods, eggs, and noodles.

loans.name: Jemuel

texts.en: Jemuel's main source of income comes from his coconut/banana production business. He is 41 years old and single but has 3 children. He is from Campo 1, Aurora, and has been in farming for 3 years, earning 8,200 PHP a month. In 2011, Jemuel joined GDMPC. Jemuel is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to buy farm chemicals. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy farm chemicals

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 26 years old, married, and has one child. Haydar is the only provider for the family.
Haydar owns a shop to sell women’s outfits. He established his business in 2005. He has acquired good experience in this field, and he is well known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation.
He is requesting a youth loan of $1,800 to pay the yearly rent on his shop. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the yearly rent on his shop.

loans.name: Anaam

texts.en:
Anaam is from Iraq. She is 51 years old, married, and has four children. Anaam and two of her children provide for the family.
Anaam is a hairdresser and works in her own house. She started her business in 2008. She has acquired a good experience in this field, and she is well known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation.
Anaam is requesting a loan of $3,000 to renovate her workplace. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so she will be able to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six, Divina works hard to support her family. She has an upholstery business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from food vending. Divina is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy more materials for her upholstery business.
Divina has sustained her business activities with her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her upholstery business.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El señor Jorge  es mecánico y su nivel de educación es técnico medio, tiene cuatro hijos vive en casa propia ocupando 4 habitaciones en un acabado le ladrillo y piso de machimbre (tablones de madera clavados sobre vigas de madera) en la zona de Bajo Sopocachi de la ciudad de la Paz.

Jorge trabaja como mecánico  más de 12 horas al día, para cubrir los gastos de agua, luz, educación de sus hijos y además de su alquiler de su taller.

El crédito lo requiere para la construcción de tabiques (separadores de habitaciones y son de ladrillo) en un primer piso de su vivienda para mejorar su calidad de vida.

El sueño de Jorge es terminar de construir su vivienda y así ofrecer una mejor  calidad de vida a sus hijos.

Es la primera vez con IMPRO y la primera con Kiva.
texts.en:
Jorge is a mechanic and his level of education mid-technical.  He has four children and lives in a four-bedroom brick and ‘machimbre’ (wood slats nailed onto wood beams) floor house located in the city of La Paz’s Bajo Sopocachi zone.

Jorge works as a mechanic for more than 12 hours daily to cover water, electricity and his children’s education costs as well as his shop’s rent.

He needs the loan to build partition walls (to separate bedrooms and they are made of bricks) on the ground floor of his house to improve quality of life.

Jorge’s dream is to finish building his house to provide better quality of life for his children.   This is his first time with IMPRO and with KIVA.

loans.use: to build partition walls on the ground floor of his house.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 30 years old and married with two children who are the following ages: four and two years old. She runs a retail shop, and she has been in business for two years, and right now her monthly income is KES 5,000. 

She is borrowing a loan of KES 20,000, which she intends to use to stock her shop. She plans to plough back the anticipated profit into the business.

loans.use: to stock her shop

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 34 years old, married and the mother of one child. For the last two years, she has earned a living as a dairy farmer and now earns KES 10,000 a month. She is requesting a loan for KES 12,000 to improve her business by buying animal feed. She will use the additional income she earns to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Tsoghik

texts.en: Tsoghik is from Jrapi village in Shirak region of Armenia. She is a 46-year-old mother of two children. Together with her husband, Tsoghik is involved in cattle breeding. They keep livestock, which currently includes three cows, four mother pigs, 70 chickens, and six turkeys. Cattle breeding is the only source of income for Tsoghik's family, and it helps them to earn a monthly income. Unfortunately that income is enough only for covering the family's basic needs, and it is very difficult for Tsoghik to cover some operational costs. Tsoghik has requested this loan to pay for forage for feeding the livestock. The loan is very important for Tsoghik to earn a higher income and cover her family's basic expenses.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en: Ma. Luisa is 49 years old, married and the mother of four children. She earns a living by raising chickens in the Philippines, and is requesting a loan for PHP 18,000 from NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her flock. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns additional income by selling fish. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business so that she can secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a 64-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 26 years to 37 years. She describes herself to be a visionary woman. She operates a farm where she sells farm produce. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located at a very productive area and her primary customers are market retailers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the poor road network. She will use the Kes 41,500 loan to buy a water tank that will be used by her family members. Her business goal is to expand her farming business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have expanded her business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Trabajadoras” se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, con 15 integrantes, de la zona de Asunción; quienes son todas amigas y vecinas de esa zona.
Paola, quien es parte de este grupo vende helados. Ella esta creciendo con su negocio ya que es gracias a este que esta pudiendo salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Comenta que trabaja desde muy tempranas horas ya que va a comprar el helado. Su clientela ha ido creciendo ya que siempre tiene muy buen producto.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de helados de todos los sabores, para tener una gran variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes y así seguir creciendo como profesional.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (Working Women) committee is in its fourth cycle in Fundación Paraguaya’s Enterprising Women’s Program.  It has 15 members from the Asunción area who are all friends and neighbors in the zone.

Paola, who is part of this group, sells frozen treats.  She’s growing with her business because thanks to it she’s being able to get ahead and help her family.  She comments that she starts work very early because she goes to buy the frozen treats.  Her clientele has been growing because she always has good products.

She’s requesting this loan to buy frozen treats in assorted flavors to have a wide variety on hand to offer her customers thus continuing to grow as a professional.

loans.use: to buy frozen treats to sell.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is 33 years old. She is a woman who is very dedicated to her home. She owns her own business, selling charcoal to the neighborhood  and thanks to that, she has everything she needs to live. She lives with her husband and their son in a house they rent which has both piped water and electricity. 

The business is in her house. She is asking for a loan to stock up her store even more and to buy a larger quantity of sacks of charcoal so she can serve her customers better and improve her sales to get her family ahead. She also wants to become an example for other people due to her great wish to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ma. Luz requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like snack foods, eggs, spices, soft drinks, etc.

Ma. Luz has been in this business for 30 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like snack foods, eggs, spices, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 33 year old, married, and has five children. She lives in Talibon, Bohol and earns a living from her sari-sari (general) store.

Sarah is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy additional merchandise to sell, such as rice, sardines, seasonings, noodles, soap, shampoo, soda, and beverages. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business and augment her income.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as rice, sardines, seasonings, noodles, soap, shampoo, soda, and beverages.

loans.name: Viktor

texts.en:
Viktor is from Verishen village. He is 37 years old, and lives with his parents, wife and three children. 
 
Viktor is involved in agriculture. He keeps 20 cows, and also has agricultural land where he cultivates potatoes and haricots. Viktor's wife uses the milk in cheese production, and Viktor sells it in the local markets. This is the only source of income for this big family, and it is very difficult for Viktor to cover even the basic daily needs of the family. 

Viktor has applied for this loan to purchase three more cows, which will enable him to get more milk, and will increase his monthly income.

This loan is very important for Viktor to get a higher income and ensure a better life for his children.

loans.use: to buy three cows for his cheese production business.

loans.name: Ergash

texts.ru:
Эргаш - житель Яванского района. Ему 59 лет. Он женат, имеет 5 детей. Его сыновья находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации и только один его сын вместе с ним занимается животноводством. 
Эргаш уже год как занимается купле - продажей крупнорогатого скота. Он берет кредит для закупа бычков с целью увеличения поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Ergash lives in the Yavan Region. He is 59 years old. He is married and has five children. His sons are migrant workers in the Russian Federation, and only one of his sons is engaged in animal husbandry together with him.

For about a year, Ergash has been buying and reselling cattle. He is taking out a loan in order to buy bulls and increase his livestock.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocío, de 30 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y cordial. Está separada del padre de sus hijos. Habita su propia casa, en compañía de sus dos hijos de 8 y 6 años de edad.
La actividad que realiza Rocío es la venta de periódicos, se levanta muy temprano en las madrugadas y se dirige a la imprenta donde compra sus periódicos, todo lo obtenido lo vende de forma ambulatoria por las calles de la ciudad. Atiende sus clientes de manera amable y cordial por lo que ha logrado ganarse su preferencia. Tiene 9 años dedicándose a este negocio  y hasta el momento lo realiza sola. Le gusta su oficio pues le genera un ingreso económico que le sirve para mantener su hogar. Aprendió todo lo necesario de su madre, quien también se dedica a cumplir esta labor. Considera que su trabajo es bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja, desea continuar con su negocio y continuar ahorrando para incursionar en la venta de perfumes y productos de belleza. Este es el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, por tanto agradece a todos los que le permiten acceder a su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se siente a gusto con su banco comunal pues considera que es un grupo unido y solidario.
El monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de periódicos de distintas casas de imprenta, de esa manera desea tener una mayor variedad disponible para la venta.
texts.en:
Rocío, 30 years old, is a hardworking and persevering woman who is also very polite and happy. She is separated from the father of her children. She lives in her own house with her 8 and 6-year-old children. 

Rocío makes a living selling newspapers. She gets up at dawn and purchases newspapers from printing houses, then walks around the city streets selling them. She is very kind and polite with her customers, so she has earned some loyal customers. Rocío has worked in this business by herself for nine years. She enjoys this work because it is a good way to earn money and it helps her to pay her household expenses. Rocío's mother taught her how to succeed in this work, since she made a living the same way. Rocío considers this a good business because she makes good profits. She hopes to continue in this work and keep saving money to one day begin to sell perfumes and beauty products.

This is Rocío's fourth loan with MFP. She is very grateful to everyone who has helped to make this loan possible so that she can work toward her goals. On the other hand, she is also glad to be a part of this united and supportive group. She is requesting a loan of 1000 Peruvian soles to invest in buying newspapers from various printing houses so that she will be able to offer a wider variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy newspapers from different printing houses so she can offer a wider variety to her customers.

loans.name: Lesly

texts.es:
Lesly, de 31 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy responsable, es conviviente con su pareja Jonás de 37 años y con quien tiene dos menores hijos de 12 y de 3 años, ella vive a lado de su familia en la casa de sus suegros y es ahí donde a diario brinda lo mejor a su familia ya que desea darles una mejor calidad de vida.
Lesly es una mujer que disfruta del trabajo, no le gusta estar inactiva es por eso que no desmaya cuanto de realizar alguna labor se trata. Su fuente de ingreso principal consiste en el alquiler de mototaxi, tiene un vehículo de segundo uso que compró hace 1 año el cual lo alquila diariamente a un familiar a cambio de recibir un pago fijo establecido como requisito. Complementa esta labor trabajando como secretaria por las mañanas en un aserradero de la localidad. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de verduras en un mercado muy concurrido pero dejó de realizar esta labor por motivos de salud.
Todo lo que realiza le gusta mucho y no duda en poner su mayor esfuerzo para trabajar cada día con mucho optimismo, su gran deseo ahora es comprar otro mototaxi alquilarlo y complementar así su principal fuente de ingresos. Este es el crédito numero 3 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos y crecimiento programado, además está muy decidida a cumplir con sus pagos como lo hizo hasta ahora en sus créditos anteriores, le agrada mucho pertenecer al grupo del que forma parte ya que todos sus integrantes son muy puntuales y responsables.
El monto solicitado 1500 soles lo invertirá en la compra de llantas y algunos repuestos para refaccionar su vehículo de trabajo.
texts.en:
31-year old Lesly is an enterprising and very responsible woman. She lives with her partner, 37-year old Jonás, with whom she has two children aged 12 and 3. She lives with her family in the home of her in-laws where every day she does the best she can as she wishes to provide her family with a better standard of living.

Lesly is someone who enjoys work; she doesn’t like to sit around so she doesn’t get disheartened when she has to work hard. Her principal source of income is from renting out a vehicle. She has a secondhand mototaxi which she bought a year ago and rents out to a relative in return for a fixed amount of money. 

As well, Lesly works as a secretary in the mornings at a local sawmill. Before that she sold vegetables in a busy market but stopped doing that because of health problems.

Everything she does she enjoys and puts in a huge effort to her work every day. She is always optimistic. Her greatest wish now is to buy another mototaxi to rent out and supplement her main source of income. 

This is her third loan with MFP, and and by working with this institution she expects to continue with the goals and growth that have already been planned. Lesly is determined to make the repayments as she has done up to now with the previous loans. She is pleased to be a member of her group since everyone is a punctual and responsible person.

The 1500 soles she is asking for will be used to buy tires and other spares for her mototaxi.

loans.use: to buy tires and spares for the mototaxi she rents out

loans.name: Nieve Mariana

texts.es: Nieve vive en orquídeas. Tiene 45 años. Es casada tiene dos  hijos de 17 y 18 años. Ella toma  la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguir  adelante  seguir con los estudios de sus hijos. Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. Ella decide juntar dinero para dar apertura  a su negocio de  venta de ropa  en general  En la actualidad su ventas poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  clientela  necesaria. ella  trabaja diariamente sola . Nieve trabaja desde la mañana  .Con el préstamo  ella comprara  una vivienda  para mejorar su negocio, varios, etc. su meta es tener su local propio para poner su negocio.
texts.en: Nieve, 45, lives in Orquídeas.  She’s married and has two children who are 17 and 18 years old.  She decided to find work to continue forward with her children’s education.  Since no one gave her the opportunity to work for a firm, she decided to gather money to open a business selling clothes in general.  Her sales gradually increased until she had the necessary clientele.  She works every day by herself.  Nieve works starting in the morning.  She will use the loan to buy a house to improve her business and others.  Her goal is to have her own locale in which to put her business.

loans.use: to buy a house.

loans.name: Nelcy  Esther

texts.es: Corte, tinturado y peinado de cabellos, son los principales productos que ofrece en su salón de belleza, Nelcy una joven de 27 años, que inició este negocio empíricamente y posteriormente  fue a la academia, para perfeccionar su aprendizaje y aumentar su oferta. Hace 8 meses, cuando ella inició su emprendimiento, ha logrado  sacarlo adelante con mucho entusiasmo, pues con ese negocio,  genera ingresos para apoyar el bienestar de su hogar y aumentar su clientela. Ella  tiene muchos sueños de prosperidad y el gran desafío de que su capital de trabajo, sea suficiente para cumplir la meta  de crecimiento que se ha propuesto. Por eso acude a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para acceder a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a  esta organización, mediante la cual comprará una lava cabezas, una silla y un tocado de peluquería. Con ello dará un mayor confort a la estadía de su clientela en su espacio productivo y continuará cautivando su compra de servicios. Ella abre las puertas de su negocio de lunes a domingos y en horarios de 9 de la mañana a 9 de la noche y con todo este esfuerzo lo que está consiguiendo es posicionarse en el mercado de sus clientes, que lo conforman amas de casa, empleadas, jóvenes  y en general adultos, que también llevan a sus niños, para que sean atendidos con el delicado toque que  da a su imagen las manos de Nelsy.
texts.en:
The main services Nelcy, 27, offers in her beauty salon are haircuts, hair coloring and hair styling.  She started the business empirically and later attended an academy to perfect her skills and increase her offer.  She started 8 months ago and has succeeded in moving it ahead with much enthusiasm because she’s able to generate income from this business for her home’s well-being and to increase her clientele.

She has many dreams of prosperity and her great challenge is that her working capital is sufficient to reach the growth goals she’s set.  Because of this, she’s calling on Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to request a Kiva loan, her first financing with this institution that she’ll use to buy a hair washing sink, a chair and a salon station.  With this, she’ll provide more comfort for her customers while they are in her salon and will continue to capture their patronage.

She opens for business Monday to Sunday from 9 in the morning to 9 at night and with all this effort is managing to position herself in the marketplace; her customers are mainly housewives, employees, young adults and adults in general who also bring their children to be cared for with the delicate touch Nelcy’s hands produce in their personal appearance.

loans.use: to buy a hair washing sink, a chair and a barber shop station.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
El Señor Marcos tiene 34 años de edad, es un señor muy trabajador, está acompañado con Sandra, tienen 2 hijos, viven en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo desde hace 15 años. El Señor Marcos tiene una Tornería y empezó con una pequeña tornería que le dejo su padre y luego se fue aumentando sus herramientas y maquinarias con los prestamos que hizo de la Fundacion Paraguaya y  con sus ganancias y sumado a esto su gran esfuerzo y desafío.
Comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado porque solo él  trabaja en la familia. Su sueño es comprar un tono más chico para hacer otro tipo de trabajos y así progresar cada día más.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de herramientas varias, taladros, esmeril, llaves, etc. que le permitirá seguir invirtiendo en su único trabajo y fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
Marcos is 34 years and very hard-working.  He has a partner, Sandra, and they have two children.  They have been living in the city of Coronel Oviedo for 15 years.  Marcas has a turnery.  He was left a small turnery by his father and later the turnery grew, with more tools and machinery, thanks to the loans from Fundación Paraguaya, his profits and Marcos' big effort and defiance.  He says his job is very demanding because he is the only one in the family who works.  His dream is to buy a smaller lathe in order to do other types of work and so progress every day.

He is applying for this loan to invest it in various tools such as drills, emery, spanners and so on.  This loan will let him invest in his only work and only source of income.

loans.use: to buy various tools such as drills, emery, spanners and so on.

loans.name: Luis Mauricio

texts.es: Luis vive en las orquídeas. Tiene 27 años. Tiene una unión libre y no tiene hijos. El tomo  la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguir  adelante. Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. El  decide juntar dinero para dar apertura  a su negocio que es una panadería  En la actualidad sus  ventas poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  clientela  necesaria. el  trabaja diariamente solo desde las 6:30 am hasta 10pm y de 14pm hasta 17pm. Luis  trabaja  desde la mañana  .Con el préstamo  el  comprara  harina, manteca, mantequilla varios, etc. su meta es tener su local propio para poner su panadería junto a su familia.
texts.en: Luis, 27, lives in Orquídeas.  He’s in a free union and has no children.  He decided to look for work to get ahead but since no one gave his the opportunity to work for a firm he decided to gather money to open a bakery.  His sales gradually grew and now he has the necessary clientele.  He works every day from 6:30am until 10am and from 2pm until 5pm.  Luis starts work early in the morning.  He will use the loan to buy flour, shortening, butter and others.  His goal is to have a place of his own to install his bakery and his family.

loans.use: to buy flour, shortening, butter.

loans.name: Kuña Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Pyapy Mbarete se destaca por la unidad y el deseo de progresar como grupo.La señora Sonia es un  ejemplo de perseverancia y del empeño que pone para progresar es por eso que el grupo la aprecia mucho.
Ella tiene una despensa en la que trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día, ya que va al mercado para surtir su negocio con todo tipo de productos. Cuenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio y que con sacrificio y esfuerzo está creciendo de a poquito.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, hortalizas, carnes, frutas y demás, para seguir teniendo bien surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Pyapy Mbarete” committee stands out for the members’ unity and wish to make progress.  Sonia is an example of perseverance and effort that’s put into making progress which is why the group holds her in high esteem.

She has a grocery store and she starts work very early in the morning in that she goes to the market to stock up on all types of products for her store.  She relates that she started her small business with sacrifice and effort and has been growing little by little.

She’s requesting this loan to buy vegetables, produce, meat, fruit and others to keep her store well-stocked.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, legumes, meats, fruit and others.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter  is a 40-year-old married man. He has three children, ages 2 to 10. He describes himself to be hard-working man. 

Peter operates a mining retail business where he sells building stones. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located at a very dry area, and his primary customers are local residents.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be a shortage of mining equipment. 

He will use the KES 8,700 loan to buy a water tank that will be used by his family members. 

His business goal is to expand his business twice within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved his work.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is 41 years old, married to Francis and a mother of four children. She weaves bags, baskets etc in Kiambaa in the outskirts of Limuru and has been doing so for 10 years now. She gets a monthly income of 60,000 KES. 

This will be Consolata’s first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy weaving materials like beads, thread etc. In the future, she wants to be a successful business woman.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials like beads, thread etc

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 50-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 18 to 28 years. She describes herself as hard working. She operates an agribusiness selling beans, tomatoes, maize etc  She has been involved in this business for three years. Her farm is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are local people. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the outbreak of diseases that affect people. She will use the KES 11,100 loan to buy a water tank that will be used by her family. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved her agribusiness .

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 23 years old, farms maize, raises poultry and also has a beauty shop. She is single and provides for her parents. Lucy has been in these businesses for one year now and gets a monthly income KES 40,000 

This will be Lucy’s second loan with KADET LTD, she plans to use the entire loan to purchase poultry feed and maize seeds for planting. In the future, she wants to be a successful business woman.

loans.use: To purchase maize seeds and feed for poultry

loans.name: Silver

texts.en: Silver is a 40-year-old married man and a father of two young children from Talibon, Bohol. He has been engaged in a tricycle transportation business for more than 15 years now. Silver is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for the tricycle, such as nuts and bolts, engine fluid, etc. With this, he will be able to maintain the good working condition of the tricycle. In the future, Silver wants to improve his business and save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the tricycle

loans.name: Jose Elmer

texts.es: Don José Elmer su nivel de estudios más altos fue finalizar la secundaria, ahora su negocio es la venta de celulares, la esposa trabaja vendiendo queso y crema por encargos en las pulperías así ambos se apoyan económicamente para sus diferentes gastos, sus hijos son mayores de edad y trabajan en una zona franca, lamentablemente perdió a uno de sus hijos el cual para él fue muy difícil sobreponerse al fallecimiento pero con el tiempo ha sabido sobrevivir a este dolor que aun está latente, él como todo un hombre trabajador está optando por crédito para mejorar su casa poniéndole cerámica y las ventanas de su casa que todavía le faltan, comprara cerámica, cemento, celosías de vidrio y marcos de aluminio, esto gracias a los financiamientos que se otorgan en plazos.
texts.en: José Elmer’s highest level of education was completed secondary school.  His current business is mobile phone sales.  His wife works selling cheese and cream to order to grocery stores and this way they both support each other economically to cover their costs.  Their children are adults and work in a tax-free zone.  Sadly, he lost one of his children and overcoming this loss was very difficult for him but in time he’s managed to overcome the pain although it’s always present in the background.  Like all hardworking men he’s opted for a loan to make some home improvements.  He will install tile and windows his house still needs.  He will buy tile, cement, glass louvers and aluminum frames thanks to the loan repayable in installments he’ll be granted.

loans.use: to buy tile, cement, glass louvers and aluminum frames.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 36 years old, married to Boniface and a mother of three. She sells groceries in Kawangware and has been in this business for 12 years now. She gets a monthly income of 45,000 KES.

This will be Tabitha’s second loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy groceries in bulk such as 10 crates of tomatoes, two bales of vegetables etc. She wants her business to flourish in the future.

loans.use: To buy more groceries in bulk such as tomatoes and vegetables.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a man of 43, married to Susan and the father of two children. He owns a retail shop in Kikuyu, in the outskirts of Nairobi City, and also has a taxi business. He has been in this business for 11 years, and gets a monthly income of 50,000 shillings.

This will be Daniel’s first loan from KADET LTD; he plans to use the loan to add stock like rice, sugar, maize flour, cooking oil, etc. in bulk.

 In the future, he wants to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase stock like rice, sugar, maize flour, and cooking oil for his general store.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
