Caroline, a resident of Kisauni, considers herself to be a very charismatic, honest and unassuming person who very much likes to work to her best. She lives with her family; her husband and their school-aged daughter. 

Caroline works in a tailoring business, sewing and amending some worn-out garments.  She’s worked in this business for five years, and does very well thanks to her charisma and her services.  

Profits she gets from this business are used for household expenses. Caroline is asking for a loan to buy fabrics, zippers, threads, buttons, etc.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, zippers, threads, buttons, etc. for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Lita

texts.es:
Lita, de 44 años, en una mujer emprendedora y llena de aspiraciones, tiene 3 hijos de 28, 27 y 14 años junto al hombre con quien convive hace 30 años llamado José, vive en casa de su suegra en donde tiene un espacio que disfruta junto a la familia que ha constituido. Lita, tiene como principal actividad la compra y venta de diversos productos regionales como  piña, plátano, papaya, cocona, naranjas, limones y mandarinas entre otros. Cada 2 ó 3 días se dirige al puerto de la ciudad en espera de la llegada de los agricultores que traen sus productos directamente desde el campo, compra en sacos por cientos o en cajones y ella se encarga de distribuirlos en cantidades menores o por unidades en su puesto que ha ubicado en la vereda de su casa. Lleva en este negocio desde hace 9 años y siempre con la ayuda de su pareja quien se encarga de movilizar los pesados sacos que contienen los productos que consigue para vender durante la semana.
Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que desde muy pequeña ha aprendido a valorar el trabajo y a hacerle frente a las situaciones difíciles, su negocio le genera lo ingresos necesarios para sobrellevar los gatos básicos de su familia y espera que su situación económica siga mejorando con el paso de los días. Este es el crédito número 6 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo, además esta convencida que seguirá siendo la socia puntual y responsable en el pago sus cuota como lo hizo en os créditos obtenidos anteriormente, le gusta pertenecer al banco comunal en el que trabaja ya que todos sus miembros son responsables y muy solidarios entre si.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará mayor cantidad frutas regionales como papaya, piñas, cocona y cítricos por sacos para continuar trabajando en su negocio.
texts.en:
44-year old Lita is an enterprising woman full of plans for the future. She has three children aged 28, 27, and 14 with her partner José with whom she has lived for thirty years. She lives with her mother-in-law and enjoys being part of the family.

Lita’s main work is buying and selling various local produce such as pineapples, bananas, papayas, coconuts, oranges, lemons, mandarins etc. Every two or three days she goes to the port and waits for the arrival of the farmers who bring their produce directly from the countryside. She buys the fruit in bags of a hundred or in boxes, and then sells it in smaller quantities or even one at a time. Her stall is located on the sidewalk at her home.

Lita has had this business for nine years. José always helps her with the transportation of the heavy sacks containing the produce that she sells during the week. She greatly enjoys what she does, as even as a child she was taught the value of work and the need to face difficult situations. Her business brings in the income necessary to pay for the basic expenses of her family; she hopes that her economic situation will continue to improve in the days and months to come.

This is Lita’s sixth loan with MFP, and she is very happy knowing that she has financial support to be able to continue with her work. She is determined to continue to be a responsible member of her group, always making her loan repayments on time as she has done in the past. She enjoys belonging to her community bank as the members are all responsible and committed.

With the 1000 soles she is seeking, Lita will buy a larger quantity of local fruit such as bags of papaya, pineapples, coconuts, and citrus fruits so that she can continue with her business.

loans.use: buy fruit such as papaya, pineapples, coconuts, and citrus fruits

loans.name: San Jose Obrero Group

texts.es:
El comité  “San José Obrero, se conformo con la iniciativa de la señora Nelly quien queriendo ayudar a sus amigas las invito y de ahí surge este grupo que está en su primer ciclo.
Nelly tiene una despensa en su casa, con todo lo que sus vecinos necesitan, siempre este bien surtido, y es gracias a este trabajo que está saliendo adelante y puede ayudar a su familia. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de fideos, azúcar, arroz, aceite y demás, los cuales son los que más demanda tienen y es por eso que quiere poder surtirse con ellos.
Agradecen la oportunidad que reciben, pues les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The committee named “San José Obrero” was started through the initiative of Sra. Nelly. She wanted to help her friends, so she invited them and started this group which is in its first loan cycle.

Nelly operates a food pantry in her house and it contains everything that her neighbors need. Her business is always well-stocked. Thanks to her work, she is able to move forward and help her family. Nelly is requesting a loan so that she can buy noodles, sugar, rice, oil, and other products that are in high demand. For this reason, she wants her business to be stocked with these items.

The members of this group are grateful for the opportunity they have received and it will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy noodles, sugar, rice, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Zeneyda

texts.es:
La Joven Zeneyda posee un negocio de venta de productos lácteos en la ciudad de León, desde hace once años realiza este trabajo para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Ella sale de su casa de habitación 5:00 am ubicada en un municipio del departamento de León, abre su negocio a las 6:00 am para ofertar a toda su clientela, finalizando sus labores a las 12:00 pm de lunes a viernes en este mismo horario Por la tarde prepara su producto para el día siguiente,  inició su negocio como vendedora ambulante con un pequeño capital el cual era  producto de su ahorro y aporte de su esposo,  es  madre de tres hijos  solo dos están a su cargo

La Joven  solicita un crédito a Ceprodel el que  utilizara para gastos médicos (realizarse estudio clínico para una cirugía de bocio) la cual le permitirá recuperar su salud y así continuar trabajando con su negocio, durante su operación su hija mayor se encargara de ayudarle con el negocio. Ella espera  recuperar su salud lo más pronto posible para continuar brindándoles el apoyo a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
The young Zeneyda has a business of selling milk products in the city of León. She has been doing this work for eleven years in order to support her household. She leaves her home, which is located in a community in the department of León, at 5:00 am, and she opens her business at 6:00 am to offer [her products] to all her customers, ending her work at 12:00 pm from Monday to Friday on this same schedule. In the afternoon, she prepares her products for the following day. She began this business as a street vendor, with a little capital that was the product of her savings and support from her husband. She is the mother of three children. Only two are in her care.

The young woman is applying to Ceprodel for a loan that she will use for medical expenses (completing a clinical study for goiter surgery), which will allow her to recover her health and thus continue working with her business. During her operation, her oldest daughter will be in charge of helping her with the business. She hopes to recover her health as quickly as possible to be able to continue offering support to her young children.

loans.use: to pay for a clinical study for goiter surgery

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en:
Nargiz is 55 years old. She lives in Tkibuli District, with husband, Guram. Several times, Nargiz requested a loan from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is her husband’s salary, working as an artisan. He makes a total of 250 Laris per month. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category. 

Nargiz requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits, with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of low income. 

With the received credit, Nargiz will trade in clothing. She plans to buy clothing from the wholesalers and resell locally, at a higher price. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothing.

loans.name: Flavia's Group

texts.en:
Flavia's group is comprised of three hard-working women. Flavia is 22 years old, and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past year, Flavia has been working hard to manage her restaurant. 

To help expand her business, Flavia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more fresh food, such as bananas and beans, for her restaurant. This will help Flavia generate greater profits, pay her house rent, and take good care of herself. 

Flavia hopes that in the future she will be able to start up another business, such as rearing domestic animals. 

Flavia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock more fresh food such as bananas and beans for cooking in her restaurant.

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. She has three children and has been a farmer for two years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

Roselyne is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to purchase poultry birds. Her biggest challenge is poultry diseases outbreak, which highly affect production. Her highest monthly expense is school fees. This loan will help with increased production, which will result in added disposable income for the family thus improved livelihood.

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Roselyne owns the following: cow, poultry, but does not own pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Genen

texts.en:
Genen is a 60-year-old widower who lives with his son in Ger in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His son Bayarsaihan, age 23, is senior student at the university. 

The borrower has been running his business selling clothes in a local market since 1998. He is hardworking and responsible. He has gained a lot of experience and built strong relationships with customers over the years. He is now requesting 2,500,000 MNT to purchase inventory for his clothing business for seasonal sales.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for his clothing business for seasonal sales.

loans.name: Sikuzani

texts.en:
Sikuzani is a married woman. She has 3 children, ages 8 to 17. She describes herself to be a hard-working and determined woman. 

She operates a farm where she sells bananas, beans, and tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for 12 years, and employs 2 staff members. Her business is located in a fertile agricultural area, and her primary customers are local customers from the surrounding community. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the KES 41,500 loan to buy a water tank that will be used by her family members. 

Her business goal is to buy extra land within five years to improve her agribusiness farming. 

She hopes that in the future, she will have improved the living standard of her family from the profits generated from the business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for her family's use.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is a man of 50 years, married to Irene and the father of 2.  He is a meat supplier, and his wife also supports the family with the income she gets from poultry keeping.  Antony has been in this business for 7 years now; he gets a monthly income of 80,000 shillings.

This will be Antony’s second loan with KADET LTD; he plans to use the entire loan to pay school fees for his children.

In future he wants to educate his children, and also have more customers for his meat supply business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy scrap for her husband's scrap selling business.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad, de 51 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y alegre.  Es separada del padre de sus hijos.  Vive en compañía de su anciana madre y su hijo Joel  de 29 años de edad, a quienes  quiere mucho.  Habitando una casa que es de su propiedad, la cual heredó de su padre. La actividad que realiza Natividad es la venta de abarrotes y comestibles, para lo cual abrió una bodega en el interior de su  propia casa, ya que la necesidad económica era fuerte y la pensión o apoyo económico de sus hijos no le alcanzaba.  Decidió iniciar éste negocio  hace más de 06  años, tiempo que le valió para lograr crecer y ampliar su negocio. Tiene muchos clientes, contando en su mayoría a vecinos, a quienes atiende con la ayuda de su mamá ocasionalmente.
Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la buena acogida y demanda que tiene, dejándole buenas ganancias.
Le gusta su actividad pues le permite socializarse con sus vecinos así tener más amistades y poder platicar de temas de su interés, además de sentirse ocupada y una persona productiva. 
Gracias a los ingresos económicos puede solventar los gastos necesarios de su hogar. Por otro lado, no le gusta que algunos de sus clientes se demoren en el pago de sus créditos que ella les brinda en la venta de sus productos, esta considerando la posibilidad de ya no otorgar estos créditos, para así poder tener más efectivo en sus manos  e invertir en ampliar su negocio. Este es el préstamo número 12 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta de poder contar con el apoyo y avanzar en su negocio, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Además de sentirse cómoda con su grupo de su banco comunal, pues considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de productos comestibles como arroz, azúcar, fideos, entre otros.  Para surtir y aumentar el disponible de mercaderías en su bodega, deseando seguir contando con la preferencia de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Natividad, 51, is a hardworking, cheerful woman.  She’s separated from the father of her children.  She lives with her aged mother and her son, Joel, 29, who she loves very much.  She lives in a house that’s her property and that she inherited from her father.  Natividad’s activity is selling groceries and foodstuffs.  To do so, she opened a grocery store inside her house because economic need was severe and the stipends or child support she got wasn’t enough.  She decided to start this business six years ago and this time has served her to grow and expand.  She has many customers most of which are neighbors who she tends to with help from her mother occasionally.  She considers her business to be quite profitable because it’s well-received and it’s in high demand; it yields good profits.

She likes her activity because it allows her to socialize with her neighbors and have more friends and to be able to talk about topics she’s interested in; she also likes to feel occupied and to be a productive person.

Thanks to her income she’s able to cover her household needs.  On the other hand, she does not like it when her customers are late making their payments on the loans credit she gives for her products’ sales.  She’s thinking about not providing this credit any longer in order to have more cash on-hand and invest in expanding the business.

This is MFP loan #12 and she feels happy about having this support to make business progress so she commits to make her payments punctually.  She also feels comfortable in her communal bank because she considers the members to be responsible and mutually supportive.

She will use the requested 1,000 new soles to buy edible products like rice, sugar and noodles, among others to stock up on merchandise for her store thus continuing to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and noodles, among others.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, tiene la edad  de 44 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la preparación del terreno para realizar una siembre nueva ya que las plantas existentes se encuentran agotadas por los años de cosecha que han brindado durante varios años además la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra de otros trabajos de asistencia para el café. Además de poder comprar unas plantas de almácigo para realizar la siembra y así tener a corto plazo un cafetal nuevo, también aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener a futuro un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jorge, 44, is married.  He lives with his children and his wife, who are his main priority.  With this loan, he plans to prepare some land to put in new crops, because the current plants are depleted due to the harvests that they have provided over a number of years.  He will also buy fertilizers and fungicides, pay for workers to help him with the coffee crops, and buy some new coffee seedlings to plant.  In this way, he will have a new coffee plantation in a short period of time, where he will be able to take advantage of the good fertility of the earth and the favorable climatic conditions for coffee cultivation.  

With these improvements, he expects to get more earnings in the future, and in this way improve his family's living conditions.  He will also be able to invest a bit more in his farm, and also accomplish some other goals that he has.  This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR.  He had not taken loans before with the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan with better payment terms and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to cultivate coffee

loans.name: Vadar

texts.en:
Vadar is a 43-year old man, married, and has two sons. He is market vendor and sells seasonal fruits and vegetables in his place in central bazaar and from his home. Vadar has 10 years of experience in this field. He knows customers needs and he has reliable providers. 

Vadar chose this business because it is profitable and brings stable income. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table of Azerbaijan's families and also make fresh punch.  His monthly income is 120 AZN.

He applied for 2000 AZN loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase his monthly turnover. This will be his third loan and he has good client history.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Eveline

texts.en: Eveline is a middle-aged Cameroonian living in a semi-urban area. She is married with two children, and she has been a tailor for over six years. In her workshop, she has four regular sewing machines and one semi-industrial zigzag machine. This loan will enable her buy two additional bales of materials to sew dresses. This will also increase her living standard.

loans.use: buy material to sew dresses.

loans.name: Adiaratou

texts.fr:
Née en 1986, Adiaratou vit avec ses 3 enfants et son époux dans une famille traditionnelle au quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni. 
Adiaratou en plus de ses activités professionnelles (enseignante) s’intéresse aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de légumes qu’elle fait venir de Sikasso et Bamako, depuis maintenant 4 ans et de céréales qu’elle achète auprès des paysans producteurs de Bougouni et environs.  
Après avoir correctement remboursé les huit prêts précédents,  Adiaratou  est à son neuvième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 3 tonnes de maïs. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, dans le marché de Bougouni à une clientèle composée  d’hommes et de femmes. 
Adiaratou  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 85.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in 1986, Adiaratou lives with her 3 children and her husband in a traditional family setting in the district of Torakabougou, Bougouni town. As well as having a professional career (teacher), Adiaratou is interested in revenue-generating activities, notably the buying and selling of vegetables which she has gotten from Sikasso and Bamako for the last 4 years, and cereals which she buys from the peasant farmers of Bougouni and the surrounding area.

Having properly repaid her 8 previous loans, Adiaratou is on her 9th loan from Soro Yiriwaso, which will be used to buy 3 tons of corn. She makes her sales at the Bougouni market for cash or credit, to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. Adiaratou hopes to make a monthly profit of 85 000 francs, which will be used to help her husband meet the family's needs, to repay the loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Tuvshuntugs

texts.en:
Tuvshuntugs is 22 years old and lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband runs a transportation business between regions. She works as an interior decorator at a private construction business entity. Their child attends kindergarten. Over the years, the apartment they reside in has been deteriorated badly and needs some serious repairs. 

Tuvshuntugs is requesting a loan of 55,00,000 MNT to cover the cost of water closet improvements, plumbing updates, purchase of ceiling, vacuum door and floor heating system installation. Installing a floor heating system will be beneficial as sometimes heat distribution from the heating station stops. Also ceiling and vacuum door installment can help a lot in keeping warm. As a result, the heat loss from door side will be stopped and the apartment will better retain heat. The couple will then have no fear of their son getting cold and can work enthusiastically for their future.

loans.use: to cover for home repair costs

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a thirty-seven year old farmer in Nkubu county in Kenya where he lives with his wife and two children who are all in school. He has been in farming for the past nine years producing milk, maize, coffee, potatoes and bananas which he sells at the local market in his area. He also runs a retail shop as an additional source of income.

He is requesting a 20,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase irrigation equipment which will help him water his crops even when there is little rainfall. This will help him get more produce and hence more income that will improve his living standards and he will use some of the money to pay school fees for his children. He aspires to have a big green house with a variety of crops in the next five years.

Poor road networks and inadequate funds are his major challenges in farming.

Benson believes Juhudi Kilimo offers the most quality to their clients.

loans.use: to purchase irrigation equipment.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en: Tabu, 46, is a single mother due to widowhood, and lives with her two children. For the last eight years she has been selling mnazi (local brew) in a small stall. Despite all the difficulties she experiences, she does not lose heart. Tabu remains focused to her goals. She wants to buy gallons of local brew to sell which is why she is asking for this loan. In the future, she dreams of opening a retail shop. Her wish is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy gallons of local brew to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce  is a 27-year-old, married woman. She has two children, ages two and four years. She describes herself as hard-working. She operates a retail store, where she sells fabrics for clothing. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located within a busy market, and her primary customers are the general public. She says that her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the KES 21,000 loan to buy a water tank that will be used by her family members. Her business goal is to become a wholesaler within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for her family's use.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel, de 44 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, como también alegre y sociable. Es conviviente con Rodolfo quien es comerciante,  fruto de esa unión tiene 02 hijos de 24 y 13 años de edad respectivamente. Viven instalados cómodamente en una casa de su propiedad. La actividad que realiza Raquel, es la venta de ropas de damas, caballeros y niños, así como zapatos que trae a pedido desde la ciudad capital, para  luego venderlos de forma personal a sus vecinos y familiares, muchas veces al contado como también a crédito a 15 días.  Dedicándose a ésta actividad  hace más de 08 años y lo realiza hasta el momento sola, tanto en la compra como en la venta.
Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja y la demanda que tiene.
Le gusta su actividad pues le permite  socializar con las personas, al brindarles un buen servicio en la atención, así como también  el contar con un ingreso económico, ya que con el sueldo de su pareja en una empresa privada no les alcazaba, teniendo muchas necesidades tanto de vestir como la alimentación.  Viendo esa dificultad decidió trabajar en éste negocio, y viendo los buenos resultados obtenidos gracias a la buena acogida, tiene planes de continuar y hacer crecer el volumen de stock de sus mercaderías. Este es el préstamo número  05 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además de sentirse muy bien con su banco comunal pues lo considera ser un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de ropas de diversos modelos y marcas en  mayor cantidad, buscando precios bajos por el volumen de sus compras porque desea aumentar  su stock de mercaderías.
texts.en:
Raquel, 44, is an enterprising, hardworking woman as well as cheerful and sociable.  She lives with Rodolfo who is a merchant.  They have two children who are 24 and 13 years old respectively.  They live comfortably in a house they own.  Raquel’s activity is selling clothes for women, men and children as well as shoes that she brings on order from the capital city to then sell personally to neighbors and family members often for cash but also on 15-days credit.  She’s been in business more than 8 years and to date works alone both buying and selling.  She considers her business profitable because of the good profits it yields and the demand it has.

She likes her activity because she’s able to socialize with people while providing them with good service as well as because it generates good income because her spouse’s salary working for a private firm was insufficient due to the many clothing and food needs they had.  In light of this difficulty, she decided to work in this business and seeing the good results she got and the good way she was received, she plans to continue and make her stock of merchandise grow. 

This will be MFP loan #5 and she hopes for your collaboration so she can make her plans reality.  She also feels very good in her communal bank because she considers it a united, supportive group.

She will use the entire requested 1,500 new soles to buy clothes in various styles and brands in larger amounts seeking the lowest prices for volume purchases because she wants to increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Makhbuba

texts.ru:
Махбуба, разведена, живет с младшим сыном. Ему 13 лет. Махбуба имеет среднее образование, после окончания школы сразу вышла замуж. По характеру очень хороший человек. Имеет хорошие отзывы от соседей. Они её любят и поддерживают. В начале 2012 года, в качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, начала заниматься торговлей продуктами питания, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 5,000 KGS. 

Благодаря упорному труду Махбуба в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется магазин, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Махбуба обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку увеличения оборота. Доходы от кредита Махбуба планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством увеличения ассортимента товара в магазине. Забота о сыне и обеспечение хорошего образования для него, это приоритетная задача для Махбуба.
texts.en:
Makhbuba is divorced and lives with her youngest son who is 13 years old.  She has a high school education and got married shortly after finishing school.  Makhbuba is, by nature, a very kind person.  Her neighbors love her and support her, and they have nothing but positive comments to say about her.  In early 2012, in order to provide a source of income for her family, Makhbuba began selling food products, a business she started with an initial sum of 5,000 KGS.

Thanks to her hard work, Makhbuba has a store, and she makes a monthly profit of about 15,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to increase her working capital.  She will use this loan to purchase inventory of food items for her store. Her priority is to take care of her son and to ensure that he receives a good education.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of food items for her store

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock and a variety store business. Aurelia is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Aurelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Selmita

texts.es:
Selmita, de 51 años, es una mujer valiente y muy gentil, esta casada con Carlos quien es agricultor. Es madre de un hijo quien tiene 19 años, aun es estudiante. Vive con su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia, donde junto a ellos trabaja para tener una mejor calidad de vida y progresar poco a poco.
El trabajo de Selmita consiste en la venta de abarrotes, ella tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, donde también ofrece algunos productos por catalogo a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus amigos, vecinos y familiares, ella también posee una mototaxi que la alquila para que un chofer trabaje en el, todas las actividades ella las realiza en su casa. Lleva más de 18 años haciendo todo de tipo de trabajo el cual hace sola ya que su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y pasa mucho tiempo en su chacra.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede ganar dinero estando en su casa, compartiendo el tiempo junto a su hijo quien en algunas ocasiones sale también a trabajar en la mototaxi que tiene. En el barrio su bodega es muy concurrida ya que trata bien a sus clientes y tiene todo lo que ellos necesitan por lo que tiene buenos ingresos y le va bien en esta actividad económica, espera mas adelante poner un negocio como es la venta de repuestos de mototaxis y una  vulcanizadora. Este será su crédito  número 18 con la institución  MFP.  Por ello solicita de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Ya que se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio, además se compromete una vez mas en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en el anterior crédito que tuvo, dice estar contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son responsables y muy buenos entre ellos.
Con el monto solicitado 600 soles, comprará productos de primera necesidad para su bodega, además de comprar algunos repuestos y accesorios para su futura vulcanizadora.
texts.en:
Selmita, 51, is a brave, very gracious woman married to Carlos who is a farmer.  She’s the mother of a 19-year-old son who is still a student.  She lives with her husband and son in her own house where she works with them to have a better quality of life and gradually make progress.

Selmita’s work consists in selling groceries.  She has a small store at home where she also sells some products via catalog to customers who for the most part are friends, neighbors and family members.  She also owns a mototaxi that she leases to a driver who works with it.  She does all her activities from home.  She’s been doing all types of work for 18 years and does it alone since her husband works in agriculture and spends much time in his fields.

What she likes about her work is that she can earn money while staying at home sharing her time with her son who sometimes also goes out to work in the mototaxi she has.  Her store is very popular in her neighborhood because she treats her customers well and she stocks everything they need which is why her income is good and she does well in this economic activity.  She hopes later on to open a mototaxi repair shop and a tire repair shop.

This will be MFP loan #18 and she’s asking for your collaboration so she can make her plans reality.  She will feel sure to progress with her business and she once again commits to make her payments like she’s done with previous loans she’s gotten.  She says she’s happy to belong to her communal bank because all the members are responsible and very good to each other.  She will use the requested 600 soles to buy basic staples for her store and will also buy some spare parts and accessories for her future tire repair shop.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Bayarmaa, 35 years old, lives with her husband and 8 year old son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In 2004, the couple moved to Ulaanbaatar and lives in a traditional Mongolian home , which is made with felts.  

She has been running superstore for three months;prior to this, she had been working as a seller in another person’s superstore. Her husband makes advertisement boards, and in summer, builds houses for additional income. 

She wants to educate her son, and improve her family’s living standard, so she is working really hard. She is requesting a loan of 800,000 MNT to increase her working capital by purchasing candies, sweets and breads. As a result, the family can generate more income for their life and their son’s education.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья уже несколько раз пользовалась кредитами КИВА. Благодаря полученной финансовой помощи Наталья смогла открыть новую точку для торговли новогодними товарами, игрушками и украшениями, что было так своевременно перед праздничным бумом в Украине. Теперь у нее три торговых точки. 
В этот раз Наталья снова обратилась за помощью именно к КИВА для того, чтобы закупить теплые тапочки, а также подарочные наборы и декоративные украшения под реализацию в зимний сезон на 21 000 гривен. Она надеется за счет стабильных продаж укрепить третью точку в развитии.
texts.en:
Natalya has already taken advantage of several Kiva loans. Thanks to this financial assistance, she was able to open a new retail location where she sold Christmas merchandise, toys and decoration, which was a very timely move before the holiday sales boom in Ukraine. She now operates three retail spots.

This time, Natalya is turning to Kiva once again, in order to purchase warm slippers, gift sets decorative ornaments for the winter season worth 21,000 hryvnia. She hopes to take advantage of steady sales to firmly establish her third retail outlet.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for resale during the winter season

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina is a 53-year-old 2nd hand clothes seller. She is married to Anthony, who is 54 years old and a printer. 

They have two children who are adults and independent. She did not continue her education after completing the basic school so she opted to go into trading.

In 2011, because she needed capital to expand her business, she joined ID Ghana after a partner introduced her to ID Ghana. She became interested and joined in November.

She is hardworking, industrious and a committed individual ready to support the husband to educate their children. 

This is her 3rd loan and she needs GHS 700 to buy more to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothing and sell to customers.

loans.name: Yulya

texts.ru: Юля, замужем, одна дочка. Юля имеет среднее образование, после окончания школы сразу вышла замуж. По характеру очень хороший человек. Имеет хорошие отзывы от соседей. Они её любят и поддерживают. Юля в качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, в начале 2012 года, начала заниматься торговлей женской одежды, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 80,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Юля в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 130,000 KGS в обороте, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Юля обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку подростковой одежду в новый магазин который она арендовала. Доходы от кредита Юля планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством увеличения ассортимента товара в магазине, и увеличения количества магазинов . Забота о дочке и обеспечение хорошего образования для него, это приоритетная задача для Юля.
texts.en:
Yulya is married and has a daughter. Yulya has secondary education, and got married right after graduating from high school. She is a very kind person and has a good reputation among her neighbours, who like and support her.

To provide a source of income for her family, Yulya started selling women's clothing in early 2012, launching her business with a sum of 80,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, the business is currently worth 130,000 KGS, with monthly profits totalling roughly 15,000 som (KGS). In order to continue developing her business, Yulya has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to purchase clothing for teenagers for a new store she has just rented. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business by expanding the range of merchandise in her shop, as well as increasing the number of shops she operates. Her priority is to care for her daughter and provide him with quality education.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for her second shop

loans.name: Vera

texts.ru:
Вера живет в Каменке, в своем доме. Вместе с мужем она более 10 лет занимается выращиванием овощей в теплицах на своем участке. Выращивают помидоры, редис и огурцы. 

В прошлом году у мужа случился инсульт, его госпитализировали и лечили в областном центре. Вере было очень трудно и огородом заниматься и за мужем ухаживать. Сейчас мужу лучше, уже может сам ходить, но работать нельзя. 

В этом году помимо лечения мужа Вера потратила деньги на отопление в теплицах. Теперь она просит предоставить ей кредит на семена и удобрения.

Вера планирет расширять свой бизнес. У нее есть еще земля, где можно построить дополнительные теплицы.
texts.en:
Vera lives in Kamenka in her own home. She and her husband have more than ten years of experience growing vegetables in greenhouses. She grows tomatoes, radishes and cucumbers. 

Last year, her husband had a stroke. He was hospitalized and treated in the regional health center. It was very difficult for Vera to take care of the farm and her husband. Now her husband is better. He can now walk by himself, but cannot work. 

This year, Vera spent money both to treat her husband and to heat the greenhouses. Now she is asking for a loan to buy seed and fertilizer. 

Vera plans to expand their businesses. She has more land where she can build more greenhouses.

loans.use: buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Zaryl

texts.ru: Зарыл 54 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Зарыл на протяжении 10 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 5,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Зарыл в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 2 лошади, 10 овцы и 10 коз. Прибыль от откорма и перепродажи скота составляет около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зарыл обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота: жеребят, коров  и быков. Доходы от кредита Зарыл планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Zaryl is 54 years old, married and has four children. Zaryl has been working with livestock breeding for a period of 10 years, after having started this business with a sum of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to persistent work, Zaryl currently has 2 cows, 2 horses, 10 sheep and 10 goats on her farm. The income from fattening and reselling livestock is around 5,000 som (KGS) per month. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Zaryl turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of foals. Zaryl plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of domestic animals.

loans.use: To purchase bulls and cows for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Tsevelmaa

texts.en:
Tsevelmaa, 63 years old, lives with her son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Her son was working in Korea for years and has now come back to Mongolia to take care of his mother.Because she lives alone in her house on plot of land and the are she resides has high risk of robbery and theft. Her daughter currently is working in Korea on a labor contract and sends her money, sometimes.  

In 2010, with her saved money of 800000 MNT, she opened her grocey store. She runs small grocery store on her plot of land and it has been operating stably for almost two years. Her son and daughter-in-law are renting a place where they are operating a restaurant. 

Tsevelmaa is requesting a loan of MNT 1500000 to contribute to her son’s business. the money will be spent for operational costs, rents, appliances and furniture. As a result, she can help her son to improve his living standard. She is a very hard-working individual whose only dream is to see her son living happily.

loans.use: to support her son's restaurant business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy embroidery material, clothes, and thread for her sewing and embriodery business

loans.name: Zemirah

texts.en:
Zemirah is a 23-year-old, married woman from Bohol, Philippines and a mother of two young children. She is engaged in the fishing business, together with her husband, for almost five years now. This is the source of their income. 

Zemirah is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, hooks, and lead weights. Zemirah hopes of making their business a success soon.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, hooks, and lead weights for her fishing business.

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Andrés  se dedica a la venta de comidas en su domicilio ubicado en el municipio de Soledad, donde habita con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos; su negocio inició por tradición familiar, pues de su padre aprendieron él y sus hermanos,  la preparación y la venta de alimentos y hoy sus hijos también trabajan con Andrés. Su principal producto es el famoso arroz de lisa que usualmente lo preparan en la costa Caribe,  lavando  las lisas muy bien y cocinándola en agua hirviendo con sal durante 10 minutos, para luego secarlas y escurrirlas y cuando pierdan el exceso de calor, se desmenuzan quitando todas las espinas, poniendo al fuego en una cazuela el hogao, las lisas y el arroz; de esta manera  cuando comienza a hervir,  se incorpore el agua, sal y pimienta ,  hasta que el arroz esté en su punto y listo  para servir bien caliente, espolvoreado con el perejil picado.  
Este delicioso producto por el cual Andrés es muy reconocido es con el que ha logrado reconocimiento en el sector donde tiene su puesto de ventas. En su proceso participa su esposa desde la madrugada para que la venta inicie desde las 6 de la mañana hasta la 11 del mismo día, y desde los lunes hasta los domingos. Sus principales clientes son los trabajadores del sector, que lo compran en porciones y que cada día aumentan más. Esto es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará  arroz, salsas, pescado y verduras, insumos con los cuales prepara su producto , el planea comprarlo en mayor volumen, para disminuir los costos de su compra y ganar un poco mas.
texts.en:
Andrés makes a living selling food in his home in the town of Soledad, where he lives with his wife and three children.  His business began as a family tradition because he and his siblings learned food preparation and sales from their father, and now Andrés's children also work with him.

His main product is the famous "arroz de lisa" [rice with mullet fish] that's usually prepared on the Caribbean coast.  The mullet is washed very well, cooked for 10 minutes in boiling salted water, then drained, dried, flaked, and deboned when it's no longer very hot.  The mullet is heated in a pot with rice and "hogao" [or "sofrito," an aromatic mixture of tomato and onion].  When it begins to boil, water and salt and pepper are added until the rice is done and ready to serve piping hot, sprinkled with chopped parsley.

This delicious product for which Andrés is very well known has given him recognition in the area where he has his sales stall.  His wife participates in the process from early in the morning so sales can start at 6 a.m. until 11 on the same day, from Monday through Sunday.  His main customers are workers in the area who buy by the portion and who are increasing every day.

This is the reason he's requesting a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it he'll buy rice, salsas, fish, and vegetables, the ingredients he uses to make his dish.  He plans to buy in quantity to lower his purchase cost and earn a little more.

loans.use: to buy rice, salsa, fish, and vegetables

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es: La Sra. Lucrecia tiene 40 años, tiene 4 hijos que tienen las edades de 7, 9, 12 y 19 años,  se dedica a la venta de comida  en la zona Bolivar de la ciudad de El Alto ella vende comida en horno artesanal hecho de barro,   Este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución la Sra. Lucrecia va a usar este préstamo para Invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas, como arroz, fideo, papa y aceite por mayor Su razón para solicitar este préstamo por la falta de capital, la Sra. Lucrecia va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando insumos, para la elaboración de sus comidas, La Sra. Lucrecia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo  brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Lucrecia is 40 years old and has 4 children, ages 7, 9, 12, and 19. She sells meals in the Bolivar zone of El Alto city. Her meals are baked in an artisan oven made of clay.

This is her 1st loan cycle with our institution. She will use the loan to purchase supplies for baking meals, including rice, beans, potatoes, and cooking oil, at wholesale. Her reason for soliciting this loan is a lack of capital. Lucrecia plans to use these benefits to continue buying supplies for elaborating her meals. 

Lucrecia is a very hard-working person and she is happy and grateful to our institution for the help it offers, since this is the only activity that can provide for her survival.

loans.use: to buy food supplies at wholesale for baking meals in her clay oven to sell.

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Amiran is from the village of Ratevani. He is single, and lives with his family: parents and a sister. 

He requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for his agricultural business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

Amiran works at local road building, and gets a small monthly salary. In addition, the family grows maize and haricots on their agricultural land, and sells the harvested products at the local open market. In addition, Amiran breeds rabbits and runs small animal husbandry business.

Amiran requested an agricultural loan from Credo to start-up a small-scale agricultural business. His loan request was approved, as a result of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to loans, as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Amiran will cultivate more land, and sow maize and haricot there. Specifically, with the loaned amount, he will rent a tractor for tilling the land, and purchase seeds for sowing. He will work hard on the plot during summer period to get a good harvest in early fall.

Amiran will sell the harvested maize on the local open market.  As a result of the Kiva loan, the family will get additional income and will use it for renovating the house, which is old and damaged.

loans.use: to rent a tractor for tilling, and for the seeds to plant.

loans.name: Munkhzaya

texts.en:
Munkhzaya is a 40-year-old mother of two children. She lives in a ger, a Mongolian felt tent, in an outer district without basic infrastructure of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her specialties are as a builder and chef, but for the past five years, she has supported her family by operating a used clothing business at the largest outdoor market of Mongolia. 

When Munkhzaya first began her business, she had 500,000 MNT as working capital. Now, she has about 4,000,000 MNT. Most of her customers are from poor families. Munkhzaya's husband works at local company and her son and daughter attend secondary school and kindergarten.  

With her previous loan she sold used clothes, but now she has started to sell cashmere and wool clothes. Munkhzaya is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a cashmere clothes' sewing machine. In the future, she plans to build a new house on her current plot of land and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pbuy sewing machine in order to sew cahsmere and woolen clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy various goods such as cooking oil, lotions, soap, sugar, salt, etc.

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en:
Ramaz is 39 years old. He lives in the small village of Martvili district with his wife and parents. His parents are provided with a retirement pension. Ramaz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milk cows and a calf whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell cheese locally in an open market at a good price. It is hardly enough for a four-member family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Ramaz requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisions provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as "high-risk borrowers" because of low income. 

With the received credit, Ramaz will begin trading in maize, dried fruits and cheese. In particular, he will buy these products from wholesalers and resell them at a better price in the capital city. Ramaz thinks this will be profitable and he will be able to increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy maize, dried fruits and cheese at wholesale to resell

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en: Consolata is 50 years old. She is a widow with five children. Her oldest is 26 years old and her youngest is 18 years old. She has been in business for four years, and she wants a loan to buy things such as thread, needles, and a sewing machine. She will use her profits to pay school fees for her children. She is very thankful for the earlier loan, which helped her to provide food for her family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and thread

loans.name: Viacheslav

texts.en: Viacheslav is 39 years old and lives in the capital city of Georgia with his family: his wife, child and parents-in-law. The source of income for the family is the monthly pensions of Viacheslav’s parents-in-law and small salary earned by his father-in-law working as a watchman. Viacheslav has requested a loan from local financial institutions several time but his loan requests were always rejected because of low income and lack of experience in the new business. His current loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. Viacheslav owns a car and plans to serve the locals as a taxi driver but he will charge higher prices for his service because of the benzene price is high. Not many citizens can afford to use the taxi service at a higher price. Because of the above mentioned problem, Viacheslav has decided to change his taxi's fuel system from benzene to gas, which is cheaper than benzene and will reduce the cost of transportation by 40 to 45 per cent. It will allow Viacheslav to decrease the price of the service, which will attract many customers. Increasing the number of customers and cutting his costs will positively affect his profit. He will pay a local auto service center to change the fuel system. The increased income will be used for family wellbeing.

loans.use: to pay for a fuel system change for his taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy produce (tomatoes, condiments, vegetables, peppers, lettuce, cabbage, etc.) for resale.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is home to the main campus of Moi University. She has two children and has been doing farming work for five years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Poultry and dairy farming!" Her biggest challenge is drought.

Caroline was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Efficiency." She was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "Animal husbandry." She will use the loan to buy a dairy cow.

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" Caroline replied, "Better nutrition because of the availability of milk."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Caroline owns a cow, poultry and bicycle, but does not own a pig, pump, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net in the household, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, TV or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Juvy Catalina

texts.en:
Juvy Catalina is 49 years old and married with three children.

Juvy Catalina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like shampoo, snack foods, school supplies and other miscellaneous items.

Juvy Catalina has borrowed and paid back nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 15 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Juvy Catalina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like shampoo, snack foods, school supplies and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Bienvinido

texts.en:
Bienvinido is 34 years old and is a fisherman from Getafe, Bohol. He has been in the fishing business for more than six years. 

Bienvinido is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and hooks. With this loan, he will be able to improve his catch. In the future, Bienvinido hopes to expand his business and save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets, lead weights, and hooks.

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Ms. Byambasuren is a 54-year-old widow who has one daughter. She lives with her daughter and two grandchildren in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in an outer district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her elder grandson attends a local secondary school. 

She operated a used shoe stall business at the second largest outdoor market in the city. Now, with the help of her daughter, she operates a shoe sale business at a local indoor market. With this loan, she will increase her working capital in order to purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.use: to increase her current assets in order to purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Marash

texts.en:
Marash is 45 years old, married and lives with his wife and parents in northern Albania. For seventeen years now, he has been operating an auto repair shop.
 
“The beginning was very difficult for me because I had no money to invest on a shop, and I was running it from my own home which was not easily accessible from clients. This made it difficult for potential clients. As time went by, and difficulties in relation to clients arose, I knew that I had no other choice but to apply for a loan from an MFI. And I am glad I did,” Marash said.

Marash is now requesting a second loan to purchase necessary tools for his shop. The amount he is applying for, is 150,000 Albanian Lek.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools for his auto repair shop.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 48 years old. He is married with six children. The oldest is 25 and the youngest is 19.  He owns a retail store and he has been in business for six years. He wants a loan to buy more things for his store such as sugar, rice, soaps and cooking oil for sale. The profit will go towards his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more rice, soaps, cooking oil and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Deudonne

texts.en:
Deudonne is 26 years old. He is married with one child, who is eight months old. His wife sells in retail store.

He has been in business for three years. 

He wants a loan to buy more tapes and CDs to burn music for sale. He will put the profit towards his savings.

loans.use: To buy tapes, CDs to burn music for sale

loans.name: Syvester

texts.en:
Syvester is a married man. He has two children, ages two and four years. He describes himself as a focused and warm person. He operates a tailoring retail store, where he sells dresses that he makes. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located within a busy town, and his primary customers are local residents. He says his biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business. 

He will use the KES 11,100 loan to buy a water tank that will be used by his family members. His business goal is to open several similar tailoring outlets within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have expanded his business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for his family's use.

loans.name: Adilia Emperatriz

texts.es: Doña Adilia tiene 46 años con dos hijos mayores de edad, es madre soltera, su esposo falleció en la guerra, ella tuvo que trabajar mucho para  lograr que sus hijos estudiaran y ahora gracias a Dios son grandes profesionales, tiene 16 años de trabajar como secretaria lo que le permite para pagar sus créditos, con este préstamo piensa poner las ventanas de su casa que ha construido con mucho esfuerzo y espera dejar un buen hogar para sus dos hijos, para comenzar la obra necesita comprar celosías, marcos de aluminio y pagar la mano de obra, quedándole pendiente darle fino a las paredes hacer divisiones entre otras mejoras pero poco a poco lo irá haciendo.
texts.en:
Adilia is 46 years old and has 2 adult children. She is a widow; her husband died in the war. Adilia had to work a great deal to see to it that her children studied and now, thank God, they are both grand professionals. Adilia has worked as a secretary for 16 years, enabling her to pay off her loans.

With this loan, she plans to install windows in her house, which she has built with much effort. Adilia hopes to leave a good home for her 2 children. To commence the necessary work, she needs to buy lattice windows and aluminum window frames, and to pay for the labor. This will finally finish the walls, separating the rooms, among other improvements. Little by little her home is being completed.

loans.use: to buy lattice windows, aluminum window frames, and to pay laborers to do the installation.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto de 28 años de edad, habita con su cónyuge y su hijo de 2 años de edad, en el municipio de Sabanagrande; lugar ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad y en la rivera del Rio Magdalena; él tiene un negocio, donde ofrece servicios de recreación dirigida, mediante la práctica de ejercicios,  en las instalaciones de la vivienda donde habita y ofrece servicios grupales e individuales, mediante rutinas de ejercicios aeróbicos, con pesas entre otros, para ayudar a sus clientes a perder grasa acumulada en sus cuerpos. Su trabajo diario inicia desde muy temprano en las horas de la mañana, hasta las 8 de la noche, cuando finaliza el último grupo. Cuando inició lo hizo orientado por su amigo quien le vendió las maquinarias que hoy tiene en su actual  negocio, hace 2 años, porque no podía atenderlo. Poco a poco Luis Alberto fue ganando clientela y hoy cuenta con personas que reconocen la calidad de su trabajo y lo requieren para que los oriente en el uso de las máquinas apropiadas, para conservar una figura especial. En la actualidad su meta más importante es lograr fuentes de financiación, para hacer crecer su negocio y finalmente tener su propia casa, con un local destinado para el desempeño de su gimnasio. Esta es la razón por la cual acude aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará máquinas de musculación,  para mejorar su servicio y con ello iniciar el camino hacia el éxito de su negocio mediante cada crédito, que logre con Kiva.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto, 28, lives with his wife and two-year-old son in Sabanagrande located 20 minutes from the city on the banks of the Magdalena River.  He has a business where he offers managed recreation services through exercise in a space at home; he offers individual and group services via aerobic exercise, weightlifting and others to help his customers lose body fat.  His daily work starts very early in the morning and goes until 8 at night when his last group finishes.

He started his work two years ago with guidance from a friend who sold him the equipment he now has in his business because he was unable to tend to it.  Gradually, Luis Alberto has acquired clientele and now people recognize the quality of his work and need him to teach them how to use the appropriate equipment to retain their special figures.  His most important goal at present is to get financing to make the business grow and eventually own a house with space set aside for a gym.  This is why he’s calling on a Kiva loan, his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy weightlifting equipment for better service and with it start on the road to business success by means of each loan he gets through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy weight-lifting equipment.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 32-year-old, married man. He has a daughter, who is one year old. He describes himself as a patient and focused man. He operates a motorcycle, with which he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located within a busy town, and his primary customers are local residents. He says his biggest business challenge is the poor road network. 

He will use the KES 21,000 loan to buy a water tank that will be used by his family members. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved his business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for use by his family.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 55 years old. He lives in a small village of Lagodekhi District with his wife. George requested a loan for a family business start-up from local financial institutions several times, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. In addition, they have 1.25 hectares of agricultural land, where maize and watermelon are grown. They sell the harvested products and the cheese locally at a good price. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

George requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit George will purchase a car and work as a taxi driver. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and work as a taxi driver

loans.name: Lian

texts.en:
Lian is a hard-working entrepreneur who has pig-raising and food-vending businesses in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lian successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is relisting Lian's business profile, in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto, de 44 años, es una hombre amable, bueno y muy trabajador, es conviviente con Marilu con quien tiene 03 hijos de 18, 09 y 02 años de edad, el vive junto a su familia en su casa propia, todos los días se esfuerza mucho para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
El trabajo de Humberto consiste en el transporte de pasajeros dentro y fuera de la ciudad, desde muy temprano sale en busca de sus eventuales clientes a quienes brinda un servicio de calidad y con calidez humana, adicional a la seguridad pues el como un transportista responsable tiene siempre en regla su documentación y esta al pendiente de las fallas que pueda tener su vehiculo para la satisfacción de sus clientes. Cuando se inicio en este trabajo manejaba un mototaxi de manera de alquiler, esto no le producía muchos ingresos y por lo mismo no estaba contento haciendo esa actividad, ahora pudo comprar su vehiculo y trabaja para el mismo, lleva mas de 06 años trabajando de manera independiente y le esta yendo muy bien.
Le gusta mucho su trabajo pues se distrae, divierte y sobre todo genera ingresos diarios para su familia, además que tiene un gran apoyo de su conviviente quien se encarga de vender algunos productos en la vereda de su casa y significa un ingreso adicional a su economía, ahora piensa en poder continuar con la expansión de sus negocio y aumentar mercaderías. Este será el  préstamo  numero 14 con MFP, esta muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos sus integrantes son personas muy responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 nuevos soles realizara el arreglo o cambio de algunas piezas de sus mototaxi, además comprará frutas y abarrotes para seguir con la venta desde su hogar.
texts.en:
Humberto, 44, is a friendly, good, and very hardworking man.  He lives with Marilu, with whom he has three children, ages 18, 9, and 2.  He lives with his family in his own house.  Every day he works very hard to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

Humberto's job is transporting passengers inside and outside the city.  He goes out very early in the morning looking for customers, whom he offers a quality service with a human touch as well as security.  As a responsible driver and for the satisfaction of his customers, he always has his documentation in order and is aware of his vehicle's defects.  When he started this job he was driving a motorcycle taxi that he rented.  This didn't produce much income, so he wasn't happy in that job.  Now he has been able to buy his vehicle and work for himself.  He has been working on his own for more than six years and it's going very well for him.

He likes his job a lot because he has fun, relaxes, and generates a daily income for his family.  He also has a lot of help from his wife, who's responsible for selling some products on the sidewalk of their house, which means an additional income for his finances.  Now he's thinking about being able to continue with the expansion of his business and increasing the merchandise.

This will be his fourteenth loan with MFP.  He's very happy to know he'll have financial support because this way he'll be certain of making progress with his business.  He's committed once again to making his payments punctually, as with his previous loans.  In addition, he likes being part of his communal bank because all the members are very responsible and supportive people.

With the requested amount of 1500 nuevos soles [PEN] he'll fix or change some parts on his motorcycle taxi.  He'll also buy fruit and groceries to continue selling from his house.

loans.use: to buy parts for his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan   es un hombre agricultor de 55  años de edad, el está casado  y  vive en Sololá.  El tiene ocho  hijos de ellos seis varones de la cual dos están casados uno  trabaja independientemente y  dos estudian en una escuela de la comunidad también  dos mujeres una está estudiando  y una quien apoyan en los oficios del hogar.

El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando cebolla, remolacha, papa, frijol   en parcelas que tiene  a pocos metros de su vivienda, esto lo aprendió de su padre desde pequeño posteriormente tuvo la oportunidad de trabajar con otras  personas aprendiendo a comercializar varios productos en el mercado.
Viendo la necesidad de crear su propio negocio decide cultivar y comercializar su propio producto con el apoyo de su familia para mejorar los ingresos económicos junto a un desarrollo familiar.
El ahora cuenta con 15 años de realizar su propio cultivo viendo que obtiene ganancias buenas cultivando estas verduras.   De este modo el solicita un préstamo de   Q 2,000.00 para que pueda comprar semillas de cebolla y su fertilizante para cultivar  y cosecharlo mejorando sus ingresos junto a su familia. 
El sueña que en un futuro el pueda emprender un nuevo comercio con el apoyo de su familia así como poder darles los estudios académicos a sus hijos que aun estudian, todo con el fin de tener un mejor desarrollo familiar.
texts.en:
Juan, 55, is a man who works in agriculture; he’s married and lives in Sololá.  He has 8 children, six boys of which two are married, one works independently and two attend a local school and two girls one of which attends school and one who helps with household chores.

He works in agriculture growing onions, beets, potatoes and beans on fields located a few meters from his house.  He learned this from his father when he was still little and later had the opportunity to work with other people learning to sell various products in the market.

Seeing the need to create his own business he decided to plant and sell his own products with support from his family to improve income and develop as a family.  He now has 15 years’ experience growing his own crops and earning good profits from them.  

He’s asking for a 2,000 Quetzal loan that will help him buy onion seeds and fertilizer for the crops to harvest them and improve his family income.  He dreams in future to start a new business with support from his family to provide his children who are still in school with good education aimed at better family development.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Paata

texts.en:
Paata is 27 years old. He lives in a small village of Sachkhere District, with his wife and parents. Paata requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family is engaged in agricultural activities on a very small scale. In particular, they have three milk cows and a 0.7-hectare plot of agricultural land. In addition, Paata works as an artisan and gets a monthly income. Together, they have hardly enough to provide food for the family of four. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Paata requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved, in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up Loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credit, with soft conditions, to country rural poor people who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Paata will purchase a minibus. After purchasing the minibus, he plans to trade in fruits and vegetables. He will buy fruits and vegetables from the wholesalers and resell them at higher prices. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up Loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus, for trading in fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Jabier

texts.es:
Jabier, de 37 años, es un hombre bueno y trabajador, esta casado con Linett de 35 años con quien tiene 02 hijos. Vive con ellos en su casa propia en donde trabaja mucho para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
El trabajo de Jabier  consiste en la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de productos regionales como plátano, arroz, yuca y otros. Tiene una chacra propia en donde trabaja a la tierra y lo prepara para tener los mejores frutos y productos en la temporada de cosecha, lleva 10 años trabajando con este negocio y aun recuerda que al principio padeció mucho al iniciar su actividad  ya que necesitaba de mucho esfuerzo, trabajo y paciencia, pudo realizar esta actividad con eficacia. Siente que es mucho mejor trabajar de manera independiente porque puede manejar su  horario.
En los momentos que va a su chacra tiene cuenta con la ayuda de algunas personas que contrata con  quienes se siente muy agradecido ya que le ayudan mucho en poder realizar bien su trabajo, le esta yendo bien ya que siente que cuando hace bien las cosas le da mucha satisfacción, ahora se preparara para poder realizar nuevos proyectos y así poder agrandar poco a poco su chacra. Este será el crédito número 12 con MFP, Por ello espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, esta muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy unidos y muy responsables.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 nuevos soles comprará abono, para fertilizar sus tierras, además de comprar palos de yuca para poder sembrar y así iniciar con una nueva producción.
texts.en:
Jabier, 37, is a good, hardworking man married to Linett, 35, with whom he has two children.  He lives with them in his own house where he works hard to provide them a better quality of life.

Jabier’s work is agriculture, specifically growing regional products like bananas, rice, manioc and others.  He has his own field where he works the soil and prepares it to produce better fruit and products during the harvest season.  He’s been working at this for 10 years and still remembers how at the beginning he went through many difficulties because the work requires much effort, work and patience; he was able to do the work efficiently and he feels that it’s much better to work independently because he’s able to set his own schedule.
