When he heads out to his fields he hires staff that he’s very grateful to because they help him quite a bit to do his work well.  He’s doing well and he gets much satisfaction out of a job well done.  Now, he’s preparing to do new projects to expand his fields little by little.  

This will be MFP loan #12 and he’s hoping for your collaboration to continue with his objectives.  He also commits once more to make his payments like he’s done previously.  He’s very happy to belong to his communal bank because they are all united and very responsible.  He will use the requested 1,500 new soles to buy manure to fertilize his fields and to buy some manioc plants to plant and start a new crop.

loans.use: to buy manure and manioc plants.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 43 years old, married, and has two children.

Adelaida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries, like soap, canned goods and soft drinks, to resell.

Adelaida has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Adelaida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like soap, canned goods and soft drinks.

loans.name: Eva's Group

texts.en:
Eva's group is made up of three hard working women. Eva is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past year, Eva has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells fresh food. 

To help expand her business, Eva has requested a loan of 200000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fresh food such as raw bananas to resell, and will help Eva generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young siblings. Eva hopes that in the future she will be able to give her younger sibling a better education. 

Eva is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh food such as raw bananas to resell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel, de 31 años, es una mujer amable y emprendedora, tiene muchos sueños e ilusiones que aun desea cumplir, es conviviente con Betman quien es negociante. Tienen 03 hijos de 18, 09  y 05 años, a quienes crían con mucho amor y es por quien día a día trabajan ya que desean brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. EL trabajo de Maribel consiste en la venta de kekes, gelatinas, flanes, arroz con leche y otros postres más que son de la delicia de sus múltiples clientes quienes se acercan a su puesto ubicado en un pequeño local del mercado de la ciudad, lleva realizando su trabajo por 6 años y en el transcurso del mismo aprendió que para tener a clientes fieles hay que brindarle un buen producto y sobre todo un trato especial y amable.
Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que solo se dedica por medio tiempo y el resto del día lo utiliza para poder estar en casa a lado de sus hijos a quienes tiene que apoyar mucho ya que se encuentran en edad que necesitan estar cerca de ellos; esto saca de los sabios consejos de su madre. Cuando se inicio en su negocio solo era ayudante de una persona que a veces la hacia trabajar por mucho tiempo y le pagaba poco, así que decidió emprender el trabajo sola y así puede tener sus propios ingresos que son muy buenos, espera seguir creciendo con lo que hace para mas adelante poner un puesto en algún otro lugar de la ciudad. Este será el sexto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero ya que le permitirá estar mas tranquila y avanzar con sus planes de su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual y sobre todo compenetrarse mas con los integrantes de su banco comunal que son muy solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 nuevos soles, comprará ingredientes, insumos y materiales para continuar con su trabajo ya que le gusta realizar su actividad con eficiencia.
texts.en:
Maribel, 31, is a kind, enterprising woman with many dreams and hopes still to reach.  She lives with Betman who is a merchant and she has three children who are 18, 9 and 5 years old who they raise with much love and for whom they work daily to provide with a better quality of life.

Maribel’s work consists in selling cakes, gelatin sweets, custards, rice pudding and other desserts that delight her many customers who come by her stand located in a small space in the city market.  She’s been in this business for six years and in this time has learned that to retain regular customers one must provide a good product but above all kind and special treatment.

She likes her work very much because she only does it half-time and spends the rest of the day at home with her children who she has to support much because they are that the age when they need her near; she learns this from her mother’s wise advice.

When she started her business she did so as an assistant to someone else who made her work much and paid her little so she decided to work for herself to earn her own income which is considerable.  She hopes to continue growing so that later on she can open a stand in another part of the city.

This will be MFP loan #6 and she’s very happy to know that she’ll have financial support that will give her more peace of mind and let her advance with her business plans.  She commits to make her payments punctually and become even more active with her fellow communal bank members who are very supportive.  She will use the requested 1,000 new soles to buy ingredients, supplies and materials to continue with her work because she likes to do her work efficiently.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
Mary, de 40 años es una valiente y emprendedora mujer, tiene 04 hijos a quienes brindo educación y crió hasta que ellos puedan ser independientes, ahora vive en su casa propia a lado de su esposo Emilio de 45 años y con quien tiene la fuerza para poder trabajar mucho y así tener una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Mary  consiste en dos actividades, la primera es el Wawa-wasi donde cuida a los niños de las madres solteras de su distrito, se dedica alimentarlos, los protege, es muy conocida en su vecindario por su amor  a los niños, por eso sus amigas y vecinas dejen en plena confianza en este Wawa-wasi a su pequeños hijos, a los quienes recogen después de su distintas labores.  Además de este negocio también vende productos por catálogos y siempre tiene un cosmético, perfume o crema que ofrecer a sus clientes, quienes son sus amigas y vecinas del vecindario.  Trabaja sola y lo lleva haciendo por más de 05 años.
Aun que su trabajo a veces le suele ser un poco pesado, ella sabe que tiene que brindarse al máximo para así poder tener mejores ganancias, aun que vende mucho a ella le gustaría poder tener mejores ingresos y aumentar sus ventas, desea seguir trabajando y así poder hacer crecer su negocio. Con el monto solicitado 800 soles, comprará algunos juguetes para los niños que atiende, además de cosmeticos para tener en stock.
texts.en:
Mary, who is 40, is a brave and enterprising woman. She has four children whom she provided with an education and raised until they could become independent. She currently lives in her own home with her husband Emilio, who is 45. In him she finds the strength to work hard in order to have a better quality of life.

Mary's work is twofold. Her first business is a nursery school, where she provides child-care for the single moms in her area. Her job is to feed them and protect them. She is very well-known in her neighborhood for her love of children, which is why her friends and neighbors rest assured leaving their little ones at this nursery school, where they pick them up after their work. 

Besides this business, she also sells products by catalog and always has a cosmetics item, a fragrance, or a lotion to offer her customers, who are her friends and neighbors. She works on her own and has been doing so for over five years. Even though her work is hard at times, she knows she has to do her best in order to have better earnings. She makes lots of sales, but she would like to increase them further and have better income. She wants to keep working so that she can expand her business.

She will use the requested amount to buy some toys for the children she takes care of, as well as to stock up on cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase some toys for the children she takes care of, as well as products to have in stock.

loans.name: Julia Clarita

texts.es: Julia vive en el cantón playas .Ella tiene 42 años , es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 17 años. A raíz de la separación de su ex pareja Toma la decisión de buscar trabajo  para que pueda terminar los estudios su hijo. Como nadie se la brindaba ella decide  juntar dinero  que tenia y dar apertura  a su negocio propio en general. En la actualidad su negocio poco a poco fue aumentando sus ventas hasta llegar a tener un buen negocio de ventas de productos. Julia todos los días se levanta 6 am. y va a visitar a sus clientes para así poder realizar los pedidos .Con el préstamo comprara ropa, bisutería, perfumes, etc. su meta es que su hijo termine la universidad  y sea un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Julia lives in the Playas Canton.  She is 42 years old, a single mother, and has a 17 year old son.  Following the separation from her ex life partner, she made the decision to look for work.  She did this so that her son would be able to finish his education.

As no one offered her work, she decided to get together the money she had in order to open her own business.  Her business was, little by little, increasing in sales.  It grew to the point that she now has a good business selling products.

Julia gets up at 6:00 a.m. every day.

She will use the loan to buy clothes, jewelry, and perfume, etc.  Her goal is for her son to finish at the university and that he becomes a good professional.

loans.use: to buy clothes, jewelry, and perfume, etc

loans.name: Mabel Patricia

texts.es: Mabel vive en el cantón playas .Ella tiene 28 años. Ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos  menores de edad.  Toma la decisión de buscar trabajo  para que puedan su hijos terminar de estudiar. Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar. Ella decide  juntar dinero  y dar apertura  a su negocio propio en general. En la actualidad su negocio poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener su negocio de ventas de artículos varios  bien surtidos. Mabel todos los días se levanta 6 am. Ella sale a dejar a sus hijos en la escuela, luego abre su negocio a las 8 a m .Con el préstamo comprara  ropa, Cd, varios etc. su meta es  tener ingreso para así poder  comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar  su negocio  y su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maribel lives in the Playas canton.  She is 28 years old, married, and has four minor children.  She made the decision to look for work so that her children could finish his education.  

As no one offered her work, she decided to get together the money she had in order to open her own business. Her business grew, little by little, until she had a varied assortment well-stocked.

Mabel gets up at 6:00 a.m. every day. She leaves her children at school, and she then opens her business at 8:00 a.m.

She will use the loan to buy clothes, CD’s, and varied items, etc.  Her goal is to have income to buy construction materials in order to improve her business and her house.

loans.use: to buy clothes, CD’s, and varied items, etc.

loans.name: Maria  Albertina

texts.es: María   vive en las orquídeas. Tiene 47años. Es divorciada. No tiene dos hijos ella a raíz de su divorcio  Toma la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguir  y salir adelante. Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. Ella decide juntar dinero  para dar apertura  a su negocio de comida rápida en general  En la actualidad su negocio poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  una clientela María trabaja diariamente  en su negocio sola, ella trabaja a las 6 am hasta las 3 p m. Con el préstamo comprara  productos de cocina, como platos, cucharas, adornos, cuchillos etc. su meta es mejorar  su vivienda  para atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María, 47, lives in Las Orquídeas.  She's divorced and has no children.  Because of her divorce she decided to look for work to continue getting ahead.  She wasn't getting the opportunity to work in a business, so she decided to get together the money to open her general fast-food business.  Currently her business has grown little by little until she had customers.  María works alone every day in her business from 6 a.m. until 3 p.m.

With the loan she's going to buy kitchen products such as plates, spoons, adornments, knives etc.

Her goal is to improve her house to better serve her customers.

loans.use: to buy kitchen products such as plates, spoons, knives. etc.

loans.name: Digna Angelica

texts.es: Digna  vive en las orquídeas. Tiene 65 años. Es soltera No tiene dos hijos ella Toma la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguir  y salir adelante. Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. Ella decide juntar dinero  para dar apertura  a su negocio de comida rápida en general  En la actualidad su negocio poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  una clientela necesaria digna trabaja diariamente  en su negocio sola, ella trabaja a las 6 am hasta las 2:30 p m. Con el préstamo comprara  productos de cocina, como cuchillos, cucharas, platos, etc. Su meta es mejorar  sus ingresos  para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Digna lives in Las Orquídeas.  She is 65 years old.  She is single and has no children.  She made the decision to look for work to keep going and get ahead.  As she could not find an opportunity for work in a business, she decided to raise some money to open a fast food business.  Her business is currently growing little by little to the point of having the clientele she needs.  Digna works every day at her business on her own.  She works from 6:00 a.m. to 2:30 p.m.  With this loan she will buy various kitchen products such as knives, spoons, and plates etc.  Her goal is to improve her income so she can improve her home.

loans.use: to buy kitchen products such as knives, spoons, and plates

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Santi Pala Group

texts.en:
Now the rainy season is approaching and the Santi Pala group are preparing to plant new crops. They are requesting a new loan to purchase watermelon seeds, cucumber seeds, chilli seeds, etc., as well as fertilizer. Some of the group members will also use the money to purchase piglets. 

I Wayan, 48, lives with his wife and one adult child. Besides using his portion of the loan for crops, he will also purchase piglets. He hopes both of his businesses can produce a maximum yield. He plans to use the profits to renovate his house and prepare for the Hindu holiday.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and piglets

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
This is Geraldine. She is very thankful for the loan that she previously acquired for it was such a great help for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She and her husband are working hand in hand to continuously provide income for their everyday expenses. She now have a canteen and she also sells onion and garlic for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. She also has a food stall and part of the loan will go to it. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s educational expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. She also has a food stall and she also sells garlic and onion for additional income.

Geraldine hopes to grow her business and dreams of having her own house and lot through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Lidia comprará cerdos los demás integrantes comprarán ropa, maíz, ingredientes para hacer platillos, bisutería, material para bordar y reces

loans.name: Roman Bartolome

texts.es:
Roman tiene 39 años de edad, pero tiene la alegria y las ganas de salir adelante de un joven de 20, su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de Santiago, Ica, Perú. el distrito de Santiago se caracteriza por tener un clima muy calido y aocgedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodon, pallares, esparragos, entre otros. Romasn vive al lado tambien de su pareja con quien tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad, el cual es muy travieso y jugueton y romasn lo quiere muchisimo ya que es el regalo mas importante que le ha dado Dios. Debido a sus pocos recursos economicos Roman solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, ´por ello trabaja mucho para darle a su hijo una buena educacion y que este sea mejor que el.

Dia a dia Roman trabaja como obrero en un fundo agricola, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al dia y el cree que  esta  saliendo adelnate en su trabajo porque es muy resposnable y sobre todo porque eas honrado.

Roman esta muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podra realizar mejoras en su vivienda en especial refaccionar las paredes, mejorar los pisos entre otros,ya que su vivienda es de abobe y en esta epoca de verano siempre este tipo de viviendas sufren rajaduras; de esta manera el podra brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y asi podra seguir luchando para hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:" DArle una buena educacion a su hijo".
texts.en:
Román is 39 years old but has the happiness and desire to get ahead of a young man of 20.  His house is located in the district of Santiago, Ica, Peru.  Santiago is known for having a warm and welcoming climate, as well as for agricultural development, especially cotton, butter beans, asparagus, and other crops.

Román lives with his wife, with whom he has a six-year-old child who is very mischievous and playful.  Román loves him very much because he's the most important gift that God has given him.  Because of his scarce financial resources Román was only able to study up to the fifth grade of his secondary education, so he works a lot to give his child a good education so he can be better than Román.

Every day Román works as a farm laborer.  He works about nine hours a day.  He believes he's getting ahead with his job because he's very responsible and above all because he's honest.

Román's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to make improvements on his house, especially repair the walls, improve the floors, and other repairs.  His house is made of adobe and during the summer this type of house suffers cracks.  This way he'll be able to give his family a better quality of life, and he'll be able continue striving to make his biggest dream a reality: "To give his son a good education."

loans.use: to improve his house

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
This is Marites, 27, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Jaycee, a porter and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Marites maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php2000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php12, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marites hopes to have her own stall and dreams to have their own house and lot. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Crecencio

texts.es:
En la cálida ciudad de Pucallpa, en la cual encontramos atractivos turísticos hermosos, Crescencio, quien tiene 58 años y el cual es un hombre muy trabajador, sobre todo tiene una familia a la cual quiere mucha, ya que su esposa y sus 3 hijos son el regalo más grande que Dios le haya podido dar. Crecencio aprendió a trabajar desde muy joven ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos y tuvo la necesidad de apoyarlos, es por ello que solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Ingeniería Civil. 

Día a día Crecencio trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas gaseosas y cervezas,  el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 25 cliente en el día; él cree que está saliendo adelante porque tiene variedad en sus productos y asimismo atiende de manera amable a sus clientes.

Crecencio está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como bebidas gaseosas y cervezas al por mayor, así tendrá mayor variedad de productos y podrá mejorara sus ingresos y de esta manera el seguirá luchado para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa de material noble”.
texts.en:
In the warm city of Pucallpa, where one can find beautiful tourist attractions such as Huacachina Lake, lives Creciendo, who is 58 years old. He is a very hardworking man who loves his family very much. His wife and three children are the greatest gift God could have given him. 

Creciendo learned to work when he was very young, because his parents had limited resources and he needed to support them. Therefore, he could only study until the fifth grade of secondary school, but he would have liked to study Civil Engineering.

Day to day, Creciendo works in his small business selling snacks, soda and beer. He works for about ten hours and serves up to 25 clients per day. He believes that he is successful because he has a variety of products and because he serves his clients in a friendly manner.

Creciendo is very grateful for the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help, he will be able to buy merchandise for his business, such as wholesale soda and beer. He will then have a greater variety of products and he will be able to improve his earnings. In this way, he will continue fighting to make his dream a reality: to finish building his home with quality materials.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (soda and beer).

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
This is Raquel.  She previously accessed a loan (50,000 PHP) to buy wood, hinges, and other materials for her modular business.  Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child, for their personal household expenses, and for their business expenditures.  She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.  

Raquel is now in the water refilling business for additional income.  She would like to apply for another loan in the same amount to buy more wood, hinges, materials, and gallons of water for refilling.  Her profits will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and to pay for the educational expenses of her child.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.  Raquel hopes to have more customers and to expand her business.  She also dreams of giving her child a good education and a good life.  Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups which are composed of 15-30 community partners.  These groups meet on a weekly basis to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy wood, hinges, and gallons of water.

loans.name: Amalya

texts.en:
Amalya is 20 years old and lives in Uyts village with her husband and grandmother. 

Amalya is involved in agriculture. She keeps cows and chickens, and also owns agricultural land where she grows nut, apple, and pear trees. She gets milk, which she uses in cheese production. Then, with the help of her husband, Amalya sells that cheese in local markets. 

As the only source of income for this family is agriculture, Amalya works hard to gather high income and cover the family's daily costs. Unfortunately, it is very difficult for her to sustain the family and at the same time cover operational costs, so Amalya has applied for this loan. 

With the help of the loan, Amalya will purchase forage for feeding the livestock and will be able to save more money for the family's well being.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Nuvy Grace

texts.en:
Nuvy Grace is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling fruits in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Nuvy Grace is borrowing 40,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Nuvy Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock and firewood retail businesses. Juanita is borrowing 17,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Juanita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a woman of forty years. She is married to Samuel and is a mother of five children. She operates a retail shop in Limuru and has been doing so for twelve years now. She gets a monthly income of KES 20,000.

This will be Alice’s tenth loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to pay school fees for her children. 

In the future, she wants to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Merci

texts.es:
Merci, de 40 años, es una muy buena y amable mujer, es conviviente con su Alcides quien se dedica a la agricultura, junto a el son padres de una niña de 5 años, y es por quien a diario trabajan mucho y sacrifican muchas cosas para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.

El trabajo de Merci consiste en la venta de bebidas, a diario el camión repartidor la visita para saber cuantas c ajas o packs de bebidas desea para el día, ella como es una mujer negociante y siempre tiene visión de salir adelante solo pide lo principal ya que no desea tener su inversión estancada por mucho tiempo, así es como todos los días ella realiza su actividad en la cual lleva más de 05 años y le sirve para poder distraerse al mismo tiempo que genera buenos ingresos a su familia.
Le esta yendo muy bien en lo que hace ya que tiene buenas ventas y a diario se acercan cada vez mas clientes, desde que empezó a crecido mucho ya que al principio vendía solo unas cajas semanales, mientras que ahora que se abasteció de diferentes presentaciones, sabores, tamaños y es así como tiene mas ventas y con lo mismo mejores sus ganancias, tiene como meta seguir creciendo hasta poder tener su mini distribuidora. Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará bebidas en mayor cantidad ya que por la época de calor en la zona tiene mas ventas y desea estar preparada para poder abastecerse.
texts.en:
Merci, 40, is a very good and friendly woman.  She lives with Alcides, who makes a living in agriculture.  Together they're the parents of a little girl, 5, for whom they work a lot every day.  They sacrifice a lot to be able to give her a better quality of life.

Merci's job is selling beverages.  Every day the delivery truck visits her to find out how many cases or packs of beverages she wants for the day.  She's a businesswoman, so she always has the idea of getting ahead.  She only requests the main things because she doesn't want for her investment to get bogged down for a long time.  This is how she carries out her job every day.  She has done it for more than five years and she has fun at the same time it generates income for her family.

It's going very well for her in her work because she has good sales and more customers every day.  She has grown a lot since she began because in the beginning she sold only a few cases weekly, whereas she has more sales and more profits now that she supplies herself with various presentations, flavors, and sizes.  Her goal is to continue growing until she can have a small distributorship.

With the requested amount of 3000 soles [PEN] she'll buy beverages in bulk because she has more sales in the region's hot season and she wants to be ready to be able to stock up.

loans.use: to buy beverages

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Casa y con 36 años Elisa junto a Antonio comparten una vida conyugal prospera con 4 hijos menores aún. Son propietarios de una vivienda construida a base de madera en la localidad de Kimbiri Región Cusco.

Desde niña fue instruida en actividades concernientes a la producción de cacao orgánico junto a sus padres  en unas parcelas cuya propiedad fue  de sus abuelos.
Lleva 20 años desempeñándose de manera independiente junto a su esposo Antonio llegando en ocasiones a convocar el apoyo de jornaleros para actividades pesadas ya sean deshierbo o cosecha.
Todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano y luego de enviar a sus hijos al colegio procede a dirigirse a sus parcelas retornando en horas del atardecer.
Le agrada mucho su actividad puesto que tiene el orgullo de seguir con las costumbres familiares de producción.
Cada campaña realiza una revisión de sus parcelas en cuanto a plantaciones vigentes y desfasadas se trata hallando actualmente varios árboles desfasados a ser reemplazados con la técnica del injertado para el cual debe contar con capital.
Sus planes para el futuro apuntan a la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble para el bienestar de sus hijos. Requiere contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la adquisición de plantas de almácigo así como de guano de aves para luego contratar a jornaleros y reemplazar plantas de cacao desfasados a través del injertado.
texts.en:
Elisa is 36 years old and married to Antonio. They live prosperously together and have four minor children. They own a house made out of wood, located in Kimbiri, in the Cusco region.

As a child she was trained on how to produce organic cocoa beans along with her parents on several pieces of land that belonged to her grandparents. She has been working independently with her husband for twenty years, and sometimes they hire laborers to help with heavy work such as weeding and harvesting.

She gets up very early each morning and after sending her kids to school she goes to her land and comes back at dusk. She really enjoys her work because she is proud to continue her family's production methods. 

Every season she inspects her land for plants that may have outgrown their useful cycle. Currently she has found several trees in this condition that must be replaced by grafting technique. She needs capital in order to do this. 

Her plans for the future go towards rebuilding her home with higher quality materials for her children's wellbeing. 

She needs to have 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase mastic trees as well as bird guano, and later hire laborers and replace old cocoa trees through grafting.

loans.use: to buy mastic trees and bird guano, and later hire workers.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. She has 3 children and has been doing this work for 4 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'she loves milking and it gives her great joy doing it!' Her biggest challenge is the high price of inputs and lack of feed during the dry seasons. She will use the loan to buy poultry birds.

Gladys was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'she got news about Juhudi from other clients around her place.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'She learnt more about loans and how to invest wisely.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Gladys replied 'She will be able to educate her children and feed her family.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Gladys owns the following: cow, poultry, and bicycle, but does not own a pig, pump, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Sirere

texts.en:
Sirere is 42 years old and blessed with five children. He is a livestock trader in Narok and has been running the business for the past two years making a monthly income of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

He has borrowed first loan of 50,000 KES from KADET Ltd. with which he intends to purchase more livestock for resale. The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost business.

His future dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale

loans.name: Gulo

texts.en:
Gulo is 38 years old and from the Baghdati district. She lives with her husband, 2 sons, and mother-in-law, who is provided with a retirement pension. Her husband works as an artisan and gets a monthly income. 

The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a vineyard with 250 samples of vine trees. They sell wine locally at a good price. Gulo is very hardworking woman and does her best to insure a good harvest. She requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow. After purchasing a milk cow, she will produce cheese and sell it locally. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. Gulo awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo, in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past two years, Veronica has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells basic commodities, such as milk, bread, sugar and soap. 

To help her expand her business, Veronica has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to purchase inventory in greater quantity to resell in her shop. This use of the loan will help Veronica to generate greater profits, and to pay school fees for her young brother. Veronica hopes that, in the future, she will be able to work hard to see that she pays her brother's school fees, up to university. 

Veronica is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as milk, bread, sugar and soap, for resale

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a man of 61 years, married to Hannah and a father of four children. He is a dairy farmer and also has rental houses. He has been in this business for twenty years now; he gets a monthly income of 70,000 shillings.

This will be Paul's seventh loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy animal feed and build another room for rental. 

In the future, Paul wants to build his family a permanent house.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the dairy cows.

loans.name: Patrocena

texts.en:
Patrocena is 75 years old and a widow with six children.

Patrocena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Patrocena has been in this business for 21 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es: Olga, tiene 38 años de edad, es soltera, vive con una hermana en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Ella trabajo por muchos años en una empresa privada y luego quedo sin empleo, pero hace un año decidió establecer su propio negocio de venta de comidas, golosinas y refrescos. Este negocio lo tiene establecido en el centro de la cuidad y ofrece a sus clientes comida tipo bufet en el almuerzo y desayunos. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 lempiras y lo va invertir en su negocio para comprar los insumos que necesita a diario para la elaboración de comidas como ser: carnes, harina, manteca, condimentos, vegetales, refrescos, arroz etc. su plan es crecer con el negocio y en un futuro abrir otro comedor para obtener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Olga is 38 years old and single.  She lives with her sister in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.  She worked for a private company for many years.  Later on she was left without a job.  However, a year ago she decided to establish her own business of selling food, candy, and soft drinks.  She has her business set up in the center of the city.  She offers her customers buffet style breakfasts and lunches.

She will use the 10,000 lempira loan she is requesting to buy the supplies she needs every day to make the food.  She will buy things like meat, flour, shortening, condiments, vegetables, soft drinks, and rice, etc.  Her plan is to grow in the business and to, in the future, open another eatery in order to get more income.

loans.use: to buy supplies like meat, flour, shortening, condiments, vegetables, soft drinks, and rice, etc. in order to make food.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El Comité " Virgen de Fátima ", es un comité con 10 integrantes, se encuentran en el segundo ciclo. Todas son mujeres trabajadoras y humildes, el comité está situado en el barrio virgen de Fátima, es por eso que lleva ese nombre.
Una de estas mujeres es la señora Basilia, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas de segunda mano, con lo que tiene los medios necesarios para mantener y dar a su familia lo que necesitan. Ella tiene como meta tener muchas mas prendas que poder ofrecer a sus clientes, es por eso que solicita de este crédito, para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de todo tipo para revender.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Fátima communal bank has 10 members in their second loan cycle.  All are hardworking and modest women.  The bank is located in the Virgen de Fátima neighborhood, which is why the bank has that name.

One of these women is Basilia.  She makes a living selling used clothing, with which she has the means necessary to support her family and give them what they need.

Her goal is to have many more garments to offer to her customers, so she's requesting this loan to be able to invest in buying all types of clothing for resale.

loans.use: to buy used clothing

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy  vive en las orquídeas. Tiene 46 años. Es divorciada  y tiene dos hijos. Ella a raíz de su separación de su ex pareja  tomo  la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguir  adelante con los estudios de sus hijos. Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. Ella  decide juntar dinero que tenia  para dar apertura  a su negocio que es tienda y bazar  En la actualidad sus  ventas poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  clientela  necesaria. Nancy  trabaja diariamente sola. Ella  trabaja  desde la mañana  en su negocio  .Con el préstamo  el  comprara arroz , aceite ,  varios, etc. su meta es poder terminar su casa que su tienda  sea más grande.
texts.en: Nancy lives in Las Orquídeas.  She’s 46-years-old, divorced and has two children.  As a result of her separation from her ex-spouse she decided to seek work to continue forward with her children’s education.  Since no one in a firm would hire her, she decided to use money she’d saved to open her business which is a grocery and general store.  Her sales have gradually increased and now she has the necessary clientele.  Nancy works daily alone.  She works from early in the morning.  She will use the loan to buy rice, oil, etc.  Her goal is to finish building her house and that her store is larger.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Corazon De Maria Group

texts.es:
“Corazón de María” Actualmente se encuentran  en el segundo  ciclo, con once integrantes. El grupo empezó, demostrando unión y solidaridad entre las compañeras; quienes ya cuentan con sus actividades productivas y su ahorro correspondiente.
María es la presidenta de este grupo, y cuenta que su grupo trabaja mucho por salir adelante y dar a sus familias todo lo que puedan, ella por su parte se dedica a las ventas, tiene una pequeña despensa bien surtida con todo tipo de productos. Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar leche, pan, queso, verduras, frutas y demás productos para poder surtir su negocio y seguir trabajando.
texts.en: “Corazón de María” is currently in its second cycle with 11 members.  The group started with unity and solidarity among the members who have productive activities and corresponding savings.  María is the group president and she relates that the group works hard to get ahead and provide everything possible for their families.  On her part, she works in sales.  She has a small grocery store well-stocked with all types of products.  She’s requesting this loan to buy milk, bread, cheese, vegetables, fruit and other products to stock her store and continue working.

loans.use: to buy milk, bread, cheese, vegetables, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of five children in Talibon, Bohol. She has been running a sari-sari or variety store business for more than nine years now. She sells various goods and items to the people in her place. 

Ma. Gina needs a loan for the expansion of her business. With this intent, she joined CEVI to apply for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, corn grits, sodas and other  beverages, soap and toiletries, etc. With this, she will be able to attract and cater for more customers in her store.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, corn grits, sodas and other beverages, soap and toiletries, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a single woman, aged 61 years now. She is still in poultry keeping in Kiambu, and she has been doing this for the past three years. She earns a monthly income of KES 28,000 from the sale of poultry.

This will be Elizabeth’s second loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy chicks to rear, and chicken feed. She wants to be a more successful business woman in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

Myrna requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items for inventory, like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items for inventory, like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Mkamba

texts.en:
Mkamba is a 60-year-old married man. He has two children, ages 27 and 34 years. He describes himself to be a goal-oriented man. 

Mkamba operates a farm where he sells farm products. He has been involved in this business for thirty years and employs five staff members. His business is located at an agricultural area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a poor road network. 

Mkamba will use the KES 8,700 loan to buy a water tank that will be used by his family members. 

His business goal is to improve his business within five years. Mkamba hopes that in the future, he will expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Maritza Felicia

texts.es: Maritza vive en las orquídeas. Tiene 33 años. Es viuda y tiene dos hijos. Ella a raíz de su viudez ella tomo  la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguir  adelante con los estudios de sus hijos. Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. Ella  decide juntar dinero que tenia  para dar apertura  a su negocio de venta de ropa  En la actualidad sus  ventas poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  clientela  necesaria  Maritza  trabaja diariamente sola. Ella  trabaja  desde la mañana  .Con el préstamo  el  comprara ropa, arreglos,  varios, etc. su meta es poder terminar su casa que su negocio  sea más grande.
texts.en: Maritza lives in Las Orquídeas.  She’s 33-years-old and has two children.  Due to her widowhood she decided to seek work to continue with her children’s schooling.  Since no one would hire her to work in a firm, she decided to use her savings to open a clothing business.  Her sales have gradually grown and now she has the required clientele.  Maritza works by herself every day starting very early.  She will use the loan to buy clothes and various merchandise.  Her goal is to be able to finish her house and that her business is larger.

loans.use: to buy clothes and assorted merchandise.

loans.name: Jessica Virginia

texts.es: Jessica vive en las orquídeas. Tiene 33 años. Es soltera y tiene tres  hijos. Ella a raíz de su separación de su ex pareja  ella tomo  la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguir  adelante con los estudios de sus hijos. Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. Ella  decide juntar dinero que tenia  para dar apertura  a su negocio de venta de cosméticos  En la actualidad sus  ventas poco a poco  han ido creciendo  hasta llegar a tener  clientela  necesaria  Jessica  trabaja diariamente sola. Ella  trabaja  desde la mañana en diferentes  horarios .Con el préstamo  el  comprara , ropa ,cosméticos ,  varios, etc. su meta es poder  terminar su casa .
texts.en: Jessica lives in Las Orquídeas.  She’s 33-years-old, single and has three children.  As a result of her separation from her ex-spouse she decided to seek employment to continue forward with her children’s education.  Since no one would hire her to work in a firm, she decided to use the money she had to open a business selling cosmetics.  Her sales have been growing gradually until she had the required clientele.  Jessica works by herself every day.  She starts early in the morning with various schedules.  She will use the loan to buy clothes, cosmetics, assorted merchandise, etc.  Her goal is to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a 53-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 7 years to 28 years. She describes herself to be a focused and determined woman. 

Rehema operates a farm where she sells maize, beans, peas, etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located at an agricultural area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Rehema will use the KES 11,100 loan to buy a water tank that will be used by her family members for household chores. This is her seventh loan with SMEP DTM after taking a previous loan of KES 100,000, which she managed to pay successfully.

Her business goal is to buy land so as to increase her farming business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have diversified her business into livestock farming.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El comité San Roque es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, tiene 11 miembros, donde toda trabajan y se esfuerzan al máximo para poder ir creciendo en el emprendimiento de cada una.
Epifania es una de estas mujeres, ella trabaja de limpiadora y también en su casa se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral. Con estos trabajos ayuda a su familia, y tiene todo lo que necesita. Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y ser mejor cada día.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, y de esta forma poder  seguir criando y alimentando a sus animales.
texts.en:
The San Roque communal bank is located in the city of Curuguaty.  It has 11 members, all of whom work and put forth maximum effort in order to be able to grow in each of their endeavors.

Epifania is one of these women.  She works as a cleaner.  She also raises and sells farmyard animals at her house.  It is with these jobs that she helps her family and has everything she needs.  She is a person with a great desire to get ahead and to improve each day.

She is requesting a loan to buy balanced feed for her animals.  This way she will be able to continue raising and feeding her animals.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is still in her retail business selling charcoal, a business that has enabled her not only to gain much experience but also to move her family forward. She is a dedicated woman with very many goals to achieve. She struggles to ensure that she reaches success. 

Dama says that since she invested her previous loan, her business has been growing and today she counts on a good number of clients and an improved income. Dama needs to stock her store with more merchandise but she lacks enough working capital. It is this sole reason that made Dama request a new loan.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Sarah is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo, in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past year, Sarah has been working hard to manage her small business; she sells clothes. 

To help her expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young siblings. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to give a better education to her young siblings. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is 33 years old and married, with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rona is borrowing PHP 13,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rona has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from fish-vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jumanne

texts.en:
Jumanne is a 52-year-old married man. He has seven children with ages ranging from 3 years to 28 years. He describes himself to be a focused man. He operates a water retail business where he sells water to the community. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located at a very productive area and his primary customers are local residents. 

Jumanne describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate storage facility of water for selling. He will use the Kes 32,700 loan to buy a water tank that will be used for storing water for selling to the community. His business goal is to improve his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business by having at least three more water retail business outlets.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 57 years old, married, and has eight children.  One of them is in school.

Victoria is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Victoria has been raising pigs for 10 years, and she has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Victoria would like to save money in the future, to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married and has 11 children. She has received no formal education. Ama sells palm oil in Bremawg, near Abura, and has done so for sometime now. Her husband is a farmer. Ama uses her income to support her husband with their large family’s expenses. 

Ama will use the loan to purchase more palm fruits for the making of palm oil, a staple ingredient in Ghana. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to grow her business and be able to save more to secure her enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruits for the making of palm oil, a staple ingredient in Ghana.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick  is a 50-year-old, married man. He has five children, with ages ranging from 6 years to 20 years. He describes himself to be a warm and caring man. He operates a retail store where he sells iron sheets, timber, and cement. He has been involved in this business for three years and employs two staff members. His business is located near a busy, popular hotel and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices of cement and timber. 

He will use the KES 11,100 loan to buy a water tank that will be used by his family members. His business goal is to run a well-stocked hardware store within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will have expanded his business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to be used by his family.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. He has two children. Benard has been farming for 10 years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, and a salary from a job.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "It gives me profit that helps me to meet my needs." His biggest challenge is: "Lack of markets for our produce." Animals on the farm have been given the names of Sandimu and Nyasero. 

Benard will use the loan to construct a dairy housing unit for his animals. Benard was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Easy rules both before and after the loan."  This client was also asked what he had learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, and he said, "This loans helps improve our living standard."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan would benefit his family, Benard replied, "It will help me purchase another dairy cow, hence improving our lives."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Benard owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile.' Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, TV' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, DVD.'

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit for his cows.

loans.name: Nazi

texts.en:
Nazi lives in the Kobuleti District. She is 64 years old and lives with her husband, grown son, daughter-in-law, and three grandchildren. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have three calves and a milk cow whose milk is used in cheese products. In addition, Nazi owns a cornfield and a plot of land where nuts are grown. The harvested products are sold at the local open market. Nazi and her husband are provided with a retirement pension. 

Several times, Nazi has requested loans from local credit providers, but her loan requests are always rejected because of the lack of experience in new business. Her current loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. 

With the received credit, Nazi will start up a fast-food café.  She will sell sandwiches, pies, and fizzy drinks. Nazi hopes her business will be profitable and that she will attract many customers since there is no similar café nearby. The profit will be reinvested in the same business and Nazi will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to start up a fast-food cafe.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama, 46 years old, earns her living selling Mnazi (a local brew). She lives in the suburban area of Kisauni, Mombasa.

Dama is very anxious to get ahead. She wants to be a great micro-businesswoman. Thanks to her small business, Dama is bringing in more income and helping out the family. She has a large clientele, and through her work she'll manage to improve her house and help her husband with the income. Dama needs this loan to buy gallons of mnazi to sell.

loans.use: to buy gallons of mnazi to sell.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 43 years old, married, and has four children. Three of her children are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Vivian runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery products to sell. She has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items, such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

Vivian would like to save money to expand her business, and continue to send her children to college, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to resell in her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 50-year-old married woman supporting her two children, both aged 18 years old.  She has been selling fresh milk door-to-door in Kapsabet for six years, earning an income of KES 25,000.

For her seventh loan, Mary has borrowed KES 75,000 from KADET LTD. She has repaid her previous loan successfully and intends to use this one to pay her milk suppliers. Mary will use any profits she earns to pay school fees for her children and to improve her family's living standards. Her dream is to ensure her children have a good future.

loans.use: To pay her milk suppliers

loans.name: Lorena  Alba

texts.es: Alba  vive en las orquídeas. Tiene 31 años. Es soltera y tiene cuatro   hijos menores de edad. Ella a raíz de su separación de su ex pareja  ella tomo  la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguir  adelante con los estudios de sus hijos. Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. Ella  decide juntar dinero que tenia  para dar apertura  a su negocio de comida rápida En la actualidad su negocio  poco a poco  han ido creciendo  hasta llegar a tener  clientela  necesaria  alba trabaja diariamente desde la mañana  hasta la noche. Con el préstamo  el  comprara, Legumbres, carnes, granos, etc. su meta es  seguir trabajando en su propio negocio.
texts.en: Alba lives in the Las Orquídeas. She is 31 years old. She is single and has four dependent children.  Upon separating from her ex-partner, she made the decision to seek work to further her children’s studies. Since no one gave her the opportunity to work in a business, she decided to save up her money to open a fast food business.  Her business has been growing little by little to the point where she now has regular customers.  Alba works daily from morning until night.  With the loan, she will buy vegetables, meat, and grains.  Her goal is to continue working in her own business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat and grains.

loans.name: Edison Gonzalo

texts.es: Edison  vive en las orquídeas. Tiene 34 años. Es soltero y no  tiene hijos. El tomo  la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguir  adelante con los estudios. Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. El  decide juntar dinero que tenia  para dar apertura  a su negocio es ebanistería En la actualidad su negocio  poco a poco  han ido creciendo  hasta llegar a tener  clientela  necesaria  Edison  trabaja diariamente   desde la mañana  . Con el préstamo  el  comprara, tablas, caña, pintura,  varios, etc. su meta es  seguir trabajando y mejorar su taller y la casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Edison lives in Las Orquídeas (a suburb of Guayaquil, Ecuador). He is 34 years old, single, and doesn’t have any children. He decided to look for a job as he wanted to continue with his studies. As no one would take him on to work in a business, he decided to gather the money he had and use it to open his own woodworking business. 

The business has been growing gradually and he now has a regular clientele. He works every day starting in the morning. With the loan he plans to buy boards, canes, paint etc. His goal is to continue with the business, and make improvements to his workshop and his parents’ house.

loans.use: buy boards, canes, paint etc.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is a widow and has three children. She has received no formal education. Yaa sells provisions in Bremawg, near Abura, and has done so for some time, now. She uses her income to support her children. 

Yaa will use the loan to buy more provisions, increasing the quantity and variety of the inventory for sale at her store. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yaa plans to increase her capital base so she will be able to buy more provisions for sale in the future.

loans.use: to buy more provisions, increasing the quantity and variety of the inventory for sale at her store.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine, 37 years old, is married and has 6 children. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. Irine operates a farm where she sells farm products such as cereals, etc. She has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs 3 staff members. Her business is located in a very productive area and her primary customers are traders from the nearby market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor road networks.

Irine will use this KES 11,100 loan to buy a water tank to be used by her family members. Her business goal is to improve her farming by using modern agricultural technology within 5 years. Irine hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 26 years old, single, and supports no one. He owns a retail shop selling essential goods in Kapsabet and has been in the business for a period of one year, earning a monthly income of KES. 5,000.

He is servicing his second loan from KADET LTD of KES. 40,000 and he intends to use this amount to purchase washing detergents, sugar, rice, cooking fat and tea leaves for resale.

The anticipated profit will be used to purchase a motorbike to enable him to start a transportation business. His dream is to be successful in his business and live happily.

loans.use: To purchase  more stock of washing detergents, sugar, rice, cooking fat and tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Violet's Group

texts.en:
Violet's group is comprised of three hard-working women. Violet is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past two years, Violet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, milk and bread. 

To help expand her business, Violet has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential goods like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale, and will help Violet to generate greater profits and pay for her own school fees. Violet hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Violet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more essential goods like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bongo.

loans.name: Virgen De Lourdes Group

texts.es:
El comité  Virgen de Lourdes, se conformo con la iniciativa de la señora Bernardina que se mostró muy interesada por el programa. Este comité se encuentra en el primer ciclo, y están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas.
La totalidad de este grupo está emprendiendo en la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, patos, cerdos, cabras y demás. Es un trabajo muy sacrificado, pero lo hacen para poder ayudar a sus familias.
Saturnina, una de las integrantes, solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de alimentos para sus animales, ya que quiere seguir cuidándolos bien y venderlos.
texts.en:
The group "Virgen de Lourdes" was formed because of Mrs. Bernardina, who became interested in the program. This group is in its first cycle and its members are learning to work together.

All this group’s members raise and sell farm animals, like hens, ducks, pigs and goats. It is a demanding job, but they do it in order to be able to help their families.

Saturnina, one of the group’s members, is requesting this loan to invest in feed for her animals. She wants to continue taking good care of them and then sell them.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is taking out a new loan to expand her existing business, selling local brew. In addition to this business, thanks to her effort and the previous loan, she was able to start another business selling fried potatoes. She says that both businesses are doing well and her desire is to see herself have a prosperous future. Rehema is asking for this loan to buy gallons of local brew and at the same time buy sacks of raw potatoes for sale.

loans.use: to buy gallons of local brew and at the same time buy sacks of raw potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Adjao

texts.en:
Adjao sells 'banku', a local favorite food made of ground corn and cassava. Adjao sells banku in Bremawg near Abura, where she lives with her husband and four children.  Her husband is a farmer. 

Adjao has received no formal education.  However, she has been preparing banku for sale for some time now. She is responsible for helping her husband with their family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy to by more corn and cassava to prepare banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to improve and expand her banku-making trade.

loans.use: to buy more corn and cassava to prepare 'banku' for sale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer. Aba has no formal education. She sells doughnuts in Bremawg near Abura, which she has done for several years now. 

Aba uses her income to help her husband with the general upkeep of their family. Aba will use the loan to buy more flour, sugar and other necessary ingredients to make doughnuts for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to invest money back into her doughnut making business, to expand and meet the community’s demand for her tasty treats.

loans.use: to buy more flour, sugar and other necessary ingredients to make doughnuts for sale.

loans.name: Nvard

texts.en:
Nvard lives in Ararat village, with her husband and two children. Nvard owns agricultural land, where she grows apple, plum and apricot trees, and cultivates wheat. She works hard to gather a good harvest and have high income. But, unfortunately, the monthly income is hardly enough to cover her family's basic costs and sustain it. So Nvard has applied for this loan, to purchase wheat seeds and cover cultivation costs, to grow more wheat. This will significantly help Nvard to increase her income.

The loan is very important for Nvard to be able to ensure a better life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds and cover cultivation costs, which will enable her to grow more wheat and obtain more income.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is single and has no children. She has received no formal education. She sells wakye in Bremawg, near Abura, which she has done for several years.

Wakye is a traditional rice dish in Ghana, made of rice, beans and red leaves; it is normally eaten with a spicy tomato salad, fish, or macaroni pasta. 

Yaa uses her income to support herself and take care of her personal expenses. Yaa will use the loan to purchase more beans, rice and red leaves to use in preparing wakye to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yaa plans to further expand her wakye making trade.

loans.use: to purchase more beans, rice and red leaves to use in preparing the local dish, wakye.

loans.name: Lorena Marianela

texts.es: Lorena  vive en las orquídeas. Tiene 37 años. Es viuda y tiene tres hijos menores de edad. Ella a raíz de su viudez tomo  la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguir  adelante con los estudios de sus hijos. Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. Ella  decide juntar dinero que tenia  para dar apertura  a su negocio es tienda En la actualidad su negocio  poco a poco  han ido creciendo  hasta llegar a tener  clientela  necesaria  Lorena  trabaja diariamente   desde la mañana  . Con el préstamo  el  comprara, colas, lechugas,  varios, etc. su meta es  seguir trabajando y mejorar su casa
texts.en: Lorena lives in Las Orquídeas (The Orchids). She is 37 years old. She is a widow and has three grown children. As a result of becoming a widow, she decided to look for work so that she could continue paying for the education of her children. Since she was not offered work by any of the businesses where she looked, she decided to save up money to be able to open her own small store. Her business has grown little by little and now has the necessary clientele. Lorena works everyday, starting in the morning. She will use the loan to buy sodas, lettuce and other things. Her goals are to continue working and to make improvements on her home.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, lettuce and other things.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El. Sr. Juan es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, es soltero, y tiene como profesión la  mecánica de automóviles liviano, hace mas de 15 años que se dedica a esto, y gracias al buen trabajo que hace ya tiene una clientela bien definida que siempre acude a él.
Su deseo es poder seguir trabajando y el día de mañana ir agrandando su negocio para tener una mayor capacidad para recibir a más autos y tener mayores ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Solicita su primer crédito que quiere destinar a la compra de un equipo de soldar que le será de extrema utilidad en su labor y que le ayudará a tener mayores clientes.
texts.en:
Juan is from the city of Curuguaty and is single.  He works as an auto mechanic and has more than 15 years in this profession.  Thanks to the high-quality work he does, he has built up a solid base of clients who always come to him.

He wants to be able to continue working and expand his business so that he will have the capacity to repair more vehicles and thus increase his income so he can help his family.

He is seeking his first loan, which he wishes to use to buy soldering equipment.  This will be extremely useful in his work and will allow him to gain more clients.

loans.use: to buy soldering equipment for his auto shop.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Mujeres Emprendedoras” está en su primer ciclo y están aprendiendo el valor de trabajar en equipo y ayudarse las unas a las otras. Una de estas mujeres es Soraida, quien tiene una modesta, pero bien surtida despensa, que con el correr de los años quiere agrandar y tener una grande.
Su sueño es poder seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia como lo viene haciendo. Es por eso que solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de carne, embutidos, verduras, leches y demás insumos para poder tener bien surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
The committee “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Entrepreneurial Women) is in its first cycle and the members are experiencing the value of working as a team and helping each other. One of these women is Soraida, who owns a small but well stocked shop, which she would like to grow over the years and turn into a big one.
Her aspiration is to be able to carry on working and helping her family, as she has been doing until now. It is for this reason that she is applying for this loan, in order to invest it in the purchase of meat, sausages, vegetables, milk and other basic foods, so that her business may have a good assortment of products.

loans.use: to buy meat, sausages, vegetables, milk etc.

loans.name: Adjao

texts.en:
Adjao sells rice in Bremawg, near Abura. Adjao has received no formal education. She is single and has no children. 

Adjao has been selling rice for many years. She is responsible for supporting herself and taking care of her personal expenses. Her loan will be used to buy a larger quantity of rice for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business, part to save, and part to invest back into her business.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of rice for resale.

loans.name: Angel Javier

texts.es:
Angel es un joven de 20 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Santiago, el cual se caracteriza por su clima cálido además de desarrollarse la agricultura en especial se cultiva el algodón, la uva, el esparrago, entre otros. Desde pequeño aprendió a trabajar, ya que debido a que sus padres tienen pocos recursos económicos, tenía que trabajar para poder apoyarlos; pero a pesar de las adversidades a logrado salir adelante, tal es así que se encuentra  estudiando en un instituto de Música de su ciudad, ya que a el le encanta Tocar guitarra y es por ello que pone mucho empeño para seguir estudiando lo que más le gusta.

Para poder solventar los gastos de sus estudios, Angel trabaja como obrero en un fundo de su ciudad, el labora alrededor de 8 horas al día y el cree que esta saliendo adelante porque le pone mucho empeño y responsabilidad.

Angel está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá pagar la matrícula y adquirir algunos materiales como pergaminos, cuadernos pentagramáticos, instrumentos, entre otros, asi el podrá tener los materiales necesarios para estudiar poder luchar por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su propia Orquesta y ser un gran músico
texts.en:
Angel is a 20 year old young man who lives in the Santiago district, which is known for its warm climate as well as being agriculturally well developed, particularly in cotton, grapes, asparagus, and others. Since he was a small boy he learned to work, since his parents were of little economic resources and he had to work to support them. Despite the adversities that he has faced he has succeeded in getting ahead. He currently is studying in a music institute in his city, since he likes playing the guitar and this is why he is dedicating the time to continue study. 

To be able to support his study expenses, Angel works as a laborer on an estate in his city. He works around 8 hours per day and he thinks that he is getting ahead because he dedicates a lot of effort and responsibility. 

Angel is very appreciative to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he can pay his university fees and adquire some parchment paper, notebooks, and instruments to be able to continue studying and in this way be able to realize his biggest dream: to have his own orchestra and be a great musician.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and buy school supplies.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un joven de 20 años de edad cuya vivienda se encuentra en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad con un clima muy cálido y con atractivos turísticos muy hermosos. Miguel es padre de un pequeño de 2 años y junto con su pareja se esfuerzan mucho para poder brindarle a su hijo una buena calidad de vida y sobre todo mucho amor.
