They understand that we need to do a better job reducing our impact because they perceive the changes in weather patterns in their region. They are also early adopters of new technologies to improve their farm. As a result, they are investing in a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester. They will use the waste from their pigs and chickens to produce renewable biogas, reducing their LP gas use, and will apply the organic fertilizer generated by the system on their crops. This loan represents 43% of the total cost of Porfiria's Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to perform maintenance on her two mototaxis.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
Don Miguel tiene 62 años de edad, es casado y tiene seis hijos. Desde muy pequeño, se dedica a realizar trabajos agrícolas junto a su padre y hermanos. A los 19 años de edad, se caso y empezó a trabajar por su propia cuenta. Después, se dedico a trabajar con ganado y su esposa e hijos le ayudan. Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, debe viajar a una distancia de tres kilómetros desde su casa hasta el lugar en donde aborda un vehiculo que lo conduce al lugar en donde realiza sus compras. Después, debe de trasladar los insumos hasta el terreno donde tiene sus cultivos, debe pagar un carretero para que se los lleve. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para completar el dinero para comprar dos bueyes. Con la inversión ya no tendrá que pagar para que le trasladen los insumos al terreno sino que él mismo lo hará con sus bueyes. Su deseo, es brindarles el estudio a sus hijos menores y trabajar en compañía de sus hijos mayores.
texts.en:
Miguel is 62 years old, married, and has six children. Since he was very little, he did agricultural work together with his father and brothers. At the age of 19, he got married and began working on his own. Then he worked with livestock and his wife and children helped him. In order to buy agricultural supplies, he must travel a distance of 3 kilometers from his house until reaching a place where he boards a vehicle that takes him to the site where he makes his purchases. After that, he must move the supplies to the field where he has his crops. He has to pay a cart driver to transport them. 

The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to complete the balance of the money needed to buy two oxen. With this investment, he will no longer have to pay for the transport of agricultural supplies to his field, but instead will be able to do it himself with his oxen. His wish to is provide his younger children with an education and work in the company of his older children.

loans.use: to buy two oxen.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Kuña guapa significa mujer trabajadora, y es eso lo que son estas 14 mujeres que forman este grupo, están en su tercer ciclo, y gracias a que todas están ayudándose las unas a las otras es que están saliendo adelante.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Cristina, quien se dedica a la venta de chipas (Alimento típico paraguayo hecho a base de almidón) y cuenta que recorre todos los días muchos kilómetros para poder vender su producto, y que gracias a este trabajo da a su familia un poco de lo que necesitan. Se define a si misma como una persona muy trabajadora, que tiene muchos sueños que quiere cumplir.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar chipas, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir vendiendo y teniendo las ganancias para seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
"Kuña guapa" means hard-working woman, and that is what the four women who make up this group are. They are in their third loan cycle, and thanks to the fact that they are helping one another, they are succeeding. 

One of the members of the group is Cristina, who sells chipas (a traditional Paraguayan treat made from manioc flour). She says that she travels many kilometers a day to be able to sell her product, and that thanks to this work she gives her family a bit of what they need.  She describes herself as a very hard-working person, who has many dreams she wants to fulfill.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy chipas, as that way she will be able to keep selling them and have the earnings to continue helping her family.

loans.use: To buy chipas to sell (chipas are a traditional Paraguayan treat made from manioc flour).

loans.name: Yvrose

texts.en: Yvrose lives in Port Salut, Haiti, about a 5-hour drive from the capital Port-au-Prince. She already has a business selling mobile phones and phone credit. She is now hoping to expand her business by becoming an EarthSpark Clean Energy Entreprenuer. With a Kiva loan, Yvrose will be set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills. A 400 dollar loan will allow her to start selling solar desk lamps and charcoal efficient stoves. She would like to sell EarthSpark products so that the people in her community can benefit from the products and help ameliorate the economic and environmental problems in her country.

loans.use: inventory for a clean energy business

loans.name: Las Guadalupanas Group

texts.es: Doña Socorro tiene 39 años de edad, desde hace mas de 10 años se dedica la cría y venta de pescado (trucha arcoiris) ya que tiene en su casa un estanque donde las cría y las alimenta, dice que llega a medir de 40 a 60 centímetros y llegan a pesar hasta 500 o mas gramos, platica también que les dan un alimento llamado “pellet” el cual está compuesto de harina de pescado, y se les da una o dos veces al día y se venden cuando tienen una edad entre 4 o 5 meses. Dice que es un pez hábil y fuerte,  su carne tiene alto valor nutritivo y es muy higiénica por que no puede vivir en aguas sucias por que se mueren y a donde va a venderlas es en la población de zitácuaro en un estanque que tiene acondicionado en una camioneta. Dice que está pidiendo un crédito ahorita por que quiere comprar alimento y quiere hacer otro estanque para que estén en mejores condiciones. Dice que en el mes que vende mas es en los meses de marzo y abril. Ella espera que con el crédito tenga en mejores condiciones a sus peces. Las otras cuatro integrantes del grupo se llaman Marisol, Remedios, Felipa y Claudia ellas invertirán en artículos para tienda de abarrotes,  para compra y venta de guajolotes.
texts.en:
Socorro is 39 years old.  She has been raising and selling fish (rainbow trout) for over ten years.  She has a pond at her house where she raises and feeds them.  She says that they come to measure 40 to 60 centimeters, and they come to weigh as much as 500 grams or more.  She also says that she gives them food called “pellet”, which is comprised of flour and fish.  She feeds them one or two times a day.  She sells them when they are between four and five months old.  

She says that it is a nice, strong fish, and its meat is very nutritious.  It is also very hygienic because it is not able to live in dirty waters or it will die.  She goes to the town of Zitácuaro to sell them.  She takes them in a tank that she has set up in a truck.

She says that she is requesting the loan now because she wants to buy food.  She also wants to make another pond so that they are in a better environment.  She says she sells the most in the months of March and April.  She hopes that with the loan her fish will have a better environment.

The names of the other four members of the group are Marisol, Remedios, Felipa, and Claudia.  They will use the loan to buy items for a grocery store and to buy and sell turkeys.

loans.use: to buy material to make a fish tank and to buy fish food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Remigia

texts.es:
La Sra. Remigia es de la ciudad de Encarnación, es una persona muy trabajadora, que desde siempre ha trabajo y luchado por sus metas y objetivos.
Es dueña de una despensa en el centro de Encarnación ya hace más de 3 años, y comenta que se ha hecho de muy buen nombre en ese barrio y que gracias a eso ya tiene muy buena clientela. Ella se define a sí misma como una persona que se esfuerza siempre al máximo por lo que quiere.
Remigia solicita de este crédito para la compra de tomates, locotes, cebollas, pollo, arroz, mandioca y demás productos para poder surtir su local y tener buenos productos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo que la ayudará mucho.
texts.en: Remigia is from the city of Encarnación; she’s a very hardworking person who has always worked and striven to reach her goals and objectives.  She owns a grocery store in downtown Encarnación; she’s had it for more than three years and comments that it’s attained good renown in the neighborhood and thanks to that she has a good clientele.  She defines herself as a person who always strives to the maximum to attain what she wants.  Remigia is asking for this loan to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions, chicken, rice, manioc and other products to stock her store and have good products to offer her customers.  She is grateful for this opportunity she’s getting that will help her very much.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions, chicken, rice, manioc and others.

loans.name: Blanca Luz

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer de 49 años, creció en una familia de escasos recursos en la cual consiguió el apoyo para terminar la escuela primaria, trabajó ayudando a sus padres desde muy joven y se casó ilusionada, sin embargo su matrimonio no resultó como ella esperaba por lo que ahora está separada y tiene 3 hijos  que son independientes y cada uno tiene su vida definida. Para Blanca el mayor obstáculo que atravesó fue la separación de su esposo, pues ella tuvo que buscar el sustento para ella y sus hijos en medio del dolor, lo cual fue posible gracias al espíritu emprendedor de ella. Actualmente vive sola en la Parroquia de Bomobolí de Santo Domingo, la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una provincia de Ecuador que en los últimos años ha tenido un alto crecimiento sostenido. Su capital  es una ciudad en donde lo más atractivo y llamativo son sus deliciosas frutas, y la gastronomía que ofrecen en el lugar. También cuenta con un comercio considerable  ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Además cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos que acompañados de su clima cálido son muy concurridos por turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Es por esto que la mayoría de sus habitantes han emprendido con alguna actividad comercial o de servicios para habitantes y turistas.
Blanca se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de manera ambulante desde hace 8 años, actividad que desarrolló gracias a la recomendación de una gran amiga que le acompañó a inscribirse como consultora de belleza. Cada día visita clientes en su mayoría mujeres para asesorarles sobre los productos que necesitan, además paralelamente en su casa tiene algunos pollos que alimenta y cuida para su posterior venta. Blanca está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercadería que pueda vender a precios competitivos a sus clientes, pues si compra mayor cantidad de productos, mayor será el descuento que reciba y además puede tener los productos en stock para atender inmediatamente las solicitudes de sus clientes. Blanca espera que este incremento en sus ingresos pueda mejorar su calidad de vida y así abastecer sus necesidades de salud, alimentación, vestimenta en el futuro. Blanca agradece a Fundación Alternativa por el apoyo que le han brindado ya que para ella no ha sido fácil invertir en su negocio, justamente por la falta de capital.
texts.en:
Blanca’s a 49-year-old woman who grew up in a family of scarce economic resources but that was able to support her schooling through elementary school level.  She worked helping her parents from a very young age and married with much hope.  However, her marriage did not turn out like she expected and she’s now separated.  She has three children who are now independent and each has their life clearly defined.

Blanca’s separation from her husband was the greatest obstacle she’s faced because she had to find a way to support herself and her children amidst the pain which she did thanks to her great entrepreneurial spirit.  She currently lives alone in Bomobolí Parish in Santo Domingo, the capital of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas Province, a province in Ecuador that’s undergone sustained growth in the last few years.  Its capital is a city whose most noteworthy and attractive feature is its delicious fruit and the local cuisine.  It also has considerable commerce because it’s become a land port for commercial exchange between the country’s mountain and coastal regions.  It also has several tourist attractions that accompanied by its warm climate draw many national and foreign tourists.  Because of this, most of its inhabitants carry out activities that are commercial or service oriented for residents and tourists.

Blanca has been working selling cosmetics from place to place for the last 8 years, an activity she developed thanks to a recommendation from a great girlfriend of hers who accompanied her to sign up as a beauty consultant.  She visits her customers, for the most part women, every day to advise them about the products they need.  In addition, she also has chickens at home that she feeds and cares for to sell subsequently.

Blanca is asking for this loan to buy merchandise she can sell at competitive prices to her customers because if she buys them in large amounts the discount she gets will be larger and she can have all the products in stock to fill customer orders immediately.  Blanca hopes that this increase in her income will allow her to improve her quality of life and meet her future health, food and clothing needs.  Blanca thanks Fundación Alternativa for the support they've given her because it’s not been easy for her to invest in her business precisely because of this lack of capital.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to increase sales.

loans.name: Grupo De Amigas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado grupo de Amigas está en su noveno ciclo. Están ayudándose para poder salir adelante. Vieron una gran oportunidad de crecimiento en el programa de la fundación.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Gloria, ella tiene como actividad la venta de zapatos, y siempre esta cargada de mucho trabajo. Se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, ya que siempre tiene buena calidad de calzados y a bajo costo, lo cual le ayuda.
El sueño de Gloria es poder tener una gran tienda de zapatos donde podrá tener todo tipo de ellos y poder ofrecer gran variedad a sus clientes, es en miras a cumplir con su sueño que pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de mas calzados para venderlos, y así estar más cerca de su sueño. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella y sus compañeras de grupo reciben para poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
This group called “Grupo de Amigas” (Group of Girlfriends) is in its 9th cycle.  They are helping each other to move forward.  They saw a great growth opportunity in the Fundación’s program.  

One of the members of the group is Gloria.  Her activity is selling shoes and she always has a lot of work to do.  She’s secured a good clientele because she always has good quality shoes at low cost which is a help.

Gloria’s dream is to be able to have a shoe store to stock all types of shoes and offer a wide variety to her customers.  Aiming at reaching this dream, she’s asking for this loan to buy more shoes to sell and thus be closer to her dream.  She is very grateful for the opportunity she and her fellow members are getting to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona, se encuentran  en el 10º ciclo,  y quieren poder ir hasta el máximo nivel del programa para ir creciendo y aprovechando de las capacitaciones que las ayudan mucho, 
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Pablina ella se dedica a la venta de ropa ambulante, tiene su puesto donde vende todo tipo de prendas y es así como ayuda a su familia dándoles lo que necesitan. Cuenta la Sra. Pablina  que el crédito que solicita a la Fundación lo utilizará para la compra de prendas de todo tipo para volver a vender y así seguir ayudando a su familia como lo viene haciendo. Ella se encuentra  muy agradecida ya que gracias a los ciclos anteriores pudo mejorar sus ingresos y el de su familia.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Encarnación sprouted from the advancements made in the area. They are in their tenth loan cycle and they want to go to the highest level of the program in order to continue growing and taking advantage of the capitations that help them very much. 
One of the members of the group is Pablina who sells clothing as a street vendor. She has her stand where she sells all types of garments and in this way is able to help her family by giving them what they need. Pablina says that the loan that she is requesting from the foundation will be used to buy garments of all types to resell, and in this way, continue helping her family as she has been doing. She is very grateful since, thanks to the previous loans, she manged to increase her income and that of her family's.

loans.use: to buy garments to sell.

loans.name: Enma

texts.es:
Enma tiene 47 años, está casada con Glicer con quien tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 11 años. Ella y su familia viven en una casa alquilada en un distrito rural. La creatividad y la constancia son unas de sus virtudes, por ello Enma se dedica a la confección y tejidos de chompas, gorras, chalinas, ponchos, etc. Todo lo que produce lo ofrece a los turistas nacionales e internacionales que llegan a su distrito, para ello cuenta con un puesto de ventas ubicado en el centro cívico.
Al lado de su esposo realiza ésta actividad, ya que él permanece más tiempo con los telares confeccionando alfombras y tapices. Con este trabajo coordinado, Enma puede brindarles a sus hijos una educación decente y calidad de vida mejor. “Me siento orgullosa porque todo lo que tengo lo obtuve a base de esfuerzo en casi 20 años”, menciona. 
Ahora viaja constantemente hacia la ciudad de Lima, llevando sus productos al por mayor, para esto tuvo que contactarse con personas quienes le hacen pedidos en cada campaña.
Enma requiere de su ayuda para adquirir más mercaderías y continuar en su lucha hacia el emprendimiento. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres al Futuro” y éste es su crédito número 6 con MFP, dice que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas como en ocasiones anteriores. Dice sentirse cómoda trabajando con las socias de su banco comunal porque comparten los mismos intereses.
Enma destinará los 500 soles solicitados en la compra de materiales para elaborar sus tejidos como lanas sintéticas y de ovejas y alpacas, además de otras artesanías para surtir su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Enma, 47, is married to Glicer with whom she has two children who are 18 and 11 years old.  She and her family live in a rented house in a rural district.  Creativity and constancy are some of her virtues which is why Enma works sewing and knitting sweaters, caps, shawls, ponchos, etc.  Everything she makes she sells to national and international tourists that come to her district and to do so she has a stand located in the civic center.

She carries out her activity alongside her husband since he spends more time with the looms making rugs and tapestries.  With this coordinated work, Enma is able to provide her children with a decent education and better quality of life.  “I feel proud because everything I own I’ve gotten as a result of almost 20 years of effort,” she mentions.  Now, she travels constantly to the city of Lima to sell her products at wholesale.  To do so, she had to contact people who place orders every season.

Enma needs your help to acquire more merchandise and continue her struggle toward empowerment.  She belongs to the “Mujeres al Futuro” (Women towards the Future) communal bank and this is her MFP loan #6.  She says she’ll be punctual with her installment payments like she’s been previously.  She says she feels comfortable working with her fellow communal bank members because they share the same interests.

Enma will use the requested 500 soles to buy knitting materials like synthetic wool and alpaca wool in addition to other crafts to stock her sales stand.

loans.use: to buy supplies like synthetic wool and other crafts.

loans.name: Porvenir 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité Porvenir II  es de San Lorenzo, y tiene 15 miembros, que se unieron para ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto de todas.
La Sra. Miguela, es casada tiene 35 años, es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y por sobre todo muy optimista e inculca a sus amigas de su comité a salir adelante. Ella vende remedios yuyos (remedios naturales), y aunque su trabajo sea muy humilde está orgullosa de lo que hace ya que es muy honesto.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de remedios yuyos para poder vender y seguir ayudando a su familia con su digno trabajo.
texts.en:
The “Porvenir II” (Time to Come II) committee is from San Lorenzo and has 15 members who joined together to help their families by means of their teamwork.  Miguela, 35, is married and she’s an enterprising, hardworking woman who above all is very optimistic and encourages her girlfriends in the committee to get ahead.  

She sells ‘yuyo’ remedies (natural remedies) and although her work is very humble she’s proud of what she does because it’s very honest.  She’s requesting this loan to buy yuyo remedies to sell and continue to help her family by means of her proper work.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 33 años esta casada con Edwin con quien tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 9 años. Ella y su familia viven en una casa propia ubicada en un distrito rural.
Silvia es una mujer acogedora y empeñosa. Se dedica a la artesanía hace más de 15 años. 
Ella tiene gran destreza en los tejidos. Desde niña tejía la ropa de sus muñecas, ahora que tiene una responsabilidad familiar, convirtió su pasatiempo como principal medio para adquirir ingresos. Ahora cuenta con telares, con ellos elabora mantas y tapices de diversas lanas. “Es más rentable tejer con lana de alpaca pero también es arriesgado porque se invierte mucho”, menciona.
A la vez, ella y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura, con la producción de maca, cuyas ventas son favorables. Ellos dividen los roles, Silvia en los tejidos y Edwin en los cultivos, así piensan lograr sus objetivos, uno de ellos es terminar de construir su casa. 
Sus metas se enfocan en crecer como empresaria, por ello requiere de su apoyo para adquirir más materiales.
Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres al futuro” y éste es su crédito número 4 con MFP, como en anteriores ocasiones menciona que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Se siente a gusto de trabajar con socias responsables.
Silvia destinará los 1000 soles en la compra de varios kilos de lanas de oveja y alpaca. Así también comprará hilos sintéticos de varios colores.
texts.en:
Silvia, 33, is married to Edwin with whom she has two children who are 14 and 9 years old.  She and her family live in a house of their own in a rural district.  Silvia’s a welcoming and enterprising woman.  She’s been a crafts-person for more than 15 years.

She’s very skilled at knitting.  When she was a little girl she’d knit clothes for dolls and now that she has family responsibility she turned her hobby into her main source of income.  Now, she has looms that she uses to make blankets and tapestries out of different kinds of wool.  “It’s more profitable to knit with alpaca wool but it’s also riskier because one must invest more,” she mentions.

She and her husband also work in agriculture growing ‘maca’ [an Andean root vegetable] which sells well.  They divide roles: Silvia knits and Edwin farms.  They hope to reach their objectives this way and one of them is to finish building their house.  Her goals focus on developing as a businesswoman but to do so she needs your help in order to acquire more materials.

She belongs to the “Mujeres al Futuro” (Women towards the Future) communal bank and this is her MFP loan #4.  Like in previous occasions, she mentions that she’ll be punctual with her installment payments.  She feels good working with responsible members.  Silvia will use the 1,000 soles to buy several kilos of sheep and alpaca wool and will also buy synthetic thread in assorted colors.

loans.use: to buy several kilos of sheep and alpaca wool as well as synthetic thread in assorted colors.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina de 53 años, una madre caracterizada por su amplio espíritu de trabajo comparte una vida conyugal con Amadeo de 57 años con quien tiene el orgullo de tener 5 hijos.
Habitan una vivienda construida a base de Material noble construida de a pocos. Dedicada por muchos años a las actividades agrícolas optó por incursionar en el negocio de la venta de abarrotes con motivo de hallarse cerca de sus hijos quienes la apoyan con las tareas del negocio todo el tiempo.
Al observar la ausencia de este tipo de comercio se inicio con mucho ímpetu cumpliéndose casi 10 años desde su apertura en un ambiente cómodo del primero piso de su vivienda.
Se siente muy contenta por como desempeña su negocio logrando conocer amistades y convirtiéndose en una vecina muy conocida. 
Con motivo de reabastecer su negocio desea adquirir productos de mayor demanda con su compra al por mayor ya que de esta manera espera hallar mejores precios a medida que mantiene su negocio abastecido por un periodo mas prolongado.
Desea a futuro Culminar el segundo piso de su vivienda y posteriormente realizar el alquiler de habitaciones para mejorar su economía familiar. Desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para abastecer su negocio con sacos de arroz, azúcar, conservas de pescado y demás verduras.
texts.en: Marina is a 53-year-old mother with a great work ethic. She lives with her common-law husband Amadeo, with whom she shares the pride of having five children. They live in a home built of of bricks. After working for many years in farming, she opted to go into business selling groceries so that she could be closer to her children, who support her full-time in her business. She noticed that there was a need for such a business ten years ago, and she took a great deal of initiative to get it started. Her store has a comfortable ambiance and is located on the first floor of her home. She is very satisfied since in running her business she has managed to make friends and to become very well-known in the area. She wishes to re-supply her business and buy products at wholesale that are in high demand by her customers. This will allow her to obtain better prices and to keep her business going. In the future she wants to complete the second floor of her home and thus be able to rent out rooms so that she can improve her family's economic conditions. She needs 3,000 nuevos soles in order to supply her business with sacks of flour, rice, sugar and other items.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar, dried fish and other grocery items.

loans.name: Rosalvina

texts.es:
Rosalvina tiene 56 años, comparte actualmente una vida marital con Juan de 53 años , tienen el orgullo de haber instruido a sus hijos por el buen camino y lograr que sean personas de bien.
Es propietaria de una vivienda construida a base de material noble. Dedicada a actividades diversas al igual que su esposo lograron culminar la habilitación de su vivienda en donde actualmente desempeñan su negocio consistente en una tienda de abarrotes.
Llevan casi 9 años de trabajo en conjunto con el cual lograron brindarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad.
Para mejorar sus ingresos optaron por complementar su negocio con el servicio de recargas para celulares.
Se siente contenta con su negocio puesto que pasa casi todo el tiempo al lado de su esposo y juntos pueden así tomar decisiones para beneficio de su economía familiar.
Como el negocio de abarrotes requiere constante abastecimiento e inversión en diversos productos desean adquirir mercadería al por mayor de viveres no perecibles para el cual desean acceder a un crédito con el apoyo de su  entidad financiera.
Sus planes a futuro apuntan a realizar la construcción de su vivienda con la culminación del segundo piso con el objetivo de dedicarse al alquiler de habitaciones. Desean contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería al por mayor como arroz, azúcar entre otros.
texts.en:
Rosalvina, 56, shares her married life with Juan, 53.  They are proud to have led their children along a good path and succeeded in their becoming upstanding citizens.  She owns a house built of substantial materials.  She and her husband carry out a variety of activities and they succeeded in building their home where they currently carry out a sustainable business: a grocery store.  They've been in this business together for almost 9 years and were able through it to provide a quality education for their children.  To improve their income they decided to add mobile phone recharge services to their business.  She feels happy with her business because she spends almost all her time alongside her husband and together they can make decisions that benefit the family economy.

Since the grocery business requires constant resupplying and investing in various products, they want to buy foodstuffs and non-perishable items at wholesale and to do so want to access a loan with help from your financial institution.  Her future plans point towards home construction and the completion of a second story so they can start a room rental business.  They need 1,000 new soles to buy merchandise alike rice and sugar, among others at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like rice and sugar among others at wholesale.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 33 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Él trabaja la agricultura y la ganadería, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos; uno tiene cinco años y el menor un año y medio. Carlos tiene seis años de trabajar con ganado, posee tres vacas las que producen leche y elaboran queso y sus derivados, produce un aproximado de 20 botellas de leche diario. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar tres cerdas embarazadas, medicinas y el concentrado necesario para terminar de crecerlas. En este negocio lleva tres años de experiencia y manifiesta que le deja muy buenas ganancias. Las cerdas las cuida su esposa mientras él se dedica a otras actividades, considera que dentro de unos tres meses esta vendiendo los cerdos. Su próximo, reto es comprar siete cerdos para engordarlos.
texts.en:
Carlos, 33, is married and has two children.  He works in agriculture and animal husbandry.  He lives with his wife and two children; one of them is 5-years-old and the younger one is a year-and-a-half.  Carlos has worked with livestock for six years.  He has three cows that produce milk and he makes cheese and its derivatives; he produces approximately 20 bottles of milk daily.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy three pregnant sows, medicine and feed concentrate needed to finish raising them.  He’s been in this business three years and states that it yields good profits.  His wife will care for the sows while he does other activities.  He believes that in about three months he’ll be selling the pigs.  His next challenge is to buy seven pigs to fatten up.

loans.use: to buy three pregnant sows, medicine and feed.

loans.name: Ton

texts.en:
Ton is one of the few pioneering Mlabri men who have learned how to weave hammocks and he is a remarkably skilled weaver, among his many talents. 

While Mr. Ton was one of the first of the Yellow Leaf people to become comfortable among other groups, he is proud to have stayed among his own tribe and is recognized as a leader within the village. 

He holds a unique position within the Mlabri community- while many Mlabri are shy and reclusive, he is a communications specialist! As a young man, he spent many years working for local Northern Thai villagers and developed an enviable fluency in Thai. He is often a spokesperson and “go-between” for the Mlabri and neighboring communities. 

He has pursued many new opportunities in order to provide for his family, which he believes is an important duty for a husband and father. 

With this loan, he will be able to provide stability and security throughout the coming year.

loans.use: to create a stockpile of hammocks during the off season to ensure a steady flow of income throughout the year.

loans.name: Sukanya

texts.en:
Mrs. Sukanya never expected an easy life.  After all, she was a Mlabri woman, and life was never easy for any Mlabri woman.  Ever.

Born in 1967, Sukanya has lived through heartbreak that most people would find hard to overcome. She was a child during the Mlabri’s painful struggle to adapt from peaceful hunting & gathering to the modern world. Her youth was a time when many of the tribe died of malnourishment and malaria, while the rest were forced into indentured servitude in toxic slash and burn agriculture. 

Sukanya had six children of her own who lived, as well as three who died in infancy.  Her husband left her for another woman and she has faced with courage and resolve the task of raising her children as a single mother.

Hammock weaving made it possible for Sukanya to provide for her family. Weaving hammocks is her primary source of income and the only available work that makes it possible for her children to grow up healthy and educated.   

Sukanya grew up with no schooling; numbers and letters are still strangers to her, though necessity has taught her basic math. She manages to budget her money to keep her family fed and clothed and is intensely interested in her children's education.

Through her Kiva loan, Sukanya will be able to plan a stable annual budget for her family for the first time, ensuring that her children are provided for and that her schedule will allow her to dedicate her energy to work, schooling and family.

loans.use: to pay for yarn and ensure a steady flow of income throughout the year.

loans.name: Santa

texts.es:
Santa de 36 años lleva una vida independiente y de trabajo junto a sus 3 hijos, por quienes apuesta hasta lo imposible.
Reside junto a sus retoños en una vivienda de material noble que logró culminar gracias a su ex compromiso. Al sufrir la separación de su pareja optó por incursionar en diversos empleos logrando hasta hoy desempeñarse como vendedora de carteras y otros afines. Lleva 4 meses con el negocio para el cual encontró en ella una buena capacidad para las ventas.
Se siente muy a gusto con su trabajo ya que de esta manera ha logrado entablar muchas amistades quienes son sus constantes clientas y han demostrado puntualidad en el pago de los productos a crédito que ella ofrece.
Todos los días ofrece sus productos recorriendo la ciudad y visitando constantemente a sus clientas.
A manera de ampliar su stock desea contar con capital y por ello desea acudir a su entidad financiera para adquirir otro lote de carteras.
Todo el trabajo realizado según comenta es para brindarle a sus pequeños una mejor educación para quienes ofrece todo su sacrificio. Desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de un lote de carteras con los modelos mas variados solicitado por sus clientas.
texts.en:
Santa, 36, lives an independent life working.  She will do even the impossible for her three children.  She lives with her children in a house made of substantial building materials that she managed to finish thanks to her ex-spouse.  When she went through her separation from him she decided to start various jobs until the present when she’s a purse and other accessories merchant.  She’s been in this business four months; she discovered a good affinity for sales within herself.  She feels very good with her work because she’s been able to establish many friendships with regular customers who have been punctual with their payments for the products she sells them on credit.  She sells her wares every day throughout the city constantly visiting her customers.

In order to expand her stock she wants to have capital which is why she’s calling on your financial institution to buy another load of pursers.  She comments that all the work she does is aimed at providing her little ones with a better education and all her sacrifice is for them.  She needs 1,000 new soles to buy a load of purses in varied styles requested by her customers.

loans.use: to buy a load of purses in the latest styles.

loans.name: Mamas Solteras Group

texts.es:
El Comite MAMAS SOLTERAS  esta en el segundo ciclo, donde las miembros están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y a ayudarse para poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
La  Sra. Antolina vende Carbon, y cuenta que le esta yendo muy bien en su venta, ya que se esta usando mayormente el carbón que el gas, entonces tiene cada vez mejores ventas.
Antolina a mas de ser una persona muy trabajadora tiene un gran espíritu y quiere salir adelante  y con el credito que solicita tiene la intención de poder comprar carbón en cantidad y proveer a sus vecinos que tienen despensas para re vender y asi ella crecer mas en  su negocio y superarse a si misma.
texts.en:
The committee MAMAS SOLTERAS (Single Mothers) is in its second cycle.  The members are learning to work together and help each other to get ahead and help their families.

Antolina sells coal, and she says that her sales are going very well.  Since coal is being used more than gas, she has more and more sales.  In addition to being a very hardworking person, Antolina has a great spirit and wants to get ahead.  With the loan she is requesting she plans to be able to buy coal in quantity and offer it to her neighbors who have storage for it and thus grow her business and outdo herself.

loans.use: to buy coal to sell.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame is married and has one child. She has no formal education. Maame sells provisions and cooking ingredients in Bremawg near Abura, which she has done for some time now. Maame uses her income to pay for her child’s school fees and to help support her husband with their family’s utility bills. Maame will use the loan to purchase more provisions and food ingredients for sale. With the profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to grow and improve her provision and food supply shop.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions and food ingredients for sale.

loans.name: Pamela Janet

texts.es:
Janet es una joven de 20 años de edad, la cual vive en la ciudad de Nazca, caracterizada por su clima cálido y por sus atractivos turísticos, entre los cuales uno de los más visitados son las líneas de Nazca. Janet ha pasado por muchas adversidades, pero a pesar de ello sigue adelante; debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de contabilidad.
Con mucho esfuerzo Pamela trabaja en un hotel de su ciudad como empleada, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos del día a día; ella cree que está saliendo adelante debido a sus ganas de surgir y sobre todo su responsabilidad.

Janet está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería como polos, short, bivirís, entre otras prendas de verano ya que tiene algunos pedidos de sus clientes; de esta manera ella podrá tener un ingreso extra y podrá mejorar cada día y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un local propio”.
texts.en:
Janet is a young woman, 20 years old, who lives in the city of Nazca which is characterized by its warm climate and tourist attractions, among which the most visited are the Nazca Lines. Janet has overcome much adversity, but in spite of that she keeps moving forward; Due to her few economic resources she could only study until the fifth grade of secondary school, but she would have liked to study the major of accounting.

Pamela works with much effort in a hotel in her city as an employee. She works around eight hours a day and with the earnings from her work she is able to cover her day-to-day expenses. She believes she is moving forward due to her desire to come up and above all her responsibility.

Janet is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help they offer her, she will be able to purchase merchandise, such as shirts, shorts, tank tops and other summer clothing, since she already has some orders from her clients. In this way she will be able to have some extra income and she can improve each day and continue fighting to be able to make her biggest dream a reality: to have a shop of her own.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (shorts, shirts, tank tops, and other things)

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and for the family's personal, household and business expenditures. Marilyn and her husband are working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marilyn would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better as more items to sell will result in better profit. Marilyn's profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. Marilyn looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marilyn hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda previously accessed a 33,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more dried fish to expand her business inventory. Her earnings were a big help for her children's education and for the family's personal, household and business expenditures. Hilda and her husband are working hand in hand to continuously provide for their everyday expenses.

Hilda would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan to buy more dried fish needed for the expansion of her business. Her business profits will definitely help Hilda to sustain the family's daily needs and her children's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Hilda dreams of expanding her business and of having other businesses. She hopes that all her children will finish their studies. Hilda faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more dried fish to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair and do general maintenance on his vehicle

loans.name: Sincerlita

texts.en:
This is Sincerlita. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. With the help of her children, she is managing their household as she works hard to continuously provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Sincerlita dreams of expanding her business and branching out to other areas. She dreams of having a prosperous life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase increased quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings are a big help in paying for her child’s education, as well as in her family's personal, household and business expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. Her variety store is growing as she is increasing her inventory.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better, as this will result in increased profits. The profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and the education expenses for her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Alma hopes to expand her business. She dreams of being successful in life and of living a peaceful life. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Florenia

texts.en:
This is Florenia. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase scrap materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with their personal, household and business expenditures. She is thankful for her loved ones who help her with her everyday expenses as she also works hard for her business to continuously grow.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan in her current revolving fund used to buy scrap and recyclable materials. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Florenia dreams of being able to help her relatives and dreams that her business will grow more in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of their work. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more recyclable trash to process and sell to manufacturers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the first month's working expenses and payroll for his insurance business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, gracias  a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Luis pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Mecánica Automotriz, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Frejoles con Seco para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luis trabaja como mecánico en una empresa textil de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción y podrá cubrir los gastos de la mano de obra, ya que desea realizar el tarrajeo y pintado de una habitación en su hogar, de esta manea el podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su gran sueño de tener su taller de mecánica.
texts.en:
Luis, 22, is single and lives with his parents and siblings in the city of Chincha. He is very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic, and has a great desire to better himself. Thanks to his efforts and the support of his parents, Luis was able to study Auto Mechanics at technical school. In his free time he likes to listen to music, and sometimes he cooks Frejoles con Seco [beans with meat] to share with his family.

At his own initiative, and with much dedication, Luis works as a mechanic in a textile factory in his city. He works every day from very early in the morning, working about 8 hours a day. He is happy doing his work and believes that it's going well because of his performance and his friendliness with his coworkers.

Luis is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he has been able to buy construction materials and cover the costs of labor. He wants to plaster and paint a wall, which will provide greater security and well-being for his family. He will continue working and making an effort to get ahead and achieve his dream of having his own mechanic's workshop.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Jose Heliodoro

texts.es: Don José Heliodoro un señor de avanzada edad, se gana la vida  vendiendo leña, hielo y helados en su casa, también se ayuda con los trabajos de albañil que a veces se le presenta la oportunidad,  con diferentes trabajos ha sacado adelante a su único hijo con sus estudios, ropa y alimentación siempre contando con el apoyo de su esposa, es pastor de una iglesia evangélica, el está optando por un doceavo crédito para infraestructura, terminar de hacer dos cuartos que ya había empezado el cual todavía le falta la mayor parte como paredes, piso, ventanas, techo y para eso necesita comprar más cemento, arena, bloques, laminas de zinc y a empezar la obra por él mismo aprovechando sus conocimientos y siendo esto posible gracias a los financiamientos por el cual está muy contento de poder seguir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en: Jose Heliodoro, an elderly man, makes his living selling firewood, ice and ice cream out of his home. He also helps with masonry work when the opportunity presents itself. With his different jobs he has helped his only son with his studies, clothing and food, always counting on the support of his wife, the pastor of an evangelical church. This is his 12th loan for infrastructure. He will finish 2 rooms that he has already started but which lack walls, floors, windows and roofing. In order to do this he needs to buy more cement, sand, cinder block, tin sheeting, and to begin the work himself, taking advantage of his knowledge. This is made possible thanks to the loans, which make him very happy to be able to continue improving his house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, cinder blocks and tin sheeting for rooms.

loans.name: Ghabi

texts.en: Ghabi is a 26-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife. He wishes to have a big family with children but before that, he’s looking to improve his status financially. He is the main income provider of the family and works very hard to be able to handle the heavy living expenses. He works as a topographer. He is well known in his town and has gained a fair number of clients so far. And to better develop his business, he’s looking today to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renovate his office so that he can take more projects and work in a good place and atmosphere. This will definitely allow him to achieve his work competently and be able to present good quality services to the clients.  He works on a freelance basis and hopes to take bigger projects and increase his earning in the near future.

loans.use: to renovate his office

loans.name: Taha

texts.en: Taha is a 24-year-old Lebanese man. He’s single and living with his parents. He combines forces with his father to be able to cover their expenses. He’s a great man who loves his family and really cares to offer them a proper life. He works nonstop, on his own. He has been working as a plumber for five years. He’s an honest man and above all punctual, which make his customers loyal to him. Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added plumbing tools for his business. This Kiva loan will facilitate his business operations and allow him to start his new project properly. Life is hard for people like Taha; this is why he needs to work nonstop so that he can build his own future and at the same time offer his parents a good way of living.

loans.use: to purchase plumbing tools for his business

loans.name: Batool's Group

texts.en:
Batool is a 52-year-old decent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. She has been running a clothing business for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the market and sells them in her community. 

Batool is interested in purchasing a variety of warm clothes, like gloves, sweaters, coats, mufflers, etc., but due to financial constraints she finds it difficult. For that she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will help her to grow her business.

She dreams of providing a successful future for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

Note: In the picture, Batool is raising her hand.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of warm clothes, like gloves, sweaters, coats, mufflers, etc. for her clothing business

loans.name: Shoukat Ali

texts.en:
Shoukat is a very hardworking and active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. His wife is a responsible housewife and all of his children are students. Since 2002 he has been running a barber shop, which is the only source of income for the family. Currently he needs to purchase products for his shop but finds it difficult due to a lack of finances. 

Shoukat has requested a loan of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase one chair, mirrors, and some cosmetic products for his barber shop.

He wishes to provide quality education for his children. He is very much thankful to all the staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase one chair, mirrors, and some cosmetic products for his barber shop.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en:
Sharif is a 39-year-old married man. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. His wife is a very hardworking and responsible housewife. 

Since 1992, Sharif has been in the business of selling milk, which is the only source of income for the family.
 
Currently he is interested in purchasing one buffalo to grow his business but finds it difficult due to financial constrains. Sharif has requested a loan amount of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his milk selling business but will increase his net income and savings as well.

He hopes to provide quality education for his children. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase one buffalo for his milk selling business.

loans.name: Sally Group

texts.en:
Gregoria is the featured borrower for Sally's group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends since they came from the Philippines to work in Lebanon. She is seated on the right. She works as a house keeper like almost all of the Philippine citizens working in Lebanon.

Gregoria is a 53-year-old widow and mother of four. She is working hard to provide her family with a good and healthy living. Her own aim is to provide them with everything they might need and hopes that she can always be a good support for them.

Gregoria is applying for her fourth cycle loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in  order to send the money to her family in the Philippines to help with their expenses. She hopes that one day she can go back home and start her own business and enjoy living with her family.

Nilda is the second one from the right, 56-year-old married woman. This is her fourth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. She is also a house keeper and wants to send the money to help her husband in the Philippines to start a new business of their own.

Tita is a 49-year-old married woman and mother of two children. She also works as a house keeper and wants to send money to her children to cover their needs. She is the second one from the left.

Rosalina is is a 52-year-old married woman, she sells clothes in her shop, which is a very good turning point in her life since she used to work as a housekeeper.  She is willing to keep improving her business to improve her living and increasing her income. Rosalina wants to invest her fourth cycle loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in buying  a new winter collection to attract new customers. She hopes to move back home and open her own business selling women''s clothes.

All of these women hope to be financially capable and one day go back to the Philippine and start their own businesses.

loans.use: to help with her family's expenses.

loans.name: Fredi Livia

texts.es:
Fredi es una mujer de 52 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Guadalupe con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo, quien trabaja en el rubro de la construcción dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia;  lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Fredi no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería, en sus ratos libres le gusta televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Fredi trabaja brindando servicios de transporte,  ella cuenta con un pequeño auto, en el cual hace colectivo desde su distrito hasta el centro de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, Fredi se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Fredi se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción y el mantenimiento general de su vehículo, de esta manera Fredi tendrá su herramienta de trabajo en mejores condiciones, así pues Fredi seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de adquirir otros autos y con ello desea iniciar su propia empresa de transporte.
texts.en:
Fredi is a 52-year-old woman who lives in the city of Chiclayo, in the district of Guadalupe, with her husband and their four children who she loves and who are her principal cause in life. She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who, along with her husband, works in the construction sector and dedicates all her effort to moving her family forward. 

Regrettably, due to a lack of economic resources and the need to work, Fredi could not study the professional major of Nursing. In her free time she likes television and on some occasions she cooks delicious noodles to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with much dedication and determination, Fredi works offering transportation services. She has a small car in which she buses people from her district to the center of her city. She works every day starting in the early hours of the morning and she can work for approximately ten hours.

Fredi feels happy doing her work and she believes it is going well for her because of the good treatment she offers her clients. Fredi is very thankful for the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they offer she will be able to make repairs and do general maintenance to her car. In this way, Fredi will be able to have her working tool in better condition. Thus Fredi will continue working and striving to achieve her great dream to acquire more cars, and with them she hopes to start her own transportation business.

loans.use: to make repairs and generally maintain her vehicle

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
This is Almira. Her previous loan was a big help to her business. She was able to start new businesses like selling electronic load, dried fish and other retail products. She and her husband are continuously working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more onions and garlic. She will also use the loan to buy dried fish, assorted candies and electronic load supply for her new business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Almira hopes to give her children a good and quality education. She dreams that her business will grow even more. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of garlic and onions needed in her business

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
This is Ma. Theresa. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Ma. Theresa hopes to expand her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en: Mr. Ganbat, 48 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife began her work as a manager in June 2012 at a private business entity. His daughter studies at a medical college and this summer will graduate. She has a part-time job at a private hospital. Mr. Ganbat was employed as a driver initially by a particular company in 2012 and now works as head of the maintenance department. Before working on a full-time basis, he was running an automobile repair service. In 2009, his wife’s brother gave them a house and he has rented it to others since that time. Currently, the family lives in his close friend’s backyard and wants to move to their own house. The house, which was given by his wife’s brother, has deteriorated over the years and hasn’t received any repair for at least four years. So he is requesting a loan of 2,800,000 MNT to install a  vacuum door, windows, and a ceiling and to repair the bathroom. As a result, the family can live in a comfortable place, which will motivate their hard work. Most importantly, the vacuum door and windows are an effective barrier for the upcoming strong storm and frost, enabling the house to keep its warmth versus the economic impact on coal consumption by the family. The family will burn less coal, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to install a vacuum door, windows, ceiling etc

loans.name: Mandkhai

texts.en: Mrs. Mandkhai, 31 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an apartment and her son attends kindergarten. Her husband’s job is dependent on seasonal variation. She teaches contortion at her rented local apartment. Before teaching contortion, she was a contortionist at a circus and after getting a backbone injury, she quit being a contortionist. One of her future goals is to obtain her own contortion hall. This young couple wants to improve their living environment by purchasing furniture for their home. So she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase a table, sofa, chair, drawers, closet, etc. As a result, the family can live in a comfortable place and can work with full enthusiasm.

loans.use: to purchase furniture

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This is Imelda, She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. Her business continues to grow as she and her husband work hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Imelda hopes to expand her business and dreams of giving her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Bayanzul

texts.en: Mr. Bayanzul, 29 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife holds a position of teller at a private bank. His daughter, five years old, goes to kindergarten. He runs an automobile sales business. He purchases old automobiles at low prices and later sells them to customers at high prices. He has been running this business for almost five years and accumulated a vast amount of experience in the sales of automobiles. This young couple wants to improve their living environment by purchasing furniture for their home. So he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase a table, chairs, sofa, drawers, etc. As a result, the family can live in a comfortable place and can work enthusiastically. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who is striving for a better life and believes only hard work can make his dream come true.

loans.use: to purchase furniture

loans.name: Ni Nyoman

texts.en:
Ni Nyoman, 45, lives only with her children. Her husband works overseas as a pig breeder. Her older child lives in the city, as a student in university. Her house has a beautiful view, because it’s located in the center of a rice field.

Ni Nyoman is a farmer who has farmland behind her house. In her farm there are coconuts, bananas and cacao. The produce of the farm provides for the children's education, the family's household needs and savings. Ni Nyoman has raised pigs at home since her husband began to work overseas. Her husband taught her how to maintain pigs like in his workplace. They already have considerable experience in raising pigs, and have gotten satisfactory results.

The waste generated by the farm, in the form of pig manure, is a constraint on the growth of the business. Ni Nyoman has taken the manure to the fields to use as fertilizer, but that was not enough to cope with the amount of the waste. When she heard about the biogas digester program, she joined immediately. Ni Nyoman is using her loan to construct and install a biogas digester, which will convert the waste into fuel (biogas) and organic fertilizer. This will reduce costs in the kitchen, and pollution of the environment can be overcome. Ni Nyoman also hopes to become an example for the people in her village, teaching the importance of using biogas for life.

loans.use: To build a biogas digester, for converting pig waste into fuel for cooking, plus fertilizer for the crops.

loans.name: Lundaajantsan

texts.en:
Mr. Lundaajantsan, 56, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running a second-hand clothes business for eight consecutive years and accumulated a vast amount of experience in this type of business. He has permanent customers and suppliers, and his business is very stable with no fear of bankruptcy. 

Besides his business, he also works as a gatekeeper at private business entity. His elder son lives separately from his parents and works as an engineer at an electricity and heating station. His younger son studies at high school, and his wife is a consultant at one of branches of the widely known Swedish Oriflame cosmetics business. 

Lundaajaltsan has borrowed money from our organization eight times and repaid every debt on time without delay, and he is one of the trustworthy clients. This time he is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to increase his circulation assets by purchasing second-hand clothes in large amounts. As a result, he can generate more income for his family. One of his objectives is to help his son to purchase an apartment. He is a very hardworking individual who has strong willpower.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Belleza

texts.en:
This is Belleza. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. Her tricycle business is still operating, and she now has a food stall. She and her partner are working hard to continuously provide income for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan for her to buy raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Belleza dreams to have a variety store and a welding shop. She hopes to have strength and good health. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en: Mr. Myagmarsuren is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a ger in Uvs province in Mongolia. His wife, Narangarav, works as a guard in a private agriculture company. His two sons Togtohbayar, age four, and Tortogtoh, age three, go to a local kindergarten. The borrower has been working as a private driver for a private company director for years and now he is planning to start his own taxi service business in town. He is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly electric- and gas-consuming car to provide a taxi service business in town. He is a hardworking and responsible person.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming taxi

loans.name: Naran

texts.en: Mrs. Naran is 45 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a small house in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband Luvsansugar, age 45, works at a local market. Her daughter Monhtsatsral, age 20, studies in the university and her younger daughter Monh-Uchral, age 5, goes to a local kindergarten. The borrower has been running a clothes retail business in a local big market for years. She imports inventory from China and brings the inventory from the railway station to the market by taxi or other transportation. She is now requesting 5,040,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly electric- and gas-consuming car in order to reduce her transportation expense and increase efficiency in her business. She is a hardworking, clever and honest woman.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly electric- and gas-consuming car

loans.name: Monh-Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Monh-Altantsetseg is 40 years old and lives with her husband, three children and her mother in a Ger (Mongolian housing tent) in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her husband, Batbayar, age 39, works at local private company as a guardsman. Her children Narantsetseg, age 16; Anhtsetseg, age 13; and Altangerel, age 12, are local secondary school students. Her mother is retired and stays at home. 

She has been running a charcoal and firewood retail business in the local market since 2010. She is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase a large amount of charcoal and firewood to sell at retail prices in the local market. She is a hardworking, optimistic and welcoming woman who says, "My three children are soon to be university students, and I need [to] save money to pay their university tuition fees."

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of charcoal and firewood to sell at retail prices in the local market.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Narantsetseg is 46 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger in Hentii province, Mongolia. Her husband Zorigtbaatar, age 47, runs a taxi service business in town. Her children Nandin-Od, age 25 and Altan-Od, age 23 have just graduated from their university and now are looking for job. Her younger daughter Odmaa, age 14 studies in a local secondary school. The borrower has been running a business buying recyclable materials from households and selling it to recycling companies at a little higher price. She is now requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of recyclable materials from households to sell to recycling companies. She is a hardworking, open-minded and modest woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of recyclable materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a buffalo

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 44 years old and married with three children.

Mary Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like soap, sardines, diapers, biscuits and other groceries needed in her business.

Mary Ann has borrowed and paid 33 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and earns additional income from load retailing, running a restaurant and farming sugarcane.

Mary Ann aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like soap, sardines, diapers, biscuits and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Bora Group

texts.fr: La cliente Eliza  est entrepreneur dynamique, membre du groupe d’affaire bora, âgée d’environ 57 ans, veuve, mère de 4 enfants parmi les quels certains ont leurs propres foyers. La cliente est vendeuse des habits (pagnes). Elle s’installe au marché central de Virunga. Elle démarra son activité avec un fonds propre reçu de sa fille aînée. Il y a plus 12 ans, elle est en activité. Ce nouveau prêt doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec des nouvelles marchandises (6 doubles des pagnes). En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, passer le reste de sa vie en paix. La cliente salut chaleureusement  l’initiative du programme de microcrédit de Hekima pour ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes non bancables.
texts.en: Eliza is a dynamic entrepreneur and a member of the business group Bora. She is around 57 years old, a widow, and the mother of 4 children, some of whom have their own households. The customer sells clothes (pagnes, highly colourful and decorative West African clothing). She sets up her merchandise at the Virunga central market. She started her business with her own funds, received from her eldest daughter and has been in business for over 12 years. This new loan will allow her to buy new merchandise (6 sets of pagnes). She also aims to increase her business and to spend the rest of her life in peace. The customer warmly pays tribute to the initiative of the Hekima microcredit program and its actions dedicated to poor, non-bankable women.

loans.use: to buy 6 sets of pagnes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
